loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de gravier,  Adjo femme de 49 ans et maman de 02 enfants a démarré en 1993. Elle  achète dans les carrières de gravier et revend au bord des rails à Baguida. Son mari est chauffeur et elle veut l’aider  dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en: Reseller of gravel, Adjo is a 49 year old woman and mother of 2 children who started her business in 1993.  She buys at the gravel pits and resells along the Baguida tracks.  Her husband is a driver and she wants to help him pay their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy gravel.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace makes cassava dough to sell (as seen in the photo). Cassava dough is used in preparing banku and is made from a starchy root vegetable called cassava. Grace has received a senior high school level educational background.  She is married and has one child. She responsibly supports her husband to provide the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to process into dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to process into dough for sale.

loans.name: Mwagaro

texts.en:
Mwagaro is a married man with 5 children, 3 of whom attend school and 2 of whom have graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a wheat flour selling business from home. He sells to his neighbours and passersby. His major challenge is seasonality. During dry season the availability of products is low compared to cold winter season where the availability of products is high. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells food items like plantain, cassava, banana and boiled groundnuts (peanuts) at Elmina. In the photo she is showing boiled groundnuts. She is married and her spouse is a tailor. She supports her spouse to provide her four children's basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy more food items such as groundnuts, etc. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more food items such as groundnuts (peanuts), etc.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 35 years old, married to Joyce and a father of three school-going children aged 15 years, 11 years and seven years. He has owned a garage where he does mechanical work on cars for the past 13 years and earns an income of KES 30,000 per month.

This is Gerald's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy spares parts, oils, and machines for the business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and ensure improved services from his garage.

In future he hopes to grow his business and own a big garage in the city.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, oils and machines for mechanic work

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells polo (a local dish) and sugar cane at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her partner is a farmer. She has been in this trade for six years. She supports her husband to provide her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare polo for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare polo (a local dish) for sale.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: As shown in the photo, Mabel sells different types of cloth, slippers, etc. at Elmina. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is into carpentry. She has been selling cloth, slippers, etc. for five years. She assists her husband in the payment of household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид житель Шахритуского района. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. В этой области Саид уже более 6 лет.
texts.en: Said lives in Shahrituz. He is 49 years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a housewife. Two of his sons are working in Russia. He makes a living by raising cattle. He fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase their numbers.  Said has been doing this for more than six years.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: One Word Iii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Word III” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu. Isatu is age 20; she was born in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu currently resides in Kabala town together with her husband and one child. Isatu sells salt, fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, rice, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. With her share of this loan, Isatu is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, fish, margi, tomatoes, rice, sugar, etc. in bulk for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has six children. She sells jewelry and fante kenkey (a foodstuff made from fermented maize dough) at Elmina. Her husband is a sprayer. Efua assists her husband with the income she makes from her sales by providing food for the family. The loan when received will be invested into the fante kenkey business by buying more bags of maize. Her future plan is to build a restaurant. Close to Efua in the photo are some dried plantain leaves for the kenkey. In the bowl of water is the soaked maize that will be milled into dough.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to produce fante kenkey.

loans.name: Zakya

texts.en:
Zakya, a 43-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon, is married and has four children. The operator of a shoe store since 2007, she has developed a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, and professional contacts. Zakya is extremely proud of her work and believes that it is her experience that has helped her succeed.

She learned about Al Majmoua through the local loan officer and has proven to be a good standing borrower and a smart businesswoman. Now requesting her second loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Zakya is planning to purchase a collection of new shoes and in the future hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, materials and tools

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 32 года.Он женат. Имеет троих детей. Более семи лет он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для покупки коровы. Баходур хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in A. Jomi. He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than seven years.  He raises cattle at home. He primarily breeds cattle for sale. He is taking out a loan to buy cows. Bahodur wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 47 years old married man and the father of four children.  For the past five years, he has been working at a grocery store.  Fawaz is well-known in his region and is liked by most of his customers because he has good taste, chooses the best quality products and he also provides perfect customer service.

Fawaz is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-KIVA partner to buy summer commodities (ice cream, juice, other items) and to help his son in his house construction.  Fawaz is a special father who works hard for the sake of his children, in order to provide everything they need.

In the future, Fawaz hopes to expand his business in order to fulfill his customer needs.

loans.use: To buy summer commodities

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Diala

texts.en:
Diala is 23 years old, married, has one child and lives in Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is the oldest daughter in a family with five children. When she was growing up, her mother did not work outside of their home, but had a reputation in her community as an excellent cook. Diala remembers waking up early in the morning before school and bathing and grooming her younger sisters, all the while being drawn to the kitchen by the smell of the fresh falafel, beans and warm bread with hot tea that her mother would prepare for breakfast. Though her family survived on the small income that her father made as a spice peddler, Diala remembers how her mother kept their door open to her neighbors and friends, who knew they could always stop by for a warm welcome and a hot meal.

Diala learned the art of food preparation from her mother, along with her commitment to share their food and homes with people in their community. Diala is also developing a home-based business where she makes pastries to sell. She is applying for a loan for 400 JOD to buy an automatic oven and equipment to start making pickles. Her goal is to increase her income and eventually open a pastry shop. She would also like to earn enough money to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy an automatic oven and equipment to start making pickles.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells gari, kenkey and fish at Elmina.  In the picture, her right hand is in the corn dough she would be using for the kenkey.  She is married and blessed with four wonderful children.  Her husband is into fitting.  This business has been in existence for 4 years. 

As part of her responsibilities she supports her husband by providing the basic needs of her family.  Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize and fresh fish to fry for sale.  She wishes to use the new profits from her business to acquire a shop.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of maize and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Saidakbar

texts.ru: Саидакбар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Саидакбар занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. То есть он покупает несколько телят, откармливает, а потом продает по более высокой цене. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки одного теленка.
texts.en: Saidakbar lives in A. Jomi. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Saidakbar works in animal husbandry. He fattens and sells cattle. He buys some calves, fattens them, and then sells them for a higher price. He has been doing this for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy one calf.

loans.use: to buy one calf.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is showing the Fante kenkey she makes from corn at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.  Her husband is a farmer.  They have 5 dependants. 

As part of her marital responsibilities she cooks, and pays utility bills.  A loan of 200 GHS will help to buy two bags of maize to prepare Fante keykey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize to prepare Fante keykey for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells children's wear, bread and cooking utensils at Elmina.  Sarah has received senior high school education.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband is a teacher. 

Sarah has been selling children's wear, bread and cooking utensils for 10 years.  She assists her spouse in the payment of household expenses and school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy more cooking utensils to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells food stuffs, fruits and popcorn at Elmina.  Cecilia has received senior high school education.  She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a driver. 

She supports her husband by providing the basic needs of her family.  Her loan will be used to buy fruits to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been through senior high school. Mary sells body and hair creams, hair extensions, gari (cassava flakes), Milo (a chocolate and malt drink mix), sugar and fish at Elmina, which she has done for 5 years. Mary assists her husband in the payment of household expenses.

She will use the loan to purchase more Milo, sugar, fish and other things to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to trade in food items. At the time of visiting, she was yet to go to the market for goods.

loans.use: to purchase more Milo, sugar, fish and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to cook for resale

loans.name: Tagoykhon

texts.ru: Тагойхон житель района А. Джоми. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его сын находится в России. Сам он занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. У него среднее образование. При доме он имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кроме того он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Тагойхон занимается 18 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Tagoykhon lives in A. Jomi.  He is 44 years old, married, and has four children. His son is in Russia. He works in farming and in animal husbandry.  He has a secondary education. He has a plot of land at home where he grows vegetables. He also raises cattle at home. Tagoykhon has been doing this work for eighteen years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
The picture above depicts Diana with some foodstuffs like plantain, cassava, palm fruits and banana. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is 4 years old. Her husband is a trader.

Diana uses her income to assists her husband in the payment of household expenses and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has 2 children. She sells rice, tomatoes, groundnut and salted fish at Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua assists her husband in the payment of school fees.

She will use the loan to purchase additional salted fish to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional salted fish to sell

loans.name: Chehab

texts.en:
Chehab is a 46-year-old married man and has four children. He has been working in transportation for 25 years. Chehab transports several things, depending on the customer's destination; he might transport vegetables, furniture and many other things.

His customers include friends and other community members who have come to know him through his work over the past twenty-five years.  He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua (a Kiva partner) for the third time in order to fix his pickup and to pay for his mother's urgent medical surgery. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business.

He's known for his strict appointments and the quality of work provided. Chehab hopes to stay capable of helping his family members and providing a healthy living for his family. He also hopes to expand his business through buying an additional pickup to reply to all requested transports.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his pickup and pay for his mother's urgent medical surgery

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is standing by the food she cooks to sell. She cooks rice and serves it with tomato sauce, boiled eggs, macaroni, fish and meat in Besease, a village in Elmina. 

Her husband is a teacher and they have been together for nine years. Justine supports her spouse to provide for the needs of her family. Justine will use the loan to buy food items to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justine plans to save to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been practicing farming in Narok for the last five years. He is 28 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.

He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Matanyaroh Ii Group

texts.en:
Nbalu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Nbalu was born in northern Sierra Leone 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five children. For 20 years now, Nbalu has been selling market food: palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, rice, salt, vegetables, etc. 

Together, Nbalu and her group members are seeking a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leone (SLL) from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

With her share of the loan, Nbalu is going to buy the above-mentioned foodstuffs in large quantities to add to her business stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, fish, rice, salt, vegetables, etc. in large quantities to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Marat

texts.ru:
Марату 40 лет и он проживает селе Цав, Сьюникского региона. Марат женат, имеет двух сыновей: старшему 12 лет, младшему 11. 
Сельским хозяйством Марат занимается более 10 лет. На своей ферме разводит крупный рогатый скот, свиней и пчел; выращивает картофель и фасоль. Сельскохозяйственные продукты (говядину, свинину, молоко, мед, картофель и фасоль) реализует в магазинах и лавках городаов Капан и Каджаран. Жена Марата помогает ему на ферме и таким образом они содержат свою семью.
Сумма кредита в 1.000.000 драм необходима Марату для организации уборки сена, приобретения нескольких ульев, рамок для меда и парафина.
texts.en:
Marat is 40 years old, and he lives in the village of Tsav in the Syuniksky region. Marat is married.  He has two sons, an eleven-year-old and a twelve-year-old.  
 
Marat has been working in agriculture for more than ten years. On his farm he raises cattle, pigs, and bees.  He grows potatoes and string beans. His produce (beef, pork, milk, honey, potatoes and string beans) are sold in shops and booths in the cities of  Kapan and Kadzharan. Marat's wife helps him on the farm, and thus they support the family.

Marat needs to take out a loan for 1,000,000 drams to harvest hay and to acquire several beehives and frames for honey and beeswax.

loans.use: to harvest hay and to acquire several beehives and frames for honey and beeswax.

loans.name: Musanka

texts.en:
Musanka has been practicing mixed farming in Narok-kenya for the last six years. He is 37 years old, married and supports seven people in his family.

Musanka is applying for his second loan. He has been a good client and has repaid his previous loan well. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kholbozor

texts.ru: Холбозор проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 41 год. Он женат. Имеет 6 детей. Образование у него среднее. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи, сеет пшеницу и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для повторного посева после сбора урожая пшеницы. То есть Холбозор хочет посеять овощи и кукурузу.
texts.en: Kholbozor lives in Yavan. He is 41 years old, married, and has six children. He has a high school education.  He is a farmer. He primarily grows vegetables, wheat, and fruit trees. He has been doing this for fifteen years.  He is taking out a loan to sow a second crop after the wheat harvest.  Kholbozorr would like to sow vegetables and corn.

loans.use: to sew a second crop after the wheat harvest

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rodah is a 59 year-old married lady. She owns a retail shop in Kilifi. Her business has been in operation for the last 10 years. Rodah is a KADET client and this marks her third borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase corn flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and margarine to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Rodah's dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and margarine

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old single man living in Tyre. He has been working as fruit-and-vegetable dealer for 11 years. He worked hard to open his business and improve it over this period. His customers include fruit-and-vegetable retail dealers in addition to friends and other community members. 

Hasan is an honest man with a good reputation and good customer service.

Hasan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to enlarge and improve his business through buying vegetables and fruits with special prices; through its income, Hasan will be capable of paying for the rest of his house.

Hasan hopes to expand and succeed more in his business. He hopes to make a small, happy family of his own, too.

loans.use: to expand his business through buying more products with special prices.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur est un mécanicien marié polygamme et pére de 9 enfants; Sa fille ainée est éléve au Lycée alors que 2 de ses freres sont au college; quatres autres de ses enfants fréquentent l'école primaire. Le dernier né a 2 ans. Il tient un atelier de réparation mécanique dans sa localité non loin de la capitale. Il dépense 180 000f par mois pour nourrir ses femmes et ses enfants et aussi sa tante qui vit lui avec dans la maison familliale. Il paie les frais de scolarité des enfants(inscriptions, fournitures, habillement,transport)pour un montant de 280 000f. Cette année, il a été obligé de vendre un moteur destiné à son véhicule pour supporter ces frais. Il assure aussi les charges sanitaires de la famille. 
L'emprunteur est sociétaire de IMCEC depuis deux ans mais n' a jamais sollicité de prets. Il demande actuellement un crédit de  300 000 f pour réparer son taxi de transport urbain en achetant 4 portes , 1 capot, 2 ailes avant, 1 male arriere. Il veut en meme temps refaire la tolerie et la peinture pour rendre le taxi plus attractif aux clients. Cela lui permettra de faire face à la forte concurrence.
Son ambition est d'acheter d'autres véhicules de transport, de moderniser son atelier mécanique et d'y vendre des pieces de rechange.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married mechanic, polygamous and father of nine children. His eldest daughter is a student at the lycee while her brothers are in middle school. Four other children are enrolled in primary school. The last-born is two years old. 

The borrower has an auto repair shop in his place of residence, not far from the capital. He spends 180,000 francs a month to feed his wives and children as well as his aunt who lives with him in the family house. He pays school fees for the children (registration, school supplies, clothing, transport) for a total of 280,000 francs. This year he was obliged to sell a motor intended for his vehicle to cover these expenses. He also pays health expenses for the family. 

He has been a member of IMCEC for two years, but he has never asked for a loan. He is presently requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to repair his urban transport taxi by buying four doors, a hood, two front fenders and a trunk. At the same time he wants to redo the body and the paint job to make the taxi more attractive to clients. This will permit him to face the stiff competition. 

His ambition is to buy other transport vehicles, to update his auto repair shop, and to sell spare parts in his workshop.

loans.use: to repair his urban transport vehicle.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 50 year-old married mother of five children aged between five and eighteen. Halima owns a retail shop in Macknon, Voi. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. Halima is a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to add more stock of corn flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Halima dream is to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to add more stock of corn flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Peweh Group

texts.en: Adama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone 30 years ago. Adama is married and the couple has four children. She has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, and fried cakes, for the past five years. She and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 3,200,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand their respective businesses. Adama is going to buy palm-oil, rice, baking flour, etc. in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice, baking flour, etc. in a large quantity to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30 year-old  single man, living and working in Tyre. Hasan has rented a barber shop for eleven years and is working hard to expand it. That’s why he has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner.  In order to help attract new customers, Hassan wants to make some decorative changes to his shop, in addition to replacing his shop's seats. His customers include friends, neighbors and other community members who have come to know him through his work over the past decade.
 
Hasan says that he is very proud of the quality of his work, and he believes that his extensive experience is what distinguishes him from others in his field.
Hasan hopes to stay active and capable of covering all his necessary expenses.

loans.use: To do some decorative upgrades to his barber shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 11, 9, and 6. She has been driving a taxi for over a year making 23,000 KES a month. This is Florence’s first loan. She plans to use it to purchase spare parts needed to service her vehicle. She intends to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a fleet of five vehicles for her business and thus create employment for other people.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her taxi

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru: Нурмахмад проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а двое детей учатся в школе. Сам Нурмахмад имеет высшее образование. На сегодняшний день он не работает по профессии. Сейчас он занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У него имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Он продает канцелярские товары, одежду и продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых продуктов в оптом (сахар, масло, мука, рис, сливочное масло).
texts.en: Nurmahmad lives in Dangara. He is 38 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife, and the two children go to school. Nurmahmad has a higher education. Currently he does not work in his profession. Now he trades in the area's central market. He has a shop where he sells mixed goods. He sells office supplies, clothes, and groceries. He has been doing this for seventeen years. He is taking out a loan to buy products wholesale including sugar, oil, flour, rice, and butter.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale

loans.name: Nyimpa

texts.en: Nyimpa is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She cooks banku (cooked fermented corn dough and cassava dough) with fish and hot pepper sauce at Elmina. Nyimpa has been cooking for sale for 10 years. The quantity she cooks runs out before 12:00 noon. She wants to sell more, and so needs a loan so she can make more quantities to sell. The increase in profits that will come as a result of the loan will be put back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To make more quantities of banku to sell.

loans.name: Mouhanad

texts.en:
Mouhanad is a 23 year old single man from Ain. He  has been selling mobile phones and their accessories in his rented shop since July 2010, with 5 years of experience in this field.
Mouhanad is a hard worker. His family are against him taking a loan because his father can help him increase his capital, but because he prefers to handle his own business alone, he has applied for his first loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to increase his business capital.
Mouhanad hopes to open a new branch in the future, and to be well known in the region.

loans.use: To increase his prepaid cards capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa sells different types of things such as rice, used shoes, eggs, beans, ice blocks and other things at Elmina, which she has done for 7 years. She wants to add the sale of provisions to what she already sells. A loan would be used to buy the above mentioned items and provisions to sell. Adjoa uses her income to support her husband and to provide the basic needs of her family.With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a single woman with one child in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. For the past 25 years, she has operated a retail vegetable-selling business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another branch in the future. With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children. She sells secondhand dresses at Elmina by moving from one area to another, which she has done for 10 years. The income she makes helps to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Esi will use the loan to purchase other kinds of used dresses to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: To purchase other kinds of used dresses to sell.

loans.name: Mena Ama

texts.en:
Mena is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.

She sells pepper, salted fish, onions and other things at Elmina. Mena has been in this trade for seven years. She responsibly assists her husband in the payment of household expenses and school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy more of the food items mentioned above to sell. She wishes to build a shop with the new profit.

loans.use: to buy food to resell.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, a farmer since 1998, was born in 1975 and lives in the village of Zovaber, in the area of Sevan, with his wife, son and daughter. His children study at school, and his wife helps Davit in farming.

On their farm Davit and his wife breed cows, pigs, sheep and chickens, activities that enable them to support their family. Davit likes his occupation very much and wants to develop his farm. Always punctual in his repayments, he is now requesting his third loan from Nor Horizon for 1.000.000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Ama sells plantain, cassava, palm fruits and small green garden eggs at Elmina. She has done this for eight years. Ama assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

She will use the loan to purchase palm fruits, plantain and other items to sell. Ama plans to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits, plantain and other items to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

Emelia cooks kokonte, a staple made of cassava flour and sometimes plantains, at Elmina. She has done this for 12 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Emelia will use the loan to purchase cassava flour and other ingredients to prepare kokonte for sale. 

She plans to plow her profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and other ingredients to prepare kokonte for sale.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda, a single woman with one daughter who has graduated from school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for the family.

For the past three months, Sauda has operated a business selling kerosene from home to her neighbours and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge she faces in her business. Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase more kerosene for sale.

Sauda dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

In the photograph Janet has displayed toffees, biscuits, matches, sugar and other items that she sells at Elmina, a fishing community on the Cape Coast. She wants to increase the quantity of goods sold and so a loan will serve as increased capital to buy more of the above mentioned items to sell. 

She responsibly supports her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her new profit will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy toffees, biscuits, matches, sugar and other items that she sells.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 44, is the married father of two children. 

Robert has been a hair dresser since 1987. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and the customer care he provides. Most of his clients are neighbors, relatives and friends, in addition to others who hear of him from his loyal customers.

Robert has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower for two cycles. His previous loan had a very good impact on his social and financial situation. That's why he's requesting another loan this time. This loan will be used to pay for his children school expenses. He can't pay them from his business because urgent issues come up suddenly and he has to cover them.
 
Robert is a good-standing borrower and a hard worker. He hopes to expand his business by offering beauty care, a spa and other requested services.

loans.use: To pay for his children school expenses.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells cloth, candles, steel wool, sugar, groundnuts and other items at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She has senior high level of education. When the loan comes, she says will be used to buy more candles, steel wool and other items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop some day.

loans.use: to buy more candles, steel wool and other items to sell.

loans.name: Hannah Edith

texts.en: Hannah sells second-hand clothing at Elmina. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Hannah has been selling second-hand clothing for 12 years. She helps her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. Christina sells rice, cassava and banku at Elmina. Banku is a staple made from corn. 

She wants to increase the quantity of banku she cooks and so a loan of 200 Ghanaian cedis (GHS) will help her buy a bag of corn and other ingredients to cook to sell. The new profit as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of corn and other ingredients to cook to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells cassava, plantain and other items at Besease, a village at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Araba has been selling cassava, plantain and other items for eight years. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to provide the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy plantain and cassava to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest. In this picture, she is taking out some of the cassava she sells.

loans.use: to buy plantain and cassava to resell

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen, a married mother of three boys and one girl, owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, Moreen has operated a beauty salon and a cyber café. She also owns real estate which is her other source of income. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business.

Having decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. Moreen's dream is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Yesin

texts.en:
Y. is a 42-year-old married man and father of four children. He opened a poultry shop in 2003.

Y. works hard to improve his business selling chicken and its affiliates. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to increase his business capital and to pay for his brother's medical surgery. His customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends. He's an honest man and provides good customer service.

Y. hopes to expand his business and continue providing a healthy living for his family. He hopes this loan will reflect positively on the issues he requested it for, wishing none of his family members face such a problem in the future.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and pay for his brother's medical surgery

loans.name: Beat Art And Craft Group

texts.en:
A single mother of four, 53-year-old Jane has been selling liquor to earn a living for four years now, having taken over the business after her Dad passed on and becoming fully involved in its daily operation after separating from her husband. She earns as much as Ugandan shillings 150,000 per week and also has a poultry business.

Jane works hard at her enterprise, knowing the crucial role it plays in the welfare of her children and relatives. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more jerrycans of liquor to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of liquor to resell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 43-year-old housewife. Her husband Ihsan has a tailoring workshop that he has been running for six years now. Mona has been supporting her husband in his business by helping him getting work done so they have a basic income to raise their four children. During these six years, they were able to add more services besides tailoring: dry cleaning and ironing clothes and fabric.

Now that the business is growing, Mona has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and to redecorate the workshop so it can fit all the required machines and tools needed to provide their services in the best and most appropriate way. Since Mona is a conservative person, she requested that her husband Ihsan appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and redecorate her workshop

loans.name: Good Sababu Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in northern Sierra Leone 45 years ago. She is married to a cattle trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Isatu sells palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. and has been doing this business for 22 years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to buy palm oil, gari, honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: The picture above shows Beatrice. She sells cloth, dresses, underwear, and so on by hawking in the vicinity of Besease near Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an electrician. She wants to expand her business and so needs a loan to buy more of the above mentioned items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a married woman with two girls, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchase of cloth material. 

For the past year, she has operated an embroidery business, sellin retail to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells soaps which makes up her other source of income. Jedidah faces a major challenge of high cost of materials because of price fluctuations. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth and other materials for her embroidery business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two children; one attends school while one has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is water bills and electricity bills. 

For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also owns a rental house, contributing to her other source of income. Rose faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Duhorimbere Ii Group

texts.fr:
Louise est une commerçante âgée de 31ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de riz  depuis 6ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence juste après sa sortie d’école en tant qu’élève. C’est une mère célibataire avec 2 enfants âgés de 13ans et 11ans qui étudient. Elle est détentrice du Diplôme de fin des études secondaires en sciences de l’éducation.

 Son crédit de 170,000francs burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de riz à vendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« DUHORIMBERE II».
texts.en:
Louise is a 31-year-old retailer who lives in Gatumba neighborhood in the Mairie district of Bujumbura. She has been selling rice for six years. This is a trade she took up right after leaving school. She is a single mother of two children, aged 13 and 11, who are enrolled in school. She has a secondary school Leaving Certificate in education. 

Her loan of 170,000 Burundi francs will contribute to growing her working capital and thus the quantity of rice she can stock in order to make more profit. 

She is a member of the community group « DUHORIMBERE II».

loans.use: to grow her working capital so as to be able to stock more rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts like chains, headlights, batteries, lubricants, etc. for his inventory.

loans.name: Duhorimbere Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de poisson  depuis 15ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence juste après sa sortie d’école en tant qu’élève. Elle est mariée a Bernard, lui-même commerçant de poisson et ont ensemble 4 enfants qui étudient. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 8e année. 
Son crédit de 450,000francs burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de poisson à vendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. L’histoire de son commerce est fascinante car elle a commence avec un capital de 65,000francs burundais avant de connaitre Turame 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« DUHORIMBERE».
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 30 year-old merchant who lives in the Gatumba neighborhood in Bujumbura city. She has been in the fish trade for 15 years. It is the profession she started in right after leaving school, where she was a student. She is married to Bernard, himself a fish seller, and together they have four children, who attend school. She herself went to school up to the eighth grade.
Her loan of 450,000 Burundian francs will contribute to increasing her capital and augment the quantity of fish for sale to make large profits. The story of her business is fascinating, as she started with a capital of 65,000 Burundian francs before discovering Turame.
She is a member of the community group "Vugukuri."

loans.use: to increase her capital and augment the quantity of fish for sale to make large profits.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with the four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to supply charcoal for sale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a goat selling business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and requirements.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is a married man with 11 children, 7 attend school while 4 are still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 30 years, he has operated a goat selling business, selling at the market to butcher shop operators. He faces a challenge of seasonality in his business. His major challenge is price fluctuations in the market. He dreams of operating a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase cows and goats to sell for meat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To  purchase cows and goats to sell for meat.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery trabaja como empleada en la Alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de matricula universitaria de su hijo. La señora vive en casa de sus suegros  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en: Rosmery works as an employee at the Town Hall of the city of La Paz.  The loan she needs is to pay for her son’s university expenses.  She lives in her in-laws’ house, which is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz; she is married and has three children.  This is the first time she is working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: pay for her son's university enrollment.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos es empleado en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de mensualidades universitarias. Carlos vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Sebastián en la ciudad de La Paz; está separado y tiene un hijo pequeño. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en: Carlos is employed at a private enterprise.  The loan he needs is to pay for his monthly university enrollment.  Carlos lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the San Sebastián zone of the city of La Paz; he is separated and has one small son.  This is the first time he works with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: pay for university expenses so he can continue with his studies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como ser: fideos, azúcar, arroz y demás productos para su tienda; con la venta de estos productos cubre los gastos de su familia. La señora vive en casa propia  con su hija menor  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz; es separada  y tiene dos hijos pero el mayor ya es casado. Juana cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues es cliente antigua desde al año 2006.
texts.en: Juana has a general store.  The loan she needs is to buy products such as:  noodles, sugar, rice and other items for her store; with the sale of this merchandise, she covers her family’s expenses.  She lives in her own house with a minor daughter, and it is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz; she is separated and also has two sons, but the oldest is already married.  Juana finds herself very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to her previously, as she has been a client since 2006.

loans.use: buy noodles, sugar, rice and other supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and transport. 
 
With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to start a charcoal selling business, purchasing sacks of charcoal and selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to urban areas for sale. He dreams of expanding and establishing rental houses in the future. Nelson decided to join Yehu to access loan to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida nació en el departamento de Apurímac (Perú) y tiene 65 años de edad. Actualmente, Zoraida  vive en la ciudad de Cusco. Zoraida es una madre responsable que se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Zoraida requiere el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y desea comprar arroz, azucar y otras cosas mas. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Zoraida was born in the department of Apurímac (Perú) and is 65 years of age.  Currently, Zoraida lives in the city of Cusco.  Zoraida is a very responsible mother, who dedicates herself to selling food.  She has a small grocery store in her home.  She has dedicated herself to this business for several years now, and things are going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

Currently, Zoraida needs a loan to supply her grocery store and wants to buy rice, sugar, and other items.  The member is a very responsible and hard-working person.  Because of these qualities, her friends invited her to participate in the “Chaska Ñawi” cooperative bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: implement her grocery store, and she wants to buy rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a machine to copy keys, a blowtorch for soldering, etc., for his locksmith workshop.

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Maua, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running two businesses.  She has a shop selling cosmetics and has sold charcoal as well for seven years now.  She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her cosmetics stock and started charcoal business. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more cosmetics and increase her charcoal stock. Her dream is to one day finish building her house, which she has started.

She will share this loan with her loan  group "Kasuku" which has 20 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and increase her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Hungria Baleria

texts.es: Hungría Baleria ha trabajado mucho para incrementar sus ventas y poder ayudar a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de mercaderia en general, por lo que hace más de 3 años que se dedica a su negocio. Por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ya que es una mujer muy carismática.  Su sueño ahora es acondicionar su establecimiento. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cremas,calzado, ropa en general, pintura de labios, sabanas, tratamientos y perfumes. Porque su gran desafío es la gran competencia del sector y por eso ella venderá lo que su clientela necesite.
texts.en: Hungría Baleria has worked hard to increase her sales and be able to help her family.  Her business is selling cosmetics and she has been in this business for more than three years.  She is always thinking about how to improve her income.  She is a very charismatic woman.  Her dream now is to equip her establishment.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy creams, lipsticks, nail polish, treatments and perfume.  Her biggest challenge is the fact that there is a lot of competition in the sector.  For this reason, she will sell what her customers need.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, nail polish, treatments and perfume

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married a woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and expenses. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase inventory such as bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy strawberries, sugar and containers so that she can continue making jam

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as copper wire, switches, and cotton tape.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel trabaja atendiendo  en un snack de venta de te, café y masitas. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de pensiones  ya que ella estudia en un Instituto la carrera de Contabilidad. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Maribel serves in a snack bar selling tea, coffee and pastries.  She needs this loan to pay her tuition fees as she is studying for a degree in accountancy.  She lives in her parents' home which is in Villa Ingenio district, in the city of El Alto.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees so that she can continue studying accounting

loans.name: Cecilia Rosalia

texts.es:
Cecilia Rosalia tiene 26 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir adelante con el trabajo y tener ingresos para dar el estudio a los hijos.

En los tiempo libres se dedica a pasar con los hijos y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia Rosalia is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The community bank VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the Ventanas canton.  It has 20 members who work in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Cecilia works in agriculture and plants corn and rice.  She makes purchases in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in that same town.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.  The support of the loan will help her family financially meet this needs.  Her dream is to continue with her work and have the income to give her children an education.

In her free time, she spends time with her children and cleans the house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lucy Zoraida

texts.es: Lucy nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, Lucy  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Lucy trabaja en el ministerio  de agricultura en el área de contabilidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Lucy en sus horas libres también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. En esta oportunidad Lucy  requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes, collares y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Lucy was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She is 42 years old.  Lucy currently lives in the same city in which she was born.  She works for the Ministry of Agriculture, in the accounts department.  She has been in this job for several years and she is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  In her spare time, Lucy also sells cosmetics.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy beauty products such as perfume, necklaces, etc.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfumes, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl trabaja  como albañil en distintos lugares en forma independiente; el realiza contratos cada semana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, fierro) ya que realizara el levantamiento de columnas para construir habitaciones. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Rió Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto; es separado y tiene cinco hijos. Raúl es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Raúl is self-employed as a builder and he works in different places, carrying out contracts every week.  He needs this loan to buy construction supplies (cement, sand and iron) so that he can erect pillars for building rooms. 

Raúl lives in his own home in Rió Seco district, in the city of El Alto.  He is separated and has five children.  Raúl has been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron to erect pillars for building rooms

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38 years old and married. He runs a "matatu" (mini-bus) business that transports commuters from Kawangware to town. As part of his business, Patrick hires two employees. He has been doing this for five years. Patrick intends to use his loan to purchase spray paint and spare parts to repair his vehicle. 

Patrick hopes to use the profits from his business to continue expanding his "matatu" business. He describes himself as honest, God-fearing, and persistent.

loans.use: to purchase spray paint and spare parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina, la socia tiene 22 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, La socia se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y venta de los mismos, la socia suele comprar al por mayor los cría engorda y reproduce, generalmente cuando llegan a la edad madura ella los vende al por mayor y menor a las diferentes picanterías y restaurantes de la zona. La socia desea poder invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes para incrementar su negocio, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes y venderlos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Luz Marina is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 4 and 2.  Her business is raising and selling guinea pigs.  She usually buys the guinea pigs wholesale and then raises them, fattens them and breeds them.  When they become adults, she generally sells them wholesale and retail to different restaurants in the area.  Luz Marina would like to invest in buying 20 guinea pigs in order to increase her business.  She is requesting the loan to invest in buying 20 guinea pigs to sell.

Luz Marina is grateful for the support that she is being given and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying 20 guinea pigs to sell

loans.name: Dios Bendice 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is one of the members of the “Dios Bendice” (God Bless) 3, 4 & 5 group which has 15 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Margarita lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. It also has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities with very limited resources.

Margarita is very excited to receive her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth. She has had her business for about four years; she started it with some savings her husband had. He gave them to her to start up her business. She is running a candy shop stall, and she is planning on investing the new loan in buying snacks, juices, candies, gums, and many other products. She sells them by walking around and waiting for various schools to get out.

Margarita’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their five children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys working and attending church. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to start building her house, little by little and with some help from her long-term partner.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juice, candies, etc.

loans.name: Joseph Fabricio

texts.es:
Joseph Fabricio tiene 23 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Joseph se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es salir adelante y aumentar las ganancias para tener lo necesario en la visa.

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia, hacer un poco de deporte y ayudar en la casa.
texts.en:
Joseph Fabricio is 23 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his son in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Joseph devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and sells at the fair there.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  His dream is to get ahead and to increase his earnings in order to have life’s necessities.

He likes to go for walks with his family, play a bit of sports, and to help at home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: 15 Tây Hải _ Hoằng Thanh _ Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Xinh is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling fish. Xinh is 47 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 15 Tây Hải _ Hoằng Thanh _ Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2004, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xinh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xinh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing-net to catch fish for sale.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a married man with two children; one attends school while one is too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman selling second-hand clothes which contributes to his other source of income. 

For the past five years, he has operated a scrap metal selling business, selling as retail to his local neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of scarcity in scrap metal supply. He dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier of scrap metal in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase scrap metals for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal for sale.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacleta, la socia tiene 54 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales la socia está a cargo aun del menor D. 9 años D. edad, viviendo con ella, la socia tiene un taxi que brinda servicios particulares a turistas, ella cobra el dinero D. este servicio y lo invierte en diferentes cosas por ejemplo en el mantenimiento del automóvil, en el combustible y otros gastos, ella desea comprar para la unidad el seguro D. pasajeros que es obligatorio, este seguro se denomina SOAT; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra del seguro D. vida D. los diferentes pasajeros.   
         
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Anacleta is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Anacleta is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  Her youngest, who is 9, is still in her care and lives with her.  Anacleta has a taxi with which she provides a private service to tourists.  She invests the money that she makes from this service in different things such as maintaining the vehicle, paying for gas and other expenses.  She would like to buy passenger insurance for her vehicle (this is compulsory).  The insurance is called SOAT - Seguro Obligatorio D. Accidentes D. Tránsito (Compulsory Traffic Accident Insurance).  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying this insurance for her passengers.

Anacleta is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying accident insurance for her passengers

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi trabaja  como cajera en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de un anticrético en la casa donde vive, pues el dueño de casa le ha subido el monto del anticrético (Anticrético es una figura legal por la cual el dueño de casa permite a otra persona vivir en la casa por un plazo determinado y por un monto total pagadero por adelantado y que será devuelto al cabo del plazo establecido en el contrato). Vive en anticrético en una casa ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro  de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Daysi works as a cashier in a private company.  She needs this loan to increase the 'anticrético' payment for the house that she rents, as the owner of the house has increased the amount of the 'anticrético' ('anticrético' is a system whereby the owner of a house allows another person to live in it for a pre-determined period of time, for a sum of money which is paid in advance and then returned to the tenant at the end of the term established in the contract).  Daysi lives in a house which she rents 'en anticrético'.  It is located in Alto San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the second time that she has had a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to increase the 'anticrético' sum for the house where she lives

loans.name: Pedro Leonel

texts.es:
Pedro Leonel tiene 21 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo Adriam de un año. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como la falta de dinero para invertir. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia dar lo necesario al hijo y comprar una casa. 

Le gusta hacer deporte, los gallos de pelea.
texts.en:
Pedro Leonel is 21 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his one year old son, Adrian, in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Pedro devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and he sells at the fair in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  He faces challenges like not having money to invest.  

His dream is to get ahead with the family, to give his son the necessities, and to buy a house.

He likes to play sports and cockfighting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bibiana, la socia tiene 67 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 7 hijos todos ellos independientes, la socia  apoya aun a uno de sus hijos al menor con sus estudios superiores, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de compra y venta de frutas y verduras, la socia la socia vende en el mercado de Santa Ana; ella desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de verduras y fruta al por mayor de los proveedores y de este modo implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para la venta.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Bibiana, who is 67 years old.  The member is married and has 7 children, all of whom are independent, though the member is helping one of the younger children with their higher education.  The member works in retail, she has a stall in the Santa Ana market for purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables.  She is looking for the loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables and fruit at wholesale from the suppliers, and in this way facilitate her business.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of dues.

loans.use: to invest in buying fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El señor Franz es docente en una de las escuelas hoteleras de la ciudad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción, pues necesita levantar un muro lateral de ladrillo en su casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Llojeta de La Paz;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Franz is a teacher at one of the hotel schools in the city.  He is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials because he needs to build a brick side wall in his home.  He lives in his own home located in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.

This is is first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mubila, trésorière du groupe d’affaire « Bidii »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, tous étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  pétrolière,  (vendeuse de pétrole en détail). Son mari est un mécanicien indépendant. Elle vend ses marchandises devant sa porte, près de son domicile. Il y a 20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  10 bidons de pétrole.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire confortablement une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Bidii» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Our client Mubila, treasurer of the business group « Bidii », is an entrepreneur of 46, married and the mother of seven children, all having been enrolled in school, some of whom are already established in their own homes. Mubila is a kerosene retailer. Her husband is an independent mechanic. 

She sells her wares in front of her door, near her home. She has been in this business for a full 20 years. However, she has just completed her eighth loan with Hekima. This new loan will serve to allow her to stock up on 10 jerrycans of kerosene. 

Besides her business, her ambition is to have all her children complete school and to build a house comfortably. This client thanks Hekima for its work on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banking. Please note that the  business group called « Bidii» is made up predominantly of women.

loans.use: to buy 10 jerrycans of kerosene.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Ciudad Satélite. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona de Villa Exaltación  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene un dos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010.
texts.en:
Víctor works as a driver.  He is a member of the Ciudad Satélite drivers' union.  He needs this loan to buy a new engine for his passenger transport vehicle.

Víctor lives in his in-laws' home which is in Villa Exaltación district, in the city of El Alto.  He is married and two children.  He has been a client of IMPRO since 2010.
