loans.use: to buy an engine for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Oswaldo Alejandro

texts.es:
Oswaldo Alejandro tiene 44 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con un nieto. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.  Su sueño es trabajar y tener siempre salud.

Le gusta ir de pesca.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Alejandro is 44 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his grandson in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Oswaldo devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and sells at the fair in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  

His dream is to work and to always have his health.

He likes to go fishing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la venta D. joyas D. fantasía fina, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue y ambos elaboran las diferentes piezas D. aretes, prendedores, anillos, brazaletes, collares, la socia nos comenta que su esposo trabaja en una institución en la cual ella tiene a la mayoría D. sus clientas, la socia realiza bellos y finos acabados los cuales son requeridos por las colegas D. su conyugue y el les hace la propaganda, La socia desea invertir en la compra D. materiales para la realización D. mayor numero D. bisutería, la socia comprara mercadería como mostacillas D. colores, cuarzos, piedrillas, alambres D. diferentes materiales, ganchitos y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. materiales.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria is 58 years old, married, and has seven children who all live independently.  Her business is selling costume jewelry.  She works together with her husband making different pieces of jewelry: earrings, brooches, rings, bracelets and necklaces.  Maria tells us that her husband works in an institution where she has most of her customers.  She makes beautiful and high-quality finishing touches to her jewelry which her husband's work colleagues require.  He markets the products to them.  Maria would like to invest in buying materials to make more jewelry.  She will buy merchandise such as colored beads, quartz, stones, wires maD. from different materials, little hooks, etc.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials.

Maria is grateful for the support that she is being given and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Anibal Enrique

texts.es:
Anibal Enrique tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos Xavier y Joselin. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es llegar a tener mas dinero para cuando lo9s hijos vayn a la escuela.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Anibal Enrique is 33 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his two children, Xavier and Joselin.  They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Anibal devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and he sells at the fair in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  

His dream is to have more money for when the children go to school.

He really likes to play sports with his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Zelma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zelma, la socia tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es soltera, La socia se dedica a la venta de madera, ella transporta de la selva madera, La Socia  tiene su maderera y desea implementar su negocio para lo cual ella invertirá el crédito en el pago parcial de una carga de madera que le llegara en 15 días, la socia tiene ahorrado un pequeño capital pero le falta el monto que está solicitando para la realización del pago de la madera que le traerán y de este modo ella podrá abastecer su negocio y continuar creciendo. La socia solicita el préstamo pata invertir en la compra de madera. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Zelma, who is 29 years old and single.  The member works selling wood; she transports the timber from the forest.  The member has her timber business and wants to improve it.  For this reason, she will invest the loan in partial payment for a load of wood which she will get in 2 weeks.  The member has saved a small amount of capital but lacks the amount that she is requesting in order to make the payment for the wood she will get.  In this way she will be able to supply her business and continue to grow. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wood.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of dues.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 69 años D. edad, esta  casada y no tiene hijos.  No cuenta con educación. 
Lleva trabajando  con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales domésticos.
Con su  nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra D. alimentos para el respectivo engorD. D. los animales por dos meses y luego venderlos  en la localidad Carumas. Trabaja junto con su esposo.  También nos cuenta que venden la lana D. los animales, con ello tienen una ganancia adicional.
Su sueño es seguir con los ganados y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the community bank Virgen D. Concepción, located in the C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 69 years old, married, and does not have children.  She has never gone to school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested the money in her business raising and selling domestic animals.

With a new loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will purchase feed to fatten her animals for two months, and then sell them in Carumas.  She works with her husband.  She also sells wool from the animals to earn extra income.  

Her dream is to continue working with livestock and increase her income. 

The things she likes about the community bank are the meetings and the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: 4 - Hoằng Phong - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hồng is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling beverages.

Hồng is 30 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 4 - Hoằng Phong - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her one dependent.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes to provide for her child. She hopes for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain a beverage stall.

loans.name: Magaly Alexandra

texts.es:
Magaly Alexandra tiene 23 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con la hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Magaly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia.

Le gusta dialogar con el esposo.
texts.en:
Magaly Alexandra is 23 years old, and she is married.  She lives with her husband and her child.  They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Her Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Anibal devotes herself to growing corn and rice.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas every month, and she sells at the fair in the same place.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help her financially in order to supply her necessities.  

Her dream is to get ahead with her family.

She likes chatting with her husband.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his younger siblings. 

For the last two years, he has operated a spare parts shop. He sells retail to his neighbours and passersby. Calvin faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. He dreams of becoming a leading spare part dealer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts like spokes, tyres and oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts like spokes, tyres, and oil.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.en: Ana Cecilia is 24 years old and lives in the city of Pimampiro in northern Ecuador. She is married and and lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter is six years old and her son is two years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who is very dedicated to her family and her home. Ana Cecilia owns a store which she opened with the desire to progress economically while working in a place where she could be with her children. She is obtaining this loan for the purpose of expanding her business. She intends to increase the amounts of products she has available for her customers. She has been getting loans from FODEMI for five years to support her business. In the past, her loans have given her family many economic opportunities. In the future, she wants to continue progressing with her family and her business. In the photo, Ana Cecilia appears with her son and one of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products for her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de un año, su primer préstamo que fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de cordero.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará treinta animales para su respectivo carneo.  Cuenta que los animales los compra en Acora, Camicachi, Chipani y los vende en el mercado de Ilave, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien también es taxista.
Su sueño es techar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas porque aprende respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the San Miguel Arcángel II community bank, located in the Ilave district in the El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She went to secondary school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos more than a year ago.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested it in her grocery store.  Currently, she works buying and selling lamb meat.

With this new loan of 3000 nuevos soles, she will purchase 30 animals for their meat.  She will buy the animals in Acora, Camichachi, and Chipani and will sell them in the market in Ilave.  Her husband helps with the business, and also works as a taxi driver.

Her dream is to put a roof on her house and for her children to be professionals.

The things she likes about the community bank are the talks, because she learns about business.

loans.use: to purchase thirty sheep.

loans.name: Temistocles Abdon

texts.es:
Temistocles Abdon tiene 36 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Temistocles se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.Su sueño es aumentar la produccion para tener mas ingresos. 

Le gusta dialogra con los amigos.
texts.en:
Temistocles is 36 years old, single, has no children, and lives with his parents in the Canton of Ventanas, in the Province of Los Rios.

The communal bank he belongs to, VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe, is located in the Recinto Sibimbe, also in Ventanas canton. It has 20 members, all of whom work in agriculture on the short cycle, sowing corn and rice.

Temistocles too is dedicated to agriculture, planting corn and rice. He purchases his supplies monthly in Ventanas, and sells his harvests in the local fairs at the same location.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure. The loan will help him economically to supply necessities. Temistocles' dream is to increase production in order to have more income.

What he enjoys most is dialogue with his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Thuỷ is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling fish.

Thuỷ is 21 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her three dependents.

In 2010, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuỷ has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thuỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thuỷ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for fish selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Jonny Manolo

texts.es: Don Manolo Es casado tiene dos Hijos uno de 4 años, y el otro de 7 tiene 35 años de edad don Manolo nos cuenta que su empresa de plataninas a ido creciendo, el, inicio su negocio hace 2 años, trabajando al credito con una ampresa de platanos y luego termino de pagar y empeso a trabajar con un capital propio ahorrando pudo comprar su carro y contratar a dos personas para que le ayuden y de la misma manera Manolo Solicita un credito para poder invertir en su negocio ya que ahora tiene mas pedidos y no tiene el capital suficiente para comprar su mercaderia
texts.en: Manolo is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 7.  He tells us that his plantain chip business has grown.  He started his business two years ago, working with a loan, with a banana company.  He finished paying back and started working with his own capital.  By saving up, he was able to buy a car and hire two people to help him.  Manolo is requesting a loan to invest in his business as he has more orders and doesn't have enough capital to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy plantains for making 'plataninas' (plantain chips)

loans.name: Angel Marcial

texts.es:
Angel Marcial tiene 37 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Angel Marcial se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener capital y seguir trabajando. 

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
37-year old Angel Marcial is single, lives with his parents, and doesn’t have any children. He lives in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

His community bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE and is located in Recinto Sibimbe in Ventanas canton. There are 20 members who work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Angel Marcial also grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas each month and sells his produce in the local market. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure. The loan will provide him with the financial support to obtain what he needs. He sometimes faces problems such as insects that attack his crops.

Angel’s dream is to have more money and to keep on working. He loves dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Ivan trabaja  como empleado en la empresa QUALITY. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (ladrillo, estuco, pintura) ya que hará la refacción de una habitación Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Plan Autopista  de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Ivan works for the company QUALITY. 

He is seeking a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, stucco, and paint so that he can make alterations to a room in his parents’ home where he lives. The house is located in Plan Autopista in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children. This is Ivan’s second loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, stucco, and paint to renovate a room in his parents' house

loans.name: Cholponay

texts.en:
Cholponay is 42, married and has three children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 15 years, and it is the only mean of subsistence for them. They started this business with an initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms, which was used to purchase one milk cow. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Cholponay pastured her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. She worked hard and managed to increase her number of cattle but in the times of crisis she had to sell part of her cattle in order to cover expenses of her family. 

Now Cholponay is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy more cattle. With the revenue, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding and pay for higher education for her children. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, todos independientes.  Estudió hasta cuarto de educación primaria.
Su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace un año.
Con su  nuevo préstamo solicitado de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez jabas de gaseosas, cinco cajas de galletas, caramelos y chocolates, etc., cuenta que los vende de forma ambulatoria por el coliseo de Ilave.
Su sueño es tener más capital para abrir un restaurante. Y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the San Miguel Arcángel II Community Bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has four children who have left home. Juana attended primary school up to grade four.

A previous loan was for S/. 500 which she invested in her candy and soft drinks business. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. With the new loan of S/. 1000 that she is seeking, Juana will buy ten cases of soft drinks, five boxes of cookies, candy and chocolates etc. She sells these items in the streets near Ilave’s coliseum. 

Juana’s dream is to have enough money to open a restaurant and thereby increase her income.

She enjoys the simplicity of getting a loan through her community bank.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies, candy etc.

loans.name: 1 - Tân Xuân - Hoằng Phụ - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ngoan is applying for a loan to improve her business. She has a grocery store.

Ngoan is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 1 - Hoằng Phụ - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Ngoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngoan has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ngoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain her grocery store.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia de 45 años, está separada de su esposo hace ya 11 años y como madre luchadora y tenaz cuida de sus 2 hijos; Noe de 18 y Brigit de 15 años, a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la cuenca alta de la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Las fuerza y vitalidad de está mujer es sorprendente. Hace 2 años que sufrió la muerte de su nuera, la esposa de su hijo mayor; desde entonces lo apoya con el cuidado de Yeraldine de tan solo 3 años de edad. Sola y con muchas responsabilidades Teodosia, pudo salir adelante; cada día agradece a Dios por ello; ya que en los últimos meses adquirió una pequeño local donde pueda vender los ricos platos de comida que cocina; está actividad le resulta rentable a ella; los pobladores conocen de su exquisito sabor, pues antes vendía en una esquina de la plaza principal de su comunidad, sin un lugar acogedor para sus clientes. Asimismo siembra diversos frutos de la zona, en una huerta que tiene en su casa, que le sirven para su consuno y de vez en cuando los comercializa al menudeo. Hace poco Teodosia, tuvo una recaída en su enfermedad de cálculo en los riñones, pero eso no la desanima. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, quiere adquirir materiales para su nuevo restaurante; sus aspiraciones son establecerse y triunfar con lo que más le gusta que es “la cocina”. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La palmeras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Teodosia, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar para abastecer los insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus exquisitos platos de comida, propios de la zona.
texts.en:
45-year old Teodosia has been separated from her husband for eleven years. She works very hard to take care of her two dependent children, Noe aged 18 and Brigit aged 15. She is raising them in her own house located in Cuenca Alta in the Peruvian rainforest (in the community of Las Palmas). 

The strength and vitality of this woman are amazing. Two years ago her daughter-in-law died. Since then she has been helping her oldest son take care of 3-year old Yeraldine. Alone and with many responsibilities, Teodesia was able to move on and she is grateful to God for that.  In the last few months she has obtained a small stall where she sells the delicious food that she has cooked, and that is proving a profitable enterprise. The local people know that she is a good cook as she used to sell food in a corner of the main square, not a very comfortable place for her customers. Teodesia also grows various local fruits in a garden at her house. This produce is mostly eaten by the family but occasionally she has enough to sell. 

A short time ago she suffered another attack of kidney stones, but even that didn’t discourage her. 

Now, with help from her community bank, she wants to buy materials for a new restaurant. She wishes to make a name for herself in the work she most enjoys: cooking. Teodesia belongs to La Palmeras Community Bank. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes that with their assistance she will be able to achieve her goals. She promises to pay back the loan on schedule as she did with previous loans.

Teodesia is grateful to be part of a community bank as all the members are responsible, committed people. Once she has received the loan, she plans to buy bags of rice and sugar to use in the wonderful local dishes that she cooks.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino se dedica  a la elaboración de zapatos de cholita (se llama cholita a la campesina de pollera) y también trabaja como chofer. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: plantas de zapato, goma, clefa, tachuelas, cuerina y demás insumos para continuar con su negocio de fabricación de calzados. Marcelino vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Bajo Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene dos hijos pero el mayor ya es casado. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Marcelino works making cholita shoes (peasant women are called cholitas), and also works as a driver.  He is asking for this loan to purchase materials like soles, rubber, tacks, imitation leather, and other materials to continue his business making shoes.  

Marcelino lives in his own home, located in the Bajo Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children, and the oldest is married.  He has been a client since 2006.

loans.use: to purchase soles, rubber, imitation leather, and other materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fifteen years, he has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Mwinyi faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season, the availability of fish for sale is minimal. He dreams of expanding and purchasing his own stall in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase sacks of fish for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish for sale.

loans.name: 8 Liên Hà - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hoà is applying for a loan to improve her business. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Hoà is 23 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 8 Liên Hà - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Hoà lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Hoà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoà has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoà has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoà hopes to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise and livestock-feed.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 50 años, reside en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Marina, su esposa desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica este humilde hombre, es la agricultura, en el cual tiene 4 años de experiencia. En sus 9 terrenos agrícolas siembra plátano, café y rocoto; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación. Ya que sabe lo difícil que es mantenerlos, según cuenta el rocoto tarda 2 años en poder dar fruto después de la siembra. Ahora ya está floreando y espera obtener buenos resultados en la cosecha, ya que con la experiencia que posee los mismos compradores visitan su chacra para poder comprar su producción. Como un buen padre de familia, responsable y con aspiraciones para sus hijos, hace poco alquiló una casa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde sus hijos están estudiando educación superior en una universidad estatal reconocida, por ello su esposa se traslado ahí para poder cuidarlos. Está nueva etapa lo impulso a dedicarse al trabajo de albañil en sus tiempos libres, pues gana más en este oficio, según afirma un promedio de 3 mil a 4 mil nuevos soles mensuales, con los que espera concretar el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juan de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de plátanos que sembró hace 2 meses y que tiene que ser fertilizados constantemente.
texts.en:
Juan, 50 years old, resides in the locality of Alto Yapaz (in Peru's central rain forest). Here he formed his family with Marina, his wife for 26 years. Together they have 4 children who are cared for with much love and affection in their own house.

This humble man is dedicated to agriculture, and he has 4 years experience. On his 9 plots of land he sows plantains, coffee, and chili peppers, which he cares for with much dedication. He has learned how difficult it is to maintain them, and he tells us that after planting the peppers they were delayed 2 years in producing. Now they are flowering and he hopes to obtain good results at harvest, and due to his experience, buyers are visiting his farm to buy his production.

Like a good family man, responsible and with aspirations for his children, he recently rented a house in the city of Huancayo, where his children are studying at a recognized state university. His wife has moved there to care for them. This new era has motivated him to work as a brick layer in his free time, since he earns more in this work -- as much as 3,000 or 4,000 new sols per month -- with which he hopes to realize his objective of advancing his children.

Juan belongs to “El Palomar al Exito” (The Dovecote for Success) Communal Bank and this is his 1st loan with MFP, where he hopes for your collaboration to achieve his objectives. He, in turn, promises to comply with his schedule of payments, as with his previous loans. Moreover, he is pleased to be part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible people with much solidarity.

Upon obtaining his loan, Juan will invest in various sacks of organic manure to spread on the plantain crops he planted some 2 months ago and that have to be fertilized constantly.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic manure for his plantain crop.

loans.name: Fanni Rosa

texts.es: Fanni  nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Fanni es artista y se presenta en eventos musicales, ella tiene una hermosa voz y trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a esta profesión y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fanni en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de chompas de lana, ella vende a pedido de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad Fanni requiere el préstamo para comprar más chompas.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Fanni was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she lives in the city in which she was born.  She is an artist and appears at music events.  She has a beautiful voice and works until very late at night.  Fanni has been in this profession for 10 years now and she is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  In her spare time, Fanni sells wool sweaters.  She sells these to her customers upon request.

On this occasion, Fanni needs a loan to buy more sweaters.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, es una mujer bondadosa de 46 años, que está casada con Andrés de 36 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo; José de 5 años; los 3 viven en la cuenca alta de la Selva Central (comunidad de las Palmas). Los verdes campos de la cuenca, son muy productivos la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican al cultivo de piña en todas sus variedades. Hace tan solo 4 años que viene dedicándose a la siembra de piña, cítricos y cacao; desde muy temprano se levanta para poder limpiar sus plantaciones de la maleza que crece en sus campos constantemente. Gracias a los cuidados  que le brinda; toda su cosecha es reconocida por su buena calidad y en temporadas de cultivo los mismos comercializadores vistan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprar sus productos. Ahora dentro de muy pocos meses cosechará varias hectáreas de naranja y tangüelo; los cuales ya tiene comprador. Viendo la demanda de sus productos Delfina está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con los que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y con ello lograr adquirir mayor rentabilidad para potenciar la calidad de sus cultivos. Obtener mejores ganancias para brindarle a su hijo una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las palmeras” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Delfina, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de piña y cítricos, para mantenerlos en buen estado.
texts.en:
Delfina is a kind 46 year old woman who is married to Andrés, who is 36 years old.  They have one child, José, who is 5 years old.  The three of them live in upper basin of the center jungle in the community of Las Palmas.  The green fields of the basin are very fertile.  The majority of the inhabitants work cultivating varities of pineapple.  

For four years, she has worked cultivating pineapple, citrus, and cacao.  She gets up very early to be able to clean her plantings of the weeds that constantly grow in her fields.  Thanks to the care she provides, all of her harvest is recognized for its good quality and in growing seasons, merchants visit her fields to purchase her products.  Now, in a few months, she will harvest acres of oranges and tangelos, which already have a buyer.  Seeing the demand for her products, Delfina is thinking of acquiring more fields so she can meet the demands of her customers.  With the fields, she will earn more profits to improve the quality of her crops, and earn more income to provide her son with a good education.  

She belongs to the community bank Las Palmeras, and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She hopes to continue their collaboration to advance with her objectives.  She promises once again to make her payments on time, as she did with past loans she has had.  She is also thankful to be part of the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Delfina will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizer for her citrus and pineapple crops, so that she can keep them in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with six children, five of whom graduated from school while one still attends school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 20 years, he has operated a fish selling business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of fish is lower. He dreams of purchasing a motor vehicle to transport his goods in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase sacks of fish for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Raul

texts.es: Jorge nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Jorge vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Jorge tiene su taller donde confecciona de chompas de lana de alpaca. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Jorge  requiere el préstamo para comprar fibra de alpaca.  El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Jorge was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and is 38 years old.  He now lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Jorge has a workshop where he makes sweaters from alpaca wool.  He has had this business for 3 years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  At this time, Jorge needs a loan to buy alpaca fiber.  Jorge is a responsible and hardworking person; because of these qualities, his friends invited him to participate in the communal bank "Chaska Ñawi” in the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy alpaca fiber

loans.name: Raphael

texts.fr: Raphael est un jeune homme de 30ans qui a ouvert  son bar nommé « COMMUINQUE BAR » en 2005. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 02 enfants. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  05 cartons de vins, 20 casiers de bière et des cartes de recharges pour satisfaire la demande. Il désire assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants et sa femme en jouant le rôle de bon père de famille c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en: Raphael is a 30 year old young man who opened his bar named "COMMUINQUE BAR" in 2005.  He is married to a reseller and has 2 children.  He is asking for this loan to buy 5 cartons of wine, 20 crates of beer, and phone cards to meet customer demand.  He wants to ensure a bright future for his children and his wife by being a good father. For these reasons, he is asking for this loan.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks, wine, and phone cards.

loans.name: Cesarina

texts.es: Cesarina, de 28 años de edad reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Elmer, su esposo desde hace 14 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos todos ellos menores y a los que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia. Desde muy joven conformó su familia, todo ello le incentivó para que pueda salir adelante junto a su esposo, quien ahora ocupa un cargo político en una de las localidades de la zona. Gracias a la agricultura, su principal sustento económico, pudo comprar sus terrenos de cultivo, donde ahora siembra café, yuca y plátanos, en tan solo 5 años de experiencia. Vendiendo su cosecha a la ciudad de Pichanaki donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder cosechar los frutos que produce, “es muy gratificante, después de tanto esfuerzo”, concluye. Ahora ella desea seguir comprando más terrenos de cultivo, donde pueda sembrar mayor cantidad de café, pues augura una subida en el mercado en los próximos años; donde quiere sacar el máximo provecho y así juntar el dinero necesario para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Cesarina de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago al personal que le está ayudando en esta cosecha de café. Asimismo en la compra de un nuevo terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
28 year-old Cesarina lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian jungle).  It was there that she formed her family together with Elmer, her husband of 14 years.  The couple have five dependent children who they care for with a lot of love.  They live in their own home.

Cesarina started her family when she was very young and this gave her the incentive to get ahead in life together with her husband, who now occupies a political post in one of the area's towns.  Thanks to farming (which is her main financial support), Cesarina was able to buy her own farm land where she now grows coffee, cassava and bananas.  She managed all this with just five years experience.  She sells her harvests in the town of Pichanaki, where she makes good profits.

What Cesarina most enjoys about her work is being able to harvest the fruit from her crops: "It is very rewarding after so much effort" she says.  Cesarina would like to continue buying more plots of land to farm so that she can grow a larger quantity of coffee as she predicts a rise in the market over the next few years and she would like to make the most of this.  This will enable her to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Cesarina belongs to the 'Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  Cesarina enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Cesarina will invest the money she has requested in paying the workers who are helping her with her coffee harvest.  She will also use some of the money to buy a new plot of farm land.

loans.use: to hire workers to help her with her coffee harvest.  She will also buy a plot of land to farm

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda.  She is married and has twelve children, seven of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans from her late brothers).    

Florence has a pub.  She has been in this business for many years, and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop,  retail.     Florence has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.   She also generates additional income through rental rooms and poultry farming. 

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.   Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 24 años, convive con Eradio su esposo, ambos tienen 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; a los cuales cuida y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la cuenca alta de la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). El trabajo al que se dedica está abnegada mujer desde hace ya 3 años, es la agricultura. Sus principales frutos son los cítricos y la piña; pero el fruto que le da mayor ingreso a Karina, es la piña, ya que siembra en sus más de 9 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo; los cuales cuidan y cosecha constantemente, junto a su esposo. Según menciona; la maleza que crece en su contorno no le permite crecer. Lo que más le molesta a ella es tener que cuidar sus plantaciones con abundante ropa, para evitar que ingresen las espinas de la piña al cuerpo; agrega que “con el intenso calor de la selva, no se puede trabajar”, menciona. En estos meses cosechará 3 hectáreas de piña y está planeando viajar a la capital para negociar a un mayor precio sus cultivos y más adelante convertirse en proveedor mayorista del país. Además está pensando abrir una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en una pequeña tienda cerca al parque de la localidad, donde su mamá colocó un negocio similar obteniendo buenas ganancias. En este mes dará el primer paso con la ayuda de su asociación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo de ustedes para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Karina, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en implementar la tienda de abarrotes que está pensando abrir.
texts.en:
24 year-old Karina lives with her husband Eradio.  The couple have three dependent children who they care for and educate in a rental house which is located in the upper basin of the Peruvian rainforest (in the community of Las Palmas).

The work that this selfless woman has been engaged in for three years now is farming.  Her main fruits are citrus fruits and pineapples.  However, it is the pineapple that provides Katrina with the most income.  She grows her pineapple over 9 hectares of farm land.  She is always caring for and harvesting her crop, together with her husband.  She tells us that the weeds that grow round about do not allow the fruit to grow.  What bothers her the most is having to care for her plantations whilst wearing plenty of clothes to avoid getting the pineapple spines in her body.  She adds "With the intense heat in the rainforest, you can't work".

Karina is harvesting three hectares of pineapple and she is planning to travel to the capital to negotiate a better price for her crops.  In the future, she plans to become a nation-wide wholesaler.  In addition, she is planning to open a grocery store business in a small store near the town park, where her mom set up a similar business and made good profits.  This month she will take the first steps with the help of her community bank.

Karina is a member of the "Las Palmeras" community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan from you in order to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.  Karina enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members of the bank are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Karina will invest the money she has requested in setting up the grocery store that she is planning to open.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Luz Marina  es estilista de profesión y trabaja en el salón de belleza de una amiga. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como tijeras, champoos, acondicionador, tintes y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in Cusco, Perú and is 42 years old.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born.  Luz Marina works as a stylist and works in her friend's beauty salon.  She has done this work for four years, and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

Luz Marina is asking for this loan to purchase materials she needs for work such as scissors, shampoo, conditioner, dyes, and other items.  She is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her friends invited her to join the Chaska Ñawi community bank with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, shampoo, conditioner, dyes, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nelyda

texts.es: Nelyda, de 39 años reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Blaferdin, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Bárbara y Maricielo a las que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia. Las tierras de Sankivironi son zonas productivas, donde se puede producir una variedad de alimentos. Por ello Nelyda, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la siembra de fréjol, palta, achiote, plátanos y maíz, en sus 6 cuadras de terrenos productivos, pero según afirma tiene un total de 10 terrenos cultivables, que por falta de capital de trabajo no puede producirlos por completo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo. “Me gusta estar activa”, comenta. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda cuando sus tiempo libre, pues se dedica al trabajo de construcción como albañil y a la cosecha de ají verde, que es muy cotizado por las empresas exportadoras peruanas. Ahora se está concentrando en mantener listos sus cultivos de palta y plátanos que dentro de 15 días cosechará, donde está segura podrá obtener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para lograr sus metas. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nelyda de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos. Asimismo en instrumentos necesarios para la ampliación de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Nelyda is 39 years old and lives in the native community of Shankivironi in the central Peruvian jungle.  She and her husband Blaferdin have been married for 20 years and have five children, but only two live with them: Bárbara and Maricielo.  They care for them with a lot of love in their own home.  

The land in Sankivironi is very fertile, and produces a variety of foods.  Nelyda has worked for four years planting beans, avocado, annatto, bananas, and corn in her six fields of fertile land.  She has a total of ten fields of land that can be cultivated, but she does not have the money to plant them.  The things she likes best about her work is to be able to spend most of her time in the fields, because she likes to be active.  She also receives help from her husband, who helps when he has free time.  He also works in construction as a bricklayer and plants green chiles, which are prized by Peruvian exporting companies.  Currently, she is concentrating on maintaining her avocado and banana crops that she will harvest in about two weeks.  She is sure she will earn a good profit.

Nelyda is a member of the community bank Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi, and this is her fifth loan with MFP, where she waits for their financial support to achieve her goals.  She promises once again to make her loan payments on time, as she has done with past loans.  She is thankful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  Nelyda will invest this loan in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her crops and tools that she needs to expand her fields.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.name: Solidario La Tinajita Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO LA TINAJITA
EL GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SOCIAS CELESTINA, ESTELA Y BERTILA LAS TRES YA OBTUVIERON UN CREDITO ANTERIOR CON FAPE, FUERON MUY CUMPLIDAS EN SUS PAGOS,CELESTINA ES SOLTERA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES A MANO, ESTELA TAMBIEN ES SOLTERA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES  Y A LA VENTA D. PAPAS FRITAS SU CARRETA LA SACA  EN LA TARD. PARA PODER VENDER SUS PAPAS, BERTILA ES CASADA TIENE DOS HIJAS PEQUEÑAS, ELLA SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES A MANO Y  TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SIEMBRAN ARVEJA  LAS TRES SOCIAS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA D. MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION D. GUIPILES.
texts.en:
'La Tinajita' solidarity group.

This group is maD. up of the following members: Celestina, Estela and Bertila.  These three ladies have already received a previous loan from FAPE and were very punctual in making their repayments.

Celestina is single and makes 'guipiles' (traditional blouses) by hand.  Estela is also single.  She makes 'guipiles' and sells fries from a cart.  She takes her cart out in the afternoons in order to sell her fries.  Bertila is married and has two young daughters.  She makes 'guipiles' by hand and also farms.  She and her husband grow peas.  The three members of this group are requesting a loan to buy raw materials for making 'guipiles'.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making 'guipiles' (traditional blouses)

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 37 años reside en la comunidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Angélica, su esposa desde hace 16 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Joyce, a la que cuidan con mucho cariño en su casa propia. Como hombre trabajador y responsable; Luis dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura, donde hace 6 años comenzó a trabajar las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que le fueron heredadas a su esposa. Ahí comenzó la siembra de plátano, ahora ya tiene café entre sus cultivos, intensificando así su producción. Además de recibir la capacitación de la cooperativa de la zona, donde vende el grano maduro de café. Produciendo así un café de mayor calidad cada año. Pero la actividad que le genera ganancias constantes, es la compra y venta de plátanos y frutas de temporada a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja constantemente. Después de acopiar la fruta a los agricultores de la zona se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad donde vende también su propia producción; obteniendo así mayores ganancias. Ahora el está pensando juntar mayor capital de trabajo con lo que pueda comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para que cumplir con sus objetivos. Luis de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de plátanos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, age 37, lives in the Alto Yapaz (central Peruvian jungle) community.  This is where he established his family with his wife of 16 years, Angélica.  They have a daughter, Joyce.  They take care of her with a lot of affection in their own house.

As a hard-working and responsible man, Luis devotes his time and effort to faming.  Six months ago he started to work the two hectares of farming land that his wife inherited.  He started by planting bananas.  Now he already has coffee amongst his crops, which is augmenting his production.  He also receives training from the cooperative in the area where he sells the mature coffee beans.  He thereby produces a better quality of coffee every year.

However, the business activity that generates steady income is buying and selling bananas and seasonal fruit.  He does this in the city of Huancayo, where he constantly travels.  After getting together the fruit from the farmers in the area, he heads to the wholesale market in the city.  That is where he also sells his own production.  That way he gets greater income.

He is now planning on getting together more working capital to buy more land to cultivate.  He belongs to the El Palomar al Éxito Communal Bank.  This is his first loan with MFP, where he hopes for their support in order to achieve his objectives.  Once he gets your support he will use the requested money to buy several kilos of bananas for his business.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La señora Rocío se dedica  la venta de comida en las noches y es profesora de educación física durante el día en un colegio de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital en este caso adquirirá mayor cantidad de arroz, fideo y demás insumos para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida. La señora vive en alquiler  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera  y no tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Rocío sells food in the evenings.  During the day she is a physical education teacher at a school in the city of La Paz.

She needs the loan to increase her capital.  This time she will get a greater quantity of rice, noodles, and other supplies.  She will do this in order to continue with her business of selling food.

She rents where she lives in the the Alto Sopacachi zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has no children.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and other supppplies for her business of selling food.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años reside en la comunidad nativa de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Herminio, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos a los que cuidan y protegen en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, producirla y vivir de ella. Es por ello que desde hace 25 años comenzó a sembrar café en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos y plátanos en sus 6 hectáreas siguientes. Lo que más le gusta es el cultivo de plátano, ya que cada 15 días cosecha los frutos maduros, obteniendo así ganancias continuas. Más le disgusta la época cuando los precios se inestabilizan en el mercado. Pero eso no la desanima, ya que continuamente recibe capacitaciones de la cooperativa donde vende sus sembríos de café y viaja continuamente a la ciudad de Huancayo; a vender sus cultivos de plátano. Además de ser una mujer hábil en los negocios; pues hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles vendiendo productos de primera necesidad donde obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora se encuentra en plena cosecha de café, donde está obteniendo una buena producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Julia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de arroz y azúcar para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Julia, age 46, lives in the native community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  This is where, 26 years ago, she established her family with her husband, Herminio.  They have five children who they take care off and protect in their own house.

Her main financial activity is farming.  When she was a young girl she was taught how to work the land, how to make it productive, and how to live from it.  That is why 25 years ago she started to grow coffee on her five hectares of land and bananas on the next six hectares.  

What she likes the most is growing bananas.  She likes it because every two weeks she harvests the mature fruit, thereby obtaining steady income.  What she likes the least is the time when the prices are not stable in the market.  

However, this does not discourage her because she receives continuous training from the cooperative where she sells her coffee crops.  She continually travels to the city of Huancayo to sell her banana crops.

She is skilled in  business, and a short time ago she opened a grocery store.  She sells basic needs products, and she gets good earnings.

She belongs to the El Palomar al Éxito Communal Bank.  This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes to receive your contribution in order to continue on with her objectives.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments as she has done with her previous loans.  

Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy several kilos of rice and sugar to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Celia Carlota

texts.es: Celia Carlota. ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas los tres tiempos negocio que ella inicio hace varios años nos cuenta que se siente contenta porque sus clientes han aumentado por esop nececita este credito para la compra de maiz y leña ya que esta convencida que nececita mas capital para trabajar el sueño mas grande de ella es superarse y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Celia Carlota sells tortillas three times a day.  She started her business several years ago and tells us that she feels happy because her number of customers has increased.  She needs this loan to buy corn and firewood as she is certain that she needs more capital in order to work.  Her biggest dream is to do well in life and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her tortilla bakery

loans.name: José

texts.es: El señor José se dedica a la elaboración de pasancalla (muy parecida al pop corn), fideo endulzado y arroz tostado y su esposa a su respectiva comercialización. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  azúcar, fideo y arroz para continuar con su negocio. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Progreso  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Señor José works making pasancalla (similar to popcorn), sweet noodles and toasted rice, and his wife has a separate business.  The loan he is requesting is for buying sugar, noodles and rice to continue his business.  He lives in his own house located in the Progreso zone in the city of El Alto, he is married and has two children. 

This is the first time he is applying for a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and noodles for he business making pasancalla (similar to popcorn), toasted rice, and sweet noodles.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, de 43 años reside en la zona de Yapaz Bajo (selva central peruana); junto a su papá Luis y su mamá Isabel a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia. Su razón de progreso y éxito, es su hijo Airton, de 17 años de edad y a pesar de que no viva junto a él; lo ama y le brinda una buena calidad de vida. Es por ello que hace 15 años, compró 10 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra café y plátanos en grandes cantidades. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es estar en el campo, cultivando y cuidando los sembríos que pronto darán frutos. Según cuenta en épocas de cosecha, se dedica a la compra y venta de café como acopiador a una empresa de producción, obteniendo así un dinero extra que suma también a la comercialización de sus propios granos. Pero la actividad a la que se dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, es el negocio de servicio de cabinas de Internet, locutorio (donde se hacen llamadas telefónicas) y cabinas de proyección de películas, es así que le va muy bien este negocio, ya que en la zona no existe un negocio igual, logrando ser él único en su rubro. Por ello está pensando mejorar cada día más en la atención y en el servicio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elvis, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más computadoras para aumentar el número de clientes en su negocio, asimismo en la remodelación del mismo.
texts.en:
Elvis is 43 years old and lives in Yapaz Bajo (in the central Peruvian rainforest) together with his dad Luis and his mom Isabel, who he cares for with a lot of love.  They live in their own home.

Elvis' reason for striving to make progress and be successful is his 17 year-old son Airton.  In spite of the fact that he does not live with him, he loves him and provides him with a good quality of life.  For this reason, more than 15 years ago, he bought ten hectares of farm land where he grows coffee and bananas in large quantities.  What he most enjoys about farming is being in the fields, growing and caring for his crops which will soon bear fruit.  He tells us that during harvest time he buys and sells coffee as a middleman for a production company.  This makes him some extra money which he adds to the money that he makes for selling his own products.  However, the business activity which Elvis spends most of his time on is his business offering Internet services, a public telephone service (where people make telephone calls) and booths where people can watch movies.  This business is doing very well since there are no other businesses like it in his area.  He is the only one who works in this field.  For this reason, he is always planning on improving his customer service and the services he provides.

Elvis belongs to the "El Palomar al Éxito" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation in helping him to carry out his plans.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  Elvis enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Elvis will invest the money he has requested in buying more computers so that he can increase his number of customers.  He will also refurbish his business.

loans.use: to buy more computers and refurbish his business

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Porfirio vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Porfirio trabaja en construcción civil y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en venta de comestible. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Porfirio requiere el préstamo para compra mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru) and is 51 years old.  Today, Porfirio lives in the same town where he was born. Porfirio works in civil construction and has a family business that sells foodstuffs.  It's been two years already that he's been working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Porfirio is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and much more.  The member is a responsible and hard-working man, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to join the "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es chofer; es socio propietario en el sindicato Litoral y su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción: cemento, arena, ladrillos y otros ya que construirá una habitación nueva. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Achachicala  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva
texts.en: Señor Mario es a driver; he is a member of the Litoral union and his wife works in a private company.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials: cement, sand, bricks and other items as he is building a new room.  He lives in his own house located in the Achachicala zone in La Paz city, and is married with four children.  This is the third time that his loan is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, to build a new room in his home.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 76 años de edad. Actualmente, Percy vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Percy es medico jubilado pero tiene una consultorio privado y trabaja junto con su esposa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Percy  requiere el préstamo para renovar el equipo médico.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Percy was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru), and is 76 years old.  Today, Percy lives in the city of Cusco.  Percy is a retired physician but he has a private practice and works together with his wife.  He has been in this business now for many years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  At this time, Percy requires the loan to renew his medical kit.  The member is a responsible and working person, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to participate in the "Chaska Nawi" Community Bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to renew his medical kit.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 38 años reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Rubén, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Oneyda y Nayely, a las que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia. Como mujer dedicada y trabajadora, todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde tiene 16 cuadras (medida de los terrenos de cultivo) de sembrío de café, cítricos, maíz, kion y fréjol. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en el cuidado de los cultivos y según cuenta, solo posee 10 cuadras y el resto lo alquila a terceras personas donde paga una mensualidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder compartir las responsabilidades junto a su esposo, quien la apoya en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos. Además cada 15 días va a la ciudad de  Pichanaki, donde comercializa sus frutos en el mercado central de la ciudad, obteniendo así mayor ganancias. Ahora comenzó con la cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, donde espera obtener buenas ganancias; ya que comenzó con la recolección plena de los granos maduros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Silvia de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos; asimismo en el pago del arriendo de su terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en: Silvia is 38 and lives in Shankivironi (in the Peruvian Amazon).  She has been married to Rubén for 20 years and they have two daughters: Oneyda and Nayely, who they care for in their own home.  Silvia works hard farming16 cuadras (a measure of farmland) of coffee, citrus, corn and beans. She has been farming for 20 years; of the land she works only10 cuadras is hers, and she pays rental fees to others for the rest.  She greatly enjoys working the land together with her husband, who helps her. Twice a month Silvia travels to the city of Pichanaki to sell her produce in the central market there.  Currently she is harvesting coffee and expects a good profit this year from the crop's beans.  This is Silvia's fourth credit with the lender “Los clavelitos de Shankivironi” and she is committed to prompt repayment, as she has done in prior loans.  She enjoys the interaction with other members of the lending association, who are helpful and responsible workers.  Silvia will use this credit to buy fertilizer to spread around her crops to increase yield, and will also use part of the loan to pay the land use fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land use fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood by the pallet

loans.name: Glades

texts.es:
Glades es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente,  tiene ocho hijos (5 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carne de ovino, alpaca y menudencias, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de quince alpacas.  Nos cuenta que las compra en las feria de Ilave para luego carnearlo y venderlo en el mercado San Miguel y Puno.  En el negocio le ayuda su papá.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia para el bienestar de sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas, la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el ahorro.
En la foto la vemos con su menor hija.
texts.en:
Glades is a member of the "San Miguel Arcángel II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has eight children (five of whom live independently).  She did not attend school.

Glades' first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in buying and selling sheep and alpaca meat and giblets.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.

Glades is requesting a new loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying fifteen alpacas.  She tells us that she buys her animals in Ilave market and then slaughters them and sells them in San Miguel and Puno markets.  Her dad helps her in her business.
