Glades' dream is to own her own home for the well-being of her children.  What she enjoys about her community bank are the talks, the punctuality, the responsibility and the savings.

In the photo we can see Glades and her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to buy fifteen alpacas

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, de 33 años reside en la cuenca alta de la selva central peruana (comunidad de las Palmas). Ahí formó su familia junto a Gregoria, su esposa desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Yerson y Rosmery, a los que quieren y educan en su casa propia. Como joven emprendedor y muy decidido, comenzó a trabajar en la actividad que le enseñaron sus padres. La agricultura, desde hace 10 años demostró todos sus conocimientos en la siembra de café, piña y cacao. De los cuales ahora dejó de sembrar café. Según mociona antes el kilo de café costaba un promedio de S/. 20 nuevos soles, teniendo una baja de S/. 8 soles. Por ese motivo dejó de dedicarse a la siembra de este producto, por lo que se dedicó la mayor parte de su tiempo en el cultivo de piña en su ½ hectárea de terreno agrícola, teniendo que alquilar más extensión de terreno para producir en mayor cantidad y así obtener buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comercializar sus productos a la capital del país donde puede comprar varias cosas que no se encuentran en su comunidad. Ahora está pensando juntar dinero suficiente para poder comprar más terrenos agrícolas propios. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Palmeras” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero, para seguir con su trabajo. Nelson, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su cultivo de piña, que está creciendo sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Nelson, aged 33, lives in the upper basin of the central Peruvian jungle (the las Palmas community).  There he has created his family with Gregoria, his wife of 10 years.  They have 2 sons, Yerson and Rosmery, who are loved and are educated in their own home.  

As an entrepreneurial and very determined young man, he began working in the occupation that his parents taught him: agriculture.  For 10 years, he has demonstrated all his skills in growing coffee, pineapple and cocoa, of which he has now stopped growing coffee.  As a result of fluctuations, a kilo of coffee that previously cost an average of 20 New Soles, is reaching a low at 8 Soles.  For that reason, he no longer engages in growing this product, and so he spends most of his time cultivating pineapple on ½ acre of agricultural land.  He has had to rent more land area to produce a greater quantity and so get good profits. 

What he likes best about his work is taking his products for sale in the capital, where he can buy various things that are not available in his community. Now he is thinking about putting together enough money to buy more of his own farmland.  He belongs to the communal bank "La Palmeras" and this is his first loan through MFP.  He is very glad to know he has the financial support to continue his work.  Nelson, once he has the support, will invest the money requested to buy 4 bags of organic manure to use on his pineapple crop, which is growing smoothly.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eliana; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ceviches, este  es un delicioso plato de bandera  frio hecho a  base de pescado y cebollas, la elaboración del ceviche es sencilla y la socia prepara con todos los insumos previamente comprados y frescos, La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes, pagar al proveedor del pescado que le deja, comprar utensilios de cocina entre otros gastos. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra.de ingredientes, pagos al proveedor, comprar utensilios de cocina.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the community bank IMASUMAC II, located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

Eliana is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She works buying and selling ceviche, a delicious cold dish made from fish and onions.  Making ceviche is simple and Eliana makes it with fresh ingredients she buys ahead of time.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients, pay the fish merchant, purchase kitchen utensils, and pay other expenses.  

Eliana appreciates the support she is given and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, pay her food providers, and purchase kitchen tools.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Rose has a business in a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Rose has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO,  to buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.   She also generates additional income through selling charcoal.  The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop.   Rose lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Isabel Catalina

texts.es: Isabel  nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 65 años de edad. Actualmente, Isabel vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Isabel es cesante de la biblioteca de la municipalidad del Cusco. Isabel también se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia como por ejemplo pantalones y otras cosas mas. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 65 years old.  She currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Isabel used to work in a library in Cusco.  She also sells clothes.  Isabel has been in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Isabel needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.

loans.name: Agam

texts.en:
Agam is 31 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, ages 15 and 7.  In 2000, she established her business of raising cows.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase a young dairy cow. 

In the future, Agam plans to  expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Delfina

texts.es: Ana Delfina: de 20 años y se dedica a la venta de artesanias como comfeccion de guipiles y elavoracion de delantales, actividad que lleva años de realizarlo y nos cuenta que esta muy agradecida con Dios ya que pues sU. ventas han prosperado y el encargo de sU. clientes han aumentado porque confecciona muy bonito y ya es reconocida por las prendas que confecciona ella nos cuenta que nececita el credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y asi seguir con su negocio, el sueño de ella es prosperar y tener un mejor futuro mas adelante.
texts.en:
20-year old Ana Delfina earns her living making and selling items such as traditional blouses and aprons. She’s been doing this work for a long time and is very grateful to God as her business has done well. She is getting more and more orders from her customers as she weaves beautifully and is well-known for the clothing she makes.

Ana needs a loan to buy supplies so she can continue with her weaving business. Her dream is to do well and to have a more prosperoU. future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her weaving business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Una madre muy esforzada es Cecilia, que cuida de sus 2 hijos  en la propiedad de sus padres que heredará a futuro. Tras la carencia económica, a pesar de tener un sueldo fijo como secretaria, vio la necesidad de tener un negocio. Ya son 2 años que ha tomado esta decisión, de vender cosméticos y productos de lencería a personas que conoce. Desde entonces los lleva a vender a sus clientes, ofreciéndolos en sus casas, dejándoles a crédito. Siempre mantiene el orden en su negocio, procura anotar el control de los productos que vende y de las deudas pendientes de cada cliente que tiene. Ahora se ha fijado metas para el futuro, ya que  su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias. Por tanto en adelante desea tener más mercadería y más clientes. Fue invitada a trabajar con MFP  de manera grupal y eso fue para ella una gran oportunidad de desarrollo que la impulsa a crecer y mejorar su actual negocio. Es reconocida por 4 oportunidades de crédito que tuvo, pues ahora desea renovar su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que espera de ustedes, comprará más mercadería de temporada y de esa manera incrementara su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: A hardworking mother - that's Cecilia, who takes care of her two children in her parents' house, which she will inherit in the future. With the economic downturn and being on a fixed income, she saw the need to have a business. She made this decision two years ago, to sell cosmetics and lingerie to people she knows. Since then, she has been selling to more customers, working with them in their homes, selling to them on credit. She always maintains order in her business; she attempts to record all the products she sells and the pending credit that each customer has. She has now set goals for the future since her business has brought in good revenue. In the future she would like to have more merchandise and more customers. She was invited to work with Kiva partner MFP through a group, and this was a great opportunity for her to develop her drive to grow and improve her business. She has received four loans in the past, and she now wants to renew her involvement and continue making her payments on time. With the loan she hopes to receive from you, she will purchase more seasonal merchandise and thus increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Pictured above is Alpha, a small-scale businessman in the township of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone.  Born in Kabala town, the 32 year-old husband and father of 2 children bakes and sells breads. He is also a motor-bike taxi driver. Alpha has been baking and selling breads for 10 years now. He has requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy baking flour to make more bread for sale.

loans.use: to buy baking flour in order to bake more bread for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; la socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a la elaboración de cerámicas y a la compra de artesanía, la socia trabaja vendiendo artesanía, la socia compra una parte de artesanía hecha y mantas tejidas en lana de alpaca y oveja, la socia también elabora mostacillas y les da el acabado final a las diferentes mostacillas para ser utilizadas en aretes, brasaletes y otros. La socia requiere el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de artesanía y la compra de diferentes trabajos ya hechos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Vilma is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She makes items from clay and also buys handicrafts which she sells.  Vilma buys some of her handicrafts ready made.  She buys blankets which are knitted from alpaca and sheep wool.  She also makes beads and gives them their finishing touches so that they can be used in making earrings, bracelets, etc.  She needs this loan to buy materials for making handicrafts and to buy pre-made items.

Vilma is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for making handicrafts and to buy pre-made items

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Juliet has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Juliet sells her products in a retail shop.   

Juliet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Juliet include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal.   Juliet lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 56 años de edad. Actualmente, Ricardina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ricardina se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad  Ricardina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Ricardina was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 56 years old.  She currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Her business is selling food as an itinerant street vendor in Huancaro market, in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for ten years and she is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Ricardina needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de una niña y vive en una propiedad que cuida en la que actualmente vive. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, y lo hace a domicilio, de esta manera todos los días sale a  ofrecer sus productos que muestra por catálogo. La marca que vende es de prestigio y eso la favorece en sus ventas, además su gran entusiasmo que tiene ha cumplido sus propias metas que la satisfacen personalmente y se propone tener ventas mayores para asegurarse en sus ganancias. Una de las ventajas que ha visto de su negocio es que recibe premios de la marca que vende por catálogo siempre y cuando supera la cantidad de productos, así puede incrementar sus ganancias. Son 4 ciclos de crédito que tiene con MFP de la cuales considera que es su mejor aliada para crecer y afrontar de manera oportuna su negocio, además cuando le ofrecen los cosméticos a un precio bajo por ello necesita ser comprada al contado. Por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con este dinero comprará más mercadería en cosméticos.
texts.en:
47 year-old Nélida is a single mother and has one daughter.  She lives in a property which she is looking after.  She has eight years experience selling cosmetics and makes her sales door to door.  Every day she goes out to sell the products that she shows her customers through her catalogs.  The brand she sells is a well known one and this favors her when it comes to making her sales.  Through her great enthusiasm, she has accomplished her own goals which makes her happy.  She plans to make more sales in order to safeguard her profits.

One of the advantages that Nélida has seen in this business is that she receives prizes from the brand that make the cosmetics she sells whenever she exceeds a certain quantity of products sold and this enables her to increase her profits.

Nélida has been working with MFP for four loan cycles.  She considers MFP to be her best ally in growing her business and responding to her customers in a timely manner.  When the company offers her cosmetics at a low price, she needs to pay for them in cash.  Nélida hopes to receive your support.  She will use this loan money to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda.  She is divorced and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Madina has been selling charcoal for 6 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  Her goal for her business is to move exclusively into wholesale sales.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 62 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la administración de sus propio negocio la socia tiene una picantería desde hace 20 años atrás ella misma atiende y cocina para sus clientes, la socia es muy conocida de su vecindad y muy querida, ella también lleva a las ferias comida típica elaborada junto con sus dos hijas, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor así como arroz, fideos, carne y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de sus diferentes platillos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Gregoria, she is 62 years old and is married with 6 children who are now all independent.  The member works managing her own business.  She has had a cookhouse for 20 years where she serves and cooks for her customers.  The member is well known in her neighborhood and much loved.  She also brings traditional local dishes to the markets, she prepares the food together with her two daughters. The member requires the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of ingredients at wholesale, such as rice, noodles, meat, and other ingredients for her different dishes. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of dues

loans.use: to invest in purchasing ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children aged 26, 22, 20 and 18.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Sanu plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yessica; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas y también vende gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurante. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant como ollas y platos y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, papa y verduras.     
                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” community bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Yessica, she is 23 years old, has one son and lives with her partner. She makes her daily activities fit around her work in the restaurant business, where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as soda and beer. Yessica works from 8:00am till 10:00pm. It is through this business, which she would like to grow, that she provides her child with a good education.  

Yessica is requesting a loan for the restaurant, to buy pots and dishes, as well as cooking ingredients such as rice, potatoes and vegetables. 

She is happy to be receiving this loan and committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy pots and dishes, as well as cooking ingredients such as rice, potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco” ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 44 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (2 independientes), estudió educación secundaria incompleta.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados como ovinos y vacunos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace catorce años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos vacas, dice que las compra en las ferias D. Yunguyo, Zepita, y las engorda por 2-3 meses, para luego venderlas.  También nos cuenta que su esposo trabaja como chofer y realiza servicio D. transporte en su auto.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias. 

En la foto se muestra junto al auto D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Juana is a partner of the "San Juan D. Tahuaco" Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, in the Yunguyo province and department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, and is married with 6 children (2 of whom are independent).  She studied up to an incomplete secondary education level.

Together with her husband, she works buying and selling livestock like sheep and cattle.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for fourteen years; her first loan was 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 3000 Soles, she will buy two cows.  She says that she will buy them at the markets in Yunguyo and Zepita, and fatten them for 2-3 months, then sell them later.  She also tells us that her husband works as a driver, providing a transportation service with his car.

Her dream is to improve the business and thus improve their income.  What she likes about the Community Bank are the meetings with the members.

In the photo she is shown next to her husband's car.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery tiene 43 años, es divorciada y disfruta de la compañía de sus 3 hijos en una  casa que le cedieron su familia. Tiene 10 años de experiencia criando animales menores como cuyes y gallinas  en su misma casa. Siempre esta al pendiente de los cuidados necesarios para sus animales ya que de eso depende para que puedan crecer sanos. Es así que es muy cuidadosa en la limpieza de la granja y en la alimentación ya que son vitales para que sean saludables. Al cabo de un tiempo los lleva a vender en la feria local de su comunidad, adicionalmente lleva granos como cebada, maíz seco entre otros  para comercializarlo ya que tiene un puesto de ventas  en la feria. Sus hijos la ayudan siempre en el transporte así como en la venta de granos y animales. Este negocio le permite tener  ingresos de manera estable y por tanto su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de animales en su granja. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP, recuerda que fue invitada por una vecina a formar el grupo que actualmente permanece y se ha convertido en una de las integrantes con mayor trayectoria que ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. El dinero lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería en granos y cuyes como pollos de mejor raza para mejorar la raza de sus animales.
texts.en:
Nery, 43, is divorced and enjoys the company of her 3 kids in a house given to them by her family.  She has 10 years experience raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens from home.  She is always on the lookout for the necessary care for her animals, which they need so they can grow up healthy.  Similarly, she is very careful cleaning the farm and with the food, as these are vital for the animals to be healthy. 

After some time she brings them to sell at the local market in her community.  She also brings grains such as barley and dried corn amongst other things to the market, where she has a market stall.  Her children always help with the transportation and the selling of the grains and animals. This business allows her to have a stable income, and for this reason she wishes to increase the number of animals on her farm. 

This will be her 15th loan with MFP.  She recalls being invited by a neighbor to join the group, where she currently remains and has become one of the most experienced members.  She has proven to be responsible and punctual in her payments.  Therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you. The money will be used to purchase merchandise such as grain and guinea pigs and chickens of the best breed to improve the breeding of her animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, and also buy corn and barley.

loans.name: Gloria Hermelinda

texts.es: Gloria nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 60 años de edad. Actualmente, Gloria vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Gloria es costurera de profesión y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Gloria requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tela, hilos y botones. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 60 years old.  She currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Gloria is a dressmaker by profession and she has a small sewing workshop in her home.  She has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Gloria needs a loan to buy materials such as fabric, threads and buttons.  Gloria is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, threads and buttons

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados y también tiene una combi que hace servicio publico en la ciudad de Cusco, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y cuyes y también para mantenimiento de su carro.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the "Virgen Purificada - Angostura" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelly is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She fattens the animals and then sells them in different markets.  In addition, Nelly has a small minibus that provides a public service in the city of Cusco.  Through these businesses, she gets her son ahead in life.  Nelly would like to expand and improve both her animal business and her transport business.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and also to have maintenance work carried out on her vehicle.

Nelly is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and also to have maintenance work done on her vehicle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.  Hellen has a food stall where she sells yellow and sweet bananas.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start getting her yellow bananas directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: Soukeinatou

texts.fr: Dame de 47ans,  Soukiénétou est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation (sucre, riz, huile végétale…) à domicile. Elle est à son premier crédit et veut renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises.  Son mari est retraité. Elle veut voir ses 04 enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions, avoir sa propre boutique pour mieux s’installer. Elle a démarré en 2009 et s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: A 47 year old woman, Soukiénétou is a reseller of food products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil...) at home.  She is on her first loan and wants to strengthen her business by buying more goods.  Her husband is retired.  She wants to see her four children grow up in good conditions, to have her own store, to be better settled.  She started in 2009 and stocks up at the market in Lome.

loans.use: to buy food products (sugar, rice).

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella es una mujer valiente, es divorciada y vive con sus dos hijos en su propiedad. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de carne de ovejas y cerdos, animales que adquiere en la feria ganadera y los beneficia para venderlos en su puesto de ventas que es una carnicería que queda en el mercado central  dentro de su ciudad. Empezó con este negocio con la venta de carne de cerdo, de la cual pudo recuperar y tener una buena ganancia, desde entonces compra más animales. Ahora su prioridad es comprarse una refrigeradora que le permita guardar su mercadería y mantenerla en buenas condiciones. Además cuenta siempre con el apoyo de sus hijos para las diversas actividades de su negocio como el transporte y la venta. Estrella esta muy deseosa de continuar en su negocio que le permite sostener a su familia  por lo que ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo. Son 23 oportunidades de crédito que tiene y un buen record positivo que habla de su responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos, razón por la cual esta muy contenta  porque durante este tiempo de trabajo con MFP le ha servido para mejorar su capital de trabajo. Por ello pide una colaboración para pueda continuar con su trabajo. Ahora su dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más animales ya que han aumentado de precio y desde tenerlos como reservas.
texts.en:
Estrella is a strong woman, she is divorced and lives with her two children on her own property.   She has 20 years experience in selling meat from sheep and pigs, animals that she acquires at the cattle market and then benefits from selling at her sales location, which is a butchery in the central market in her city. She started this business selling pork, from which she was able to obtain and keep a nice profit.  Since then, she has bought more animals. Now her priority is to buy a refrigerator that will allow her to store her merchandise and keep it in good condition.  In addition, she also always counts on the support of her children for activities related to her business, such as transport and sales. 

Estrella is very eager to continue in her business, which allows her to support her family.  This is why she has decided to increase her working capital. She has had 23 opportunities for loans, and has a good positive payment record which speaks to her responsibility and commitment to her payments.

She is very happy because during this time working with MFP, it has served her in improving her working capital.  Therefore she calls for collaboration so that she can continue with her work.  Now your money will be invested in the purchase of more animals, because they have already increased in price and she can hold them as reserves.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: Luz Aurora nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 69 años de edad. Actualmente, Luz Aurora vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Luz Aurora es cesante de enfermería y junto con su esposo tienen un consultorio médico. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Luz Aurora requiere el préstamo para renovar los equipos quirúrgicos. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Luz Aurora was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 69 years old.  Currently, Luz Aurora lives in the same town where she was born.  Luz Aurora is a former nurse, and along with her ​​husband has a doctor's office.  She has been working in this business for 12 years now, and it is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

At this time, Luz Aurora is asking for the loan to renew their surgical kit.  

The member is a responsible and hard-working woman, and it was for these qualities that her colleagues invited her to participate in "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to renew their surgical kit.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Aristides; El socio tiene 51 años de edad, el socio es separado, El socio tiene 2 hijos, El socio se dedica a la elaboración de cerámicas y también el trabaja en un taller  de venta de artesanía. El socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para elaborar unas vasijas y poder vender. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arcilla, pinceles, oxidos naturales y para el alquiler del horno para la cocción de las vasijas.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señor Aristides; he is 51 years old and is separated  with 2 children.  The member works creating ceramics and also works in a shop selling handicrafts. The member requires the loan to buy materials to make some pottery and to be able to sell it. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of materials such as clay, brushes, natural oxides and for the rental of a kiln for firing the pottery.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to him, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of his dues.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing materials.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bacilia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde cultiva verduras como cebollas, repollos y zanahorias y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado De Cusco que se llama Vinocanchon, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para su terreno de cultivo.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” (Purified Virgin - Angostura).  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Bacilio, she is 37 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children.  The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling vegetables; she has a plot of cultivated land where she grows vegetables such as onions, cabbage and carrots and then sells it as a street vendor in the Cuzco market that's called Vinocanchon.  Through this business, the member is moving her children ahead in life.   

The member wants to expand and improve her cultivated land. The member is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land.

The partner is happy about the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los  girasoles , sus representantes  le pusieron así por que el girasol es una flor muy linda ,entre arbusto sucio  pero sin embargo se ve linda, llena  de esperanza igual ellas ,están llenas de sueños y fundación realidad le da la oportunidad de asearlo realidad.
Esta  ubicado en la localidad  del Carrizo estado de Oaxaca , esta conformado por  doce integrantes.
El representante  del grupo es la señora Amelia , tiene la escolaridad de la secundaria terminada , tiene dos hijos una mujer y un varón, la niña se llama Natalia de  doce años de edad, y julio de  dieciocho años de edad, ella necesitaba el préstamo para  la compra de alimentos ,es que vede antojitos mexicanos en las noches .
Sus clientes  necesitan un lugar mas grande , así que con sus ganancias piensa hacer
mas grande su local .
La señora Amelia  deseaba  este préstamo  para aumentar las ganancias de su negocio 
y así hacer  de su negocio  un lugar mas grande , uno de sus sueños es hacer  un restaurante para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus  seres queridos que son sus hijos.
Otro de los representantes es la señora  Analy  también forma parte del grupo  , tiene  veinte años  estudio hasta la secundaria , tiene un hijo de  cuatro meses , ella necesitaba el préstamo para comprar mas ropa ella se dedica ala venta y compra  de ropa , pues ella se dedica ala venta y compra de ropa.
Sus clientes le aconsejan de que ponga su local para que cuando ella no tenga tiempo de irlos a visitarlos  ellos pueden ir a su local y ver la ropa que le llega, para ya no sacarla de la bolsas si  no que ya las tenga exhibidas.
Uno de sus sueños es ese  hacer mas grande su negocio  para tener mas contentos a   sus
clientes y así tener mas ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida
A largo plazo desea hacerse de una buting.
Los otros diez integrantes  se llaman :
María Luisa – para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María  Adelina-para la venta de quesos.
María Gregoria- para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ricarda _ para la  venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosario-para hacer mas grande su cocina económica.
Francisca Galacia-para la    venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita-para la venta de ropa.
Gregoria-para la venta de ropa.
Adelia-para la venta de pollos.
Reina –para la venta de quesos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers).  The group representatives gave it that name because the sunflower is a very beautiful flower.  Even though the sunflower is among messy shrubs, it still looks beautiful.  It looks full of hope, just like they are.  They are full of dreams, and the Fundación Realidad gives them the opportunity to make them come true.

The communal bank is located in Carrizo in the state of Oaxaca.  It is comprised of 12 members.  Amelia is the representative of the group.  She has a high school education.  She has two children, a daughter and a son.  Her daughter, Natalia, is 12 years old.  Julio is 18 years old.  She needs the loan to buy food.  She sells Mexican snacks in the evenings.  Her customers need a larger place.  She plans to use her earnings to make her place bigger.

Amelia wanted this loan in order to increase the income from her business.  That way she will make her place of business bigger.  One of her dreams is to establish a restaurant in order to have a better quality of life for herself and her loved ones, who are her children.

Analy is another of the representatives, and she also forms part of the group.  She is 20 years old, and she went to school up to high school.  She has a four month old son.  She needs the loan to buy more clothes.  She devotes herself to selling and buying clothes.  Her customers advise her to set up a sales location so that when she does not have time to go see them, they can go to her place to see the clothes that she receives.  They will do that so that they are not paying for what they have not seen.

One of her dreams is to have a larger business in order to make her customers happier.  That way she will have more income in order to have a better quality of life.  In the long term she wishes to have a boutique.

The other ten members’ names and reasons for the loan are:

María Luisa – to sell Mexican snacks.
María  Adelina-to sell cheese
María Gregoria- to sell Mexican snacks.
Ricarda - to sell Mexican snacks.
Rosario-to increase her prepared food sales. 
Francisca Galacia- to sell Mexican snacks.
Margarita-to sell clothes.
Gregoria- to sell clothes.
Adelia-to sell chickens.
Reina –to sell cheese.

loans.use: to buy and sell food.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; la socia es casada La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia vende en el mercadillo de tica tica verduras, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras ella tiene un stand en el mercadillo y vende verduras, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maria, who is married.  The member works buying and selling vegetables, she sells the vegetables in the street market of Tica Tica.   The member works buying and selling vegetables.  She has a stall at the street market where she sells vegetables.  The member requires the loan to invest in buying vegetables at wholesale.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with her repayments.

loans.use: to be able to invest in purchasing vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen foods

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas, naranjas, platanos entre otras frutas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria y también la socia trabaja en la municipalidad de Anta en el área de camal, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the “Richary Antena” communal bank, located in the province and district of Anta, in  Cusco department. 

Gladys is 33 years old, living with someone, and has 3 children. Daily, she sells fruit, such as apples, oranges, and plantains, among others, in the streets of her area and, also, in the Camal area of Anta municipality. Gladys is advancing her children by working in this manner.

Gladys wants to expand her fruit-selling business and she is requesting a loan to buy fruit at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy fruit at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (1 independiente).  La señora no cuenta  con estudios.
Desde hace  un año  trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales  caseros como ovinos y porcinos.
Con éste nuevo crédito de  S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará  un toro para su respectivo engorde por dos meses, para luego venderlo en la localidad de Yunguyo. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y esposo.
Como muchas mujeres en Puno, también se dedica a la chacra como papa, habas, occa, tarwi.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y los ahorros que ganan.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “San Juan de Tahuaco” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 51 years old and has four children (one of whom lives independently).  Juana did not attend school.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling animals such as sheep and pigs.

With this new loan for 2,000 soles, Juana will buy a bull which she will fatten for two months.  She will then sell it in the town of Yunguyo.  Her children and her husband help her in her business.

Like many women in Puno, Juana also has a farm where she grows potatoes, beans, okra and 'tarwi' (a species of lupin that is grown for its edible bean).

Juana's dream is to improve her livestock and thereby improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a bull to fatten

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de tractor, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y también la socia tiene un negocio de venta de helados, ella reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden helados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados y comprar repuestos de tractor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos e insumos para preparar los helados.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “RICHARY ANTEÑA.”  The bank is located in Anta District, which belongs to the province of Anta and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Rosini.  She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her day between her household duties and her business selling spare tractor parts.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  Sra. Rosini also has a business selling ice cream.  She distributes her ice cream to various ice cream stores.  She wants to expand her ice cream business and to purchase spare tractor parts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase the spare parts and to buy ice cream making supplies.
                                                      
The member is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and ice-cream making supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan es una joven de 20 años y vive con sus progenitores en la propiedad que tienen desde hace muchos años atrás. Trabaja en un negocio familiar que fundaron sus padres desde hace más de 20 años vendiendo artículos ferreteros, es lo que aprendió durante toda su vida. Es así que decide independizarse en la venta de artículos ferreteros en el mismo local de ventas que tiene sus padres. Esta forma de trabajar  lo hace desde hace 2 años y le permite solventar económicamente la carrera que esta estudiando, pero tiene planes de crecer y tener su propio local de ventas. Ahora su fin es adquirir diferentes artículos de ferretería que son de su propio capital, como yeso, pernos, tubos de conexión. Considera que es de suma importancia para su negocio trabajar con los créditos que obtiene con MFP, que le permite incrementar poco a poco su capital y genera en ella el habito de la responsabilidad para afrontar sus cuentas además de que disfruta de ser parte del banco comunal a la que pertenece  porque son personas confiables de las cuales viene llevando hasta la fecha 6 ciclos de préstamo grupal. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder concretar sus estudios e independizarse en su negocio. Con el dinero comprará más mercadería en los artículos ferreteros que vende.
texts.en:
Susan is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the home they’ve owned for many years. She works in the family hardware business that her parents started more than twenty years ago. She learned all about the business as she grew up.

Two years ago she decided to become self-sufficient and sell hardware at the same stall as her parents. This allowed her to pay for her studies. But she also has plans to expand and have her own stall.

Currently Susan’s goal is to obtain different types of hardware using her own money such as plaster, bolts, and pipe connectors. She believes that the loans she obtains from Kiva partner MFP are very important for her business as they allow her to gradually increase her working capital. They also make her take responsibility for the repayments. She also enjoys being part of the community bank whose members are very trustworthy. To date she has been part of six group loans. 

Susan is counting on assistance from many donors so she can complete her studies and start her own business. With the money she will buy more hardware items for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware business

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De La Giralda Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES DE LA GIRALDA:
La señora Natividad día a día se dedica a su actividad económica que es la compra y venta de laurel, ya que hace quince años ella se a dedicado a esta actividad para el sostenimiento de su familia ya que su esposo es de escasos recursos económicos y ella lo ha apoyado para sacar adelante a su familia ya que no cuentan con otro recurso económico mas que lo de su negocio y se dedica un poco a la crianza de animales y tejidos típicos hechos a mano. Dolores, ella es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales, ya que ella es una persona que vive sola y ella día con día se dedica a su actividad económica  para sostenerse  ya que su esposo a fallecido y ella a salido adelante por si sola. También se dedica a la venta de chuchitos, Tamales y chile rellenos  ya que a ella ya la conocen bien  y las personas le hacen pedidos de sus productos por eso ella quiere ayuda a su capital.
ellas estan solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccin de tejidos.
texts.en:
'Mujeres la Giralda' group:

Natividad works daily in her business buying and selling bay leaves.  She has been working in this business to support her family for 15 years.  Her husband is of limited financial means and so she has supported him in getting their family ahead in life as they don't have any other financial income than that provided by her business.  Natividad also raises a few animals and makes traditional woven products by hand.

Dolores is a hard-workiing woman who makes traditional woven products by hand and raises animals.  She lives alone and works in her business daily in order to support herself.  Her husband is dead and she has been getting ahead on her own.  She also sells 'chuchitos' (Guatemalan tamales), tamales and stuffed chilis.  She is well known and people order her products from her.  For this reason, she would like some help in increasing her capital.

The two ladies are requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making woven products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como ganados, ovejas y chanchos, la socia vende animales en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar comida para los animales.  
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Elena Emperatriz, a member of “RICHARY ANTEÑA”, a Communal Bank located in Anta, a district of the Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Elena Emperatriz is 70 years old, she is single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she sells animals such as livestock, sheep and pigs. She sells them in the different fairs of the Anta province. She wishes to increase and improve her animals sale activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy animals and animal feed.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Akuvi Séfako

texts.fr: Dame de 26ans,  Akuvi est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation (sucre, riz, huile végétale…) dans un bar nommé « SANS SOUCI ». Elle est à son premier crédit et veut renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises. Son mari est gestionnaire. Elle veut voir ses 02 enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Elle a démarré en 2008 et s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: A 26 year old woman, Akuvi is a reseller of food products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil...) in a bar called "SANS SOUCI" ("CAREFREE").  She is on her first loan and wants to strengthen her business by buying more goods.  Her husband is a manager.  She wants to see her two children grow up in good conditions.  She started her business in 2008 and stocks up at the market in Lome.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.fr: Gérant d’une boutique (ETS BON PRIX) depuis 2006, Moustafa est un jeune homme dynamique de 32ans. Il est spécialisé dans la vente des produits congelés (saucisse, poissons, ailes de poules) et des produits d’alimentation générale (tomate, spaghetti, sucre, lait). Il achète au grand marché de Lomé et veut assurer  sa vie avant de se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Manager of a store (ETS BON PRIX) (ETS GOOD PRICE) since 2006, Moustafa is a 32 year old, young, dynamic man.  He specializes in the sale of frozen food (sausage, fish, chicken wings) and basic food products (tomatoes, spaghetti, sugar, milk). He buys at the main market in Lome and wants to make his life secure before embarking on married life.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maricela; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carne de res, ella lleva a diferentes tipos de ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta como la feria de Inquilpata y tiene un puesto en el mercado de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Maricela, a member of “RICHARY ANTEÑA”, a Communal Bank located in Anta, a district of the Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Maricela is 45 years old, she is married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she buys and sells beef. She works in the different fairs of the Anta province, such as the Inquilpata fair, and she also has a stall in the Anta market. She wants to increase her meat selling activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy meat at wholesale price.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale price.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia’s motivation for starting her business, Stokes and Company, was born of a passion for used and re-purposed items. She developed this passion from garage sale “treasure hunting” excursions taken with her mother as a child. As she got older, Dalia realized that she also had a natural talent for decorating and design. With this combination of talent and passion as her guide, she started her own antique, clothing and women’s services store in Abilene, Texas.

Dalia attributes the quick rise and success of her business to her relentless hard work along with the efforts of her husband and two children. When she first started Stokes and Company 5 years ago, it was a small booth inside of an antiques mall. “My husband persuaded me to follow my dreams, so I opened the booth. Within 6 months, it tripled in size; 6 months after that, we expanded to our own location. After 5 years, we moved from a 1200-square-foot store to our current location, nearly three times that size,” she says. Without the persistent dedication of her family, who have done everything from manage the business to repairing its buildings, Dalia believes this success would never have been possible.

Stokes and Company offers its customers used and reupholstered furniture, antiques, home décor items, and clothing for women. She says that her business takes old furniture and, using her natural eye for design, repairs it to give it a “new life.” In her own words, “I feel like my business is like a jewelry box: you’ll never know what you can find when you go in there. That’s what sets me apart from others.” She believes that the unique service she provides and her store’s constantly changing inventory compel her clients to return to Stokes and Company.

In the future, Dalia hopes to continue offering her customers one-of-a-kind service while expanding her business to cater to the everyday needs of women. In its new location, Dalia has split the store into two parts: one for the antiques and furniture shop and the other to serve as a studio to create custom pieces for customers. She also added a waxing salon to bring her business closer to the goal of catering to the diverse needs of her women customers.

With this loan, Dalia will expand her inventory to fit the needs of her business’ new space. While the move to a 3500-square-foot location is necessary, this means that her current inventory covers only about 1/3rd of that space. After realizing that a commercial bank would not fit her business needs, Dalia reached out to Kiva's partner ACCION Texas-Louisiana. With this loan, Dalia will not only continue to serve her loyal clients, but she will expand her services to meet the needs of an even more diverse part of her community.

loans.use: to pay for inventory expansion.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo started his St. Rose, Louisiana-based staffing business, "My TBS, LLC", because he has always liked being independent. He also gets great enjoyment from watching business ideas mature and develop. Balancing his business, marriage, and four children along with a full-time career spanning 18 years, Ricardo also enjoys being busy. He describes himself as a stereotypical entrepreneur: “I’m goal and big-picture oriented. I’m very good at aligning myself to my goals and driving to success.”

Ricardo’s business connects qualified blue and white collar workers to businesses that need their services. He says, “We contract employees in fields from IT and computer technology to grass mowing and labor.” Currently, Ricardo runs his business “lean and mean,” with himself as the only full-time employee. All of his other employees are the contract workers that he has connected to his business clients, of which there are about ten currently.

Ricardo believes that his business’ biggest success is its ability to connect talented individuals with businesses that need them. “Success is when you are able to provide employment for qualified people. Even as a contract worker, you are on contract for two years or better; that’s gainful employment. That is success.” 

Working in the staffing business is a constant challenge, Ricardo states. The ongoing obstacles presented by an ever-changing job market require him to regularly retool, redirect and redevelop his business and its practices. He also says that, because opportunities open and close so quickly in his business, the need to prioritize and manage resources properly is an ever-present challenge. The way he has been able to overcome these challenges is, as he says, by “knowing the business. The more you know, the better equipped you are to handle the demands of the job.”

In the future, Ricardo hopes to see his business become 100% self-sufficient. Currently, he continues his full-time work in his professional career while managing My TBS on the side. While he likes the financial security this provides him and his family, he would one day like to be able to rely totally on his business.

This loan will allow Ricardo to meet the demands of several quick turn-over projects in his business’ future. “In this business, you have to be ready to move on opportunities quickly. You can’t afford to be slow while pursuing opportunities that open up.” The cash he will get from this loan will allow Ricardo to jump on upcoming opportunities at a competitive speed. It will allow him to continue to serve his business clients, his workers and his community by providing gainful employment to those who need it.

With his 18 years of experience in mind, Ricardo has this to say to aspiring business owners: “Only when you’ve had a lot of knock downs and bruises are you poised to experience success. Stay with it, get the training you need, and learn your business. If you don’t see success the first time, drop back and go at it again. Learn from your mistakes.” This wisdom has carried Ricardo to success, and this loan will help him continue to build on what he’s learned.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming staffing contracts.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina y fideos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Richary Anteña" located in the district of Anta, belonging to the Anta province and Cusco department. 

The member is Mrs. Clorinda. She is 43 years old, in a committed relationship and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of a grocery store where she sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, flour and beans. The member works from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. The member wants to expand her grocery business. She seeks the loan in order to purchase products wholesale for the grocery store. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase products wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jorge Heberto

texts.es: Jorge Heberto tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de leña y leche. Tiene más de 30 años en su negocio por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar cada día su negocio, algunas veces no tiene muchas ganancias debido a fuertes lluvias y algunos clientes no le compran, pero esto no lo detiene a salir adelante con su actividad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña en gran cantidad y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Jorge Heberto has three children who are all underage. He works selling wood and milk. He has been in this business for more than 30 years. Every day he seeks ways to improve his business. During some periods he has a low income because of heavy rains that prevent his customers from buying his goods. However, this doesn't prevent him from getting ahead in his business. The loan he is requesting is to purchase large quantities of wood so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeny; la socia tiene  28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 1 hijo la socia tiene un bebe y ella es enfermera de profesión, la socia por el momento no está ejerciendo su profesión porque su bebe aún requiere de ella la mayor parte del tiempo, la socia los días sábados va a vender verduras en el mercadillo de tica tica, ella tiene en casa un pequeño huerto en el cual produce verduras y los lleva a vender de forma minorista en el mercadillo para poder generar un ingreso extra mas en casa. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Imasumac II" which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Yeny. She is 28 years of age, in a committed relationship and has one child, a baby. She is a nurse by profession who at the moment is not practicing her profession because her baby still requires the greater part of her time. On Saturday the member goes to sell produce in the small marketplace of Tica Tica. She has at home a small vegetable garden where she produces vegetables, and takes them to the market to sell at retail in order to generate some extra income for her household. 

The member appreciates the support that is given and thus promises to make her payments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing her crops.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de fruta ella trae de lugares como Quillabamba, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, platanos, uvas y mandarinas y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar y verduras. 
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Richary Anteña" which is located in the district of Anta belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Maruja. She is 40 years of age, in a committed relationship and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of a restaurant where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner. She also has a business selling fruit which she brings from places such as Quillabamba. By means of this business the member gets her children ahead. The member is seeking the loan to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarin oranges as well as to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, sugar and vegetables. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make good on her payments.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarin oranges as well as ingredients for cooking such as rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel describes his business, "C. Collision and Auto Repair", as a family affair. The staff is comprised of Israel, his father and his brother. With a true entrepreneurial spirit, he states that the reason for starting his business was, simply, that “nobody was hiring.” With combined 40 years of experience, Israel and his family were able to take the grim reality of the economic downturn and turn it into a business opportunity.

The road to a successful business, Israel says, hasn’t been an easy one. When he opened his business, which offers a wide range of automobile services from mechanical repairs to body work, it was located in a small shop in a residential neighborhood that wasn’t a prime location for a body shop. The most successful business choice C. Auto Repair has made since it opened was moving from its original shop in Rueda, Texas, to a larger shop in Dallas. Of this choice, Israel says, “We took a leap of faith and moved to Dallas, and we just started growing based on referrals alone.”

While he is happy about the business’ success in its new location, Israel is constantly driving to grow and expand the services he offers. “In the future, I would really like to offer full-service everything – state inspections and alignments in a year or two, and, eventually, one or two other locations,” he says. Getting to this future goal involves tireless work from Israel and his family – the shop is open for business 7 days a week, and Israel is typically there from open to close.

With this loan, C. Auto Repair was able to attain the operating capital needed to begin working in its new location. A large portion of the loan was used to install the plumbing systems necessary to get certified by the state. The remainder allowed Israel to buy an inspection machine, which will be used to further him toward his goal of turning C. Auto into a full-service shop.

Israel’s business ethic is rooted in a dedication to good customer service. The advice that he gives to aspiring business owners is that “the biggest thing is return customers; always take care of your customers, and in return they will take care of you.” This loan has allowed Israel to continue doing work he loves, expand his family business and continue to reliably serve the automobile needs of his Dallas community.

loans.use: to pay for plumbing repairs and purchase a state vehicle inspection machine.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y leche, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las distintas ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne y leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne y leche al por mayor.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the "Richary Anteña" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Teofila is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling meat and milk.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in the street markets in Anta province.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Teofila would like to expand her business selling meat and milk.  She is requesting this loan to buy meat and milk wholesale.

Teofila is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat and milk wholesale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Yolanda radica por mas de 20 años en Huancayo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Vende ropa y accesorios para bebes, niños pequeños y personas adultas desde hace más de 6 años en un puesto de ventas que tiene en la feria comercial de su localidad. Asimismo se establece en otros puestos cuando hay ferias en otras localidades, por el momento su negocio realiza de manera ambulante y dispone de su carpa para armar provisionalmente su puesto de ventas. Manifiesta que su negocio es rentable porque compra su mercadería al por mayor  directamente de las fabricas de confección de ropa porque es ahí donde consigue  mayor variedad a menor precio. Se entero de los créditos que otorga MFP por medio de un familiar y desde ese entonces ya son 23 veces en las que tiene un préstamo de manera grupal y considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia de trabajo solidario que hoy es su gran aliada en el desarrollo de su negocio. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. En esta ocasión con el dinero comprará más ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda has lived in Huancayo for more than 20 years.  She lives together with her husband and her four children.

Yolanda's business is selling clothes and accessories for babies, small children and adults.  She has been in this business for more than six years.  She makes her sales from a stall in the street market in her town.  She also sets up her stall when there are street markets in other towns.  Right now, she makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and has an awning that she uses to temporarily set up her sales stall.  Yolanda tells us that her business is profitable because she buys her merchandise wholesale directly from clothes factories.
