Lleva 6 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.  Se dedica a la confección de toallitas secadoras y los vende en la tienda de una amiga.  Cada vez que reúne cierta cantidad lo entrega para ponerlas en vitrina y exhibirlas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 9 metros de tela para toalla, 6 rollitos de cinta satinada, un paquete de hilos combinados, 1 rollito de pasa cinta, un ciento de aplicaciones.
Al quedarse viuda (hace un año) ha tenido que trabajar para poder tener un poco de tranquilidad y también para criar a su último hijo quien todavía depende de ella.
Con Manuela Ramos ha encontrado la facilidad de tener un crédito, que le permite generar sus ingresos y sobre todo poder pagar sus cuotas del préstamo con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Rhode is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” cooperative bank, located in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 58 years old, a widow, and has three children.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 6 years.  She dedicates herself to making little drying towels and sells them in a friend’s store.  Each time she gathers a certain quantity, she delivers them so they can be put in display cases and exhibited.

With her new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 9 meters of fabric for towels, 6 rolls of satin ribbon, one packet of assorted threads, 1 roll of bias tape, one hundred appliques.

At becoming a widow (one year ago) she has had to work to be able to have a little peace, and also to raise her youngest son who still depends on her.

With Manuela Ramos, she has found the facility to have credit, which permits her to generate income and, above all, be able to pay her loan installments with tranquility.

loans.use: buy fabric for towels at wholesale.

loans.name: Sobeida Elvira

texts.es:
Sobeida Elvira es una fémina trabajadora, emprendedora y entusiasta quien inicio vendiendo artesanías de manera ambulante en el Salvador pero como la situación socioeconómica no era la misma y las ventas bajaron decidió invertir en otro negocio. Ella desde hace un año que está comercializando productos plásticos por mayor en las distribuidoras, ventas y pulperías quienes son sus clientes.
El crédito lo invertirá en productos plásticos vasos, platos, tasas, cucharas, tenedor, cuchillos, panas…etc.
texts.en:
Sobeida Elvira is a hard-working, entrepreneurial, and enthusiastic woman who began selling handicrafts as a street vendor in Salvador.  However, as the socioeconomic situation was not the same and her sales declined, she decided to invest in another business.  For the last year, she has been selling plastic products at wholesale to the distributors, shops and grocery stores who are her customers.

The loan will be invested in plastic products such as cups, plates, mugs, spoons, forks, knives, etc.

loans.use: to buy plastic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: apples, grapes, pears, bananas, strawberries and potatoes, green beans, plantains and various types of squash.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael requires a loan to buy diverse inventory, such as pants, shoes and women's clothing. He also sells passion fruit after he seeds them, and they are really for wholesale. He has been running his business for four years. Rafael lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. 

Rafael has taken out four loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past two years; all of which have been paid back in full. He has used these loans to diversify the products that he sells. He is very excited about taking out this loan so that he can continue to grow his business.

Rafael says that his favorite thing is to work in the country, and his most important challenge is to build a house for his family. He hopes that with his business profits he will be able to save and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy pants, shoes and women's clothing.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios es mi Fortaleza lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Blanca quien tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosa, helados y hielo. Ella desea aumentar su negocio hacerlo más grande es por ello que con el crédito comprara productos para surtir la venta con granos básicos, pan, café, huevo…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Johana comerciante de ropa y zapatos por encargo desde hace 6 años, Candida quien tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cocidos, y Yamileth se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The 'Dios es mi Fortaleza' (God is my Strength) group has four hard-working and entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Blanca, who owns a small store where she sells soda, frozen treats and ice.  She would like to increase her business and make it larger.  She will use her loan to buy products with which to stock her store: basic grains, bread, coffee, eggs, etc.

The other members of the group are Johana, who has been selling clothes and shoes to order for six years; Candida, who owns a tortilla bakery and sells baked beans; and Yamileth, who sells food.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Eveleing Gladys

texts.es:
Eveleing es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Tiene grado de instrucción superior. 
La señorita  trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez meses.  Su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra, venta y engorde de ganados vacunos, ovinos.  También vende frutas en la localidad de Ilave.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00  nuevo soles comprará ocho ovinos para su engorde por 2 ó 3 meses.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su mamá.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir de toda clase en la localidad de Ilave.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo  y los temas de reflexión que nos brinda las promotoras.
texts.en:
Eveleing is a member of the “Virgen de Concepción” community bank which is located in the village of Ayrumas Carumas, in Acora district, in Puno province and department.  She is 19 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She has a higher level of education.

This young lady has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten months.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business buying, fattening and selling cattle and sheep.  She also sells fruit in the town of Ilave.

With this new loan for 1,000 soles, Eveleing will buy eight sheep which she will fatten for 2 or 3 months.  Her mom works alongside her in the business.

Eveleing's dream is to own a business selling all kinds of clothes in the town of Ilave.

What Eveleing most likes about her community bank is the ease of receiving loans and all the topics that the loan officers introduce for them to reflect upon.

loans.use: to buy eight sheep

loans.name: La Palma Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada la Palma la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera y tener unos de los rios mas bonitos y mas visitados de toda la region. En esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva el nombre de la comunida la Palma el cual esta integrado por 10 personas.

La señora Elvira es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Gabriel con el cual tiene 2 hijos, Isais de 19 años que estudia la universidad y Gabriel de 9 años que estudia la primaria, ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su padre le enseño a elaborar los dulces tipicos de la region (cocadas, dulces de leche, dulces de ajongoli, jamoncillo y alfafores) y desde que se caso inicio a hacerlos y salir a venderlos a las comunidades cercanas como son Vicente y Tetela, ella vende sus dulces casa por casa ya que desea ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella nos platico un poco sobre la elaboracion de algunos de esos dulces, las cocodas las elabora con cocolo molido, los dulces de leche se preparan con leche y azucar, dulces de ajongoli con ajongoli, el jamoncillo con semilla de pipian y los alfafores con maiz, ellas nos dice que la elaboracion de sus dulces no algo muy facil ya que debe ponerle mucha dedicacion y saber los tiempo que necesita cada dulce para su elaboracion.

Ella necesita este credito para invertilo en la compra de maiz, semilla de pipian, ajongoli, leche, azucar, coco, piña, para porteriormente elaborar su deliciosos dulces y salir a verderlos.

La señora Elvira espera que su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio prospere y poder invertir un poco en la venta de perfumeria la cual piensa vender con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad. 

Los demas miembros del grupo son: 

claudia - venta de ropa por catalago
sandra - venta de calzado tejido
amalia - venta de antojitos mexicanos
bernardino - venta de pollo
arcadia - venta de dulces 
guadaluopa - molino 
irma - venta de ropa 
ofelia - venta de ceramica
Geronimo - venta de dulces
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called La Palma which is characterized by being located in a sugarcane region and having one of the most beautiful and most visited rivers of the entire region. In this community there is a group named the La Palma Community, which is made up of 10 people.

Señora Elvira is one of the members of this group.  She is 39 years old, has attended school only through secondary level, and is married to Señor Gabriel with whom she has 2 children.  Isais is 19 years old and studying at university, and Gabriel is 9 years and attending primary school.  She tells us that from a very young age, her father taught her to make the sweets typical of the region; cocadas (coconut sweets), dulce de leche (caramels), dulce de ajongoli (sesame seed sweets), jamoncillo (fudge), and alfafores (cookies filled with dulce de leche).  Since that time, she began making the sweets and going out to sell them to nearby communities such as Vicente and Tetela.  She sells the sweets door to door, and she wants to earn a little extra money to help her husband with household expenses and the education of their children.

She talks a little about the preparation of some of the sweets; she makes the cocadas with ground coconut, the dulce de leche caramels are made with milk and sugar, the dulces de ajongoli with sesame seeds, the jamoncillo fudge with pipian seeds (a type of squash) and the alfafores cookies with corn.   She tells us that the preparation of the sweets is not very easy, because it requires a lot of dedication and knowing the time needed to prepare each kind of sweet.

She needs this loan to invest in purchasing corn, pipian seeds, sesame seeds, milk, sugar, coconut, pineapple, to subsequently make her delicious sweets and go out to sell them.

Señora Elvira hopes to grow her business because she wants her business to flourish and to be able to invest a little in the sale of perfumes which she plans to sell to her friends and neighbors in the community.

The other members of the group are:
Claudia - sells clothing via catalog
Sandra - sells fabric shoes
Amalia - sells Mexican corn-based foods
Bernardino - sells chickens
Arcadia - sells sweets
Guadalupe - provides milling services
Irma - sells clothing
Ofelia - sells ceramic
Geronimo - sells sweets


En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada la Palma la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera y tener unos de los rios mas bonitos y mas visitados de toda la region. En esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva el nombre de la comunida la Palma el cual esta integrado por 10 personas.

La señora Elvira es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Gabriel con el cual tiene 2 hijos, Isais de 19 años que estudia la universidad y Gabriel de 9 años que estudia la primaria, ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su padre le enseño a elaborar los dulces tipicos de la region (cocadas, dulces de leche, dulces de ajongoli, jamoncillo y alfafores) y desde que se caso inicio a hacerlos y salir a venderlos a las comunidades cercanas como son Vicente y Tetela, ella vende sus dulces casa por casa ya que desea ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella nos platico un poco sobre la elaboracion de algunos de esos dulces, las cocodas las elabora con cocolo molido, los dulces de leche se preparan con leche y azucar, dulces de ajongoli con ajongoli, el jamoncillo con semilla de pipian y los alfafores con maiz, ellas nos dice que la elaboracion de sus dulces no algo muy facil ya que debe ponerle mucha dedicacion y saber los tiempo que necesita cada dulce para su elaboracion.

Ella necesita este credito para invertilo en la compra de maiz, semilla de pipian, ajongoli, leche, azucar, coco, piña, para porteriormente elaborar su deliciosos dulces y salir a verderlos.

La señora Elvira espera que su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio prospere y poder invertir un poco en la venta de perfumeria la cual piensa vender con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad. 

Los demas miembros del grupo son: 

claudia - venta de ropa por catalago
sandra - venta de calzado tejido
amalia - venta de antojitos mexicanos
bernardino - venta de pollo
arcadia - venta de dulces 
guadaluopa - molino 
irma - venta de ropa 
ofelia - venta de ceramica
Geronimo - venta de dulces

loans.use: to sell sweets that are typical of the region.

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca, cerca de la presa de Cerro de oro existe un comunidad llamada la Candelaria la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona donde se crea ganado y se produce mucho queso en esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva en nombre de su comunidad ya que sus integrantes pensaron que de esta manera seria mas conocido su grupo este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas.

Don Norberto es uno de los miembros de este grupo el tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casa do, el tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad. El nos platica que desde que el era muy pequeño sus padres tenia una tienda la cual se llama abarrotes Ramos y hace un poco mas de 10 años sus padres se la heredaron y ahora es el quien la atiende junto con su esposa, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa en uno de los laterales.

El nos platica que siempre le a gustado tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes siempre encuentre lo que buscan. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de frijol, arroz, arina, aceite, azucar, sal, sopa, jabon, cloro, detergentes, galletas, refrescos, dulces, papel higenico, productos enlatados(chiles, frijoles, atun), tomates, chiles, cebolla y pan para resurtir su tienda.

El espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que su tienda cresca y sus ganancias las utilizara en pintar su tienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Ramona- Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Esther_ Venta de tacos
Francisca- Venta de refresco
Carmela- Venta de refresco
Manuela- Venta de abarrotes
Raquel- Venta de calzado
Gerardo- Renta de tractor
Magdalena- Venta de trastes
Gabriela- Venta de antojitos Mexicanos
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca, near the Cerro de Oro (Hill of Gold) dam there is a community named La Candelaria. This is known as a cattle-raising and cheese-making region. Here there is a group named after the community, since its members believe the name will help their group become better known. They have 10 members.

Norberto is a member of the group. He is 38 years old, studied through secondary school, and is now married with 2 children, both attending a community primary school. Norberto tells us that when he was very small, his parents had a store called Abarrotes Ramos, and a little over 10 years ago, his parents left the store to him. Now he and his wife run it. The store is located in his house and one parallel to his.

Norberto prefers keeping the store well-stocked so that his customers can always find what they are looking for. He needs this loan to buy beans, rice, flour, oil, sugar, salt, soup, soap, clorox, detergents, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, toilet paper, canned goods (chili, beans, tuna), tomatoes, chilis, onions, and bread, to restock his store.

Norberto hopes that with this investment, his business will prosper, since he wants his store to grow. His earnings will be used to paint the store and to offer a better quality of life to his children.

The remaining members of the group are:
Esther - Sells tacos
Francisca - Sells soft drinks
Carmela - Sells soft drinks
Manuela - Sells groceries
Raquel - Sells shoes
Gerardo - Rents out a tractor
Magdalena - Sells dishes and utensils
Gabriela - Sells Mexican snacks

loans.use: sell groceries, shoes, soft drinks, snacks and dishes and utensils.

loans.name: Las Campesinas Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca cerca de la presa de Cerro exsite un comunidad llamada Arroyo Chicali la 

cual se caracteriza por ser una comunidad Indigena en la cual se habla dialecto mazateco en esta 

comunidad existe un grupo llamado las Campesinas ya que ellas se consideran mujeres de campo 

muy trabajadoras este grupo esta integrado por 12 personas.

La señora Ismaela es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene 41 años, estudio solo la 

primaria y esta casada con el señor Armando el cual trabaja como jornalero ellos tiene 5 hijos de 

nombres: Diana de 15 años que se encuentra estudiando la secuendaria, Vicente  y EM. de 12 

y 8 años que asisten a la primaria, Yurem de Jesus y Yurem EM. de 3 años. Doña Ismaela nos 

platica que hace mas o menos un año decidio iniciar a vender dulces y refrescos en su casa ya que 

lo que gana su esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar y vendiendo ella gana un 

poco de dinero extra para ayudar a sue esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus 

hijos.

Ella nos platica que a puesto una pequeña mesa en la parte de enfrente de su casa en la cual 

vende sus dulces, ella nos platica que la venta es buena ya que a los niños siempre se les antoja 

un dulce y muchas de la familia de la comunidad acostumbran a comer con un refresco .

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos y dulces para resurtir su negocio. 

Doña Ismaela nos dice que algunas veces sube a su carretulla sus mesa y sus dulces y los lleva a 

vender al campo deportivo los dias que hay futbol. Ella desea que su negocio prospere ya que 

quiere invertir sus ganancias en la compra de un poco de abarrotes para hacer crecer su negocio.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

victoria- antojitos mexicanos
rufina- venta de abararrotes
Venancia -venta de pescado
Maria - cria de ganado
Julia - venta de pescado
Maria S - venta de abarrotes 
Carmela - venta de tacos
Maria del Carmen - venta de antojitos 
inerva -venta de pollo 
Hilda - venta de refrescos 
Elizabeth - refrescos
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, near the Cerro reservoir, there is a community called Arroyo Chicali which is an indigenous community whose people speak the Mazateco dialect.  There is a group in this community which is called "Las Campesinas" (Country Women) because they consider themselves to be very hard-working country women.  There are 12 members in this group.

Ismaela is one of this group's members.  She is 41 years old and has only an elementary school level of education.  She is married to Armando, who works as a day laborer.  The couple have five children: 15 year-old Diana, who is in high school; 12 year-old Vicente and 8 year-old EM., who are in elementary school; and 3 year-old Yurem de Jesus and Yurem EM..

Ismaela tells us that approximately one year ago she decided to start selling sweet treats and soft drinks in her home as the money her husband earned wasn't enough to cover their household expenses.  By selling these products, she earns a little extra money which she uses to help her husband with their household expenses and to cover their children's education expenses.  She tells us that she placed a small table in the front of her home and this is where she sells her sweet treats.  She tells us that her sales are good because the local children always fancy a sweet treat and many of the families in the community have a soft drink while they eat.

Ismaela needs this loan to invest in buying soft drinks and sweet treats to re-stock her business.  She tells us that sometimes lifts her table and her sweet treats up onto her small cart and takes them to sell at the sports field on days when there are soccer matches.  She would like her business to prosper and would like to invest her profits in buying some groceries so that she can grow her business.

The other members of the group are:

Victoria - who sells Mexican snacks
Rufina - who sells groceries
Venancia - who sells fish
María - who raises livestock
Julia - who sells fish
María S. - who sells groceries
Carmela - who sells tacos
María del Carment - who sells snacks
Inerva - who sells chicken
Hilda - who sells soft drinks
Elizabeth - who sells soft drinks

loans.use: to sell sweet treats, snacks, groceries and soft drinks

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra de 45 años de edad, casado con Teofilo de 45 años, que fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos, Elba de 8 años y Abel de 6 años, quienes la motivan a seguir  trabajando y sacarlos adelante y hacer de ellos unos hombres de bien, útiles a la sociedad. Ellos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Alejandra desde su niñez, siempre le ha gustado ayudar a sus padres  en el trabajo que le encomendaban, pero sus padres tuvieron fuerte caída en el aspecto económico. La tienda que tenía y que los proveía de ingresos dejó de funcionar, además el negocio agrícola también decayó. Ante esto Alejandra y su familia tuvieron muchos percances pero con el tiempo lograron salir adelante y bajo muchos sacrificios hoy tienen una tienda en donde vende ropa. Ahora ella aprendió a ser precavida en las decisiones que toma con respecto a su negocio, es así como ha mejorando. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero usualmente ella trabaja por cuenta propia y sus productos lo venden en su propia casa. Ella anhela en un futuro cercano, ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de captar mayor clientela. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella esta agradecida  a la vez comprometida en cancelar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco banco comunal es una persona entusiasta y motivadora.  Con los 2.000 mil nuevos soles desea adquirir más prendas para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 45-years old and married to 45-year old Teofilo. They have two children, Elba aged 8 and Able aged 6. They are the reason why Alejandra and Teofilo work so hard; they wish to see their children grow up to make something of themselves and become a useful part of society. They live in their own house located in Pichari district.

Ever since she was a child, Alejandra has enjoyed helping her parents with any jobs they gave her, but her parents knew very little about economics. The store she used to run and which provided their income failed, and their agricultural business also fell through. Alejandra and her family had many problems but over time, they succeeded in overcoming them and with much sacrifice they now have a store where she sells clothing.

Alejandra has now learned to be cautious with the business decisions she makes and is doing better. Sometimes she has assistance from Teofilo but usually she works on her own. She runs the store out of her house. 

In the near future her wish is to better stock the store so she can gain more customers. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, for which she is grateful and promises to make the repayments punctually. In her community bank she is a enthusiastic and motivated member. With the loan of S/. 2000, Alejandra will buy more clothing for the store.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Fernanda Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fernanda, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, el mayor  estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los servicios que presta la institución.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas, ya que a esa hora su hijo mayor está en la escuela y solo tiene que ocuparse del más pequeño y en las tardes en cambio le tiene que ayuda a su hijo con las tareas de la escuela. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lleva  7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien, lo que más vende según nos cuenta son los perfumes tanto de damas como caballeros ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the 5 de Septiembre Community Bank meet every two weeks in Ciudadela La Paz in the city of Portoviejo. Ever since colonial times the city has been known as the Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos. 45-year old Señora Fernanda is a member of this bank. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children aged 10 and 3, the elder of whom attends school. Her husband is a businessman. Fernanda is the founder of the bank and enjoys being a member because of the services offered by the institution.

She is a housewife, but in order to earn income of her own, she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week usually in the mornings when her older son is in school and she only has to take care of the younger one. Also in the afternoons she has to help her son with his homework.

Fernanda lets her customers have the products on credit and then collects money from them each week. She’s been doing this work for seven years and it has gone well. The products that sell best are perfumes for both men and women as they are very good.

The loan is to buy more perfume, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Fernanda’s dream is for the store to continue doing well for the sake of the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, es comerciante, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, los dos trabajan y se apoyan, ella por su parte vende frutas y productos de belleza, inicio gracias al apoyo de una cuñada, este negocio le sirve como fuente permanente de ingreso.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas para el negocio, manzanas, kiwi, bananos, fresas, uvas, melocotón, melón y sandia, estos productos es su fuerte en el negocio, y a través de ellas obtiene ingresos, pues su clientela le demanda frutas frescas.
Con la inversión puede atender mejor a los clientes, aspirando siempre a mejorar y fortalecer el comercio, también el número de clientes y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is a businesswoman. She lives with her son and is single. The two of them work together and support each other. María sells fruit and beauty products, businesses she started with the support of a sister-in-law. The sales of these products provide a permanent income.

María is seeking a loan to buy fruit such as apples, kiwi, bananas, strawberries, grapes, peaches, melons, and watermelon for the business. These products are the backbone of the business and provide most of the income because her customers require fresh fruit.

With the loan money she will be able to provide better service to her customers. Her desire is always to improve and strengthen the business and increase both her customer base and her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, kiwi, bananas, strawberries, grapes, peaches, melons, and watermelon

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Julia del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de chiverías, helado, hielos…etc. luego poco a poco empezó a comprar pan, huevo, fósforos, sal en pequeñas cantidades. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la comprar de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para surtir su venta.
texts.en:
Julia del Socorro is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who owns a grocery store.  She started her business selling snacks, iced treats, ice, etc. then she gradually started buying bread, eggs, matches and salt in small quantities.

Julia will invest her loan in buying a larger quantity and variety of products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, cream, matches, snacks, soda, etc.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la siembra D. frijol y maíz, vive con su esposo y juntos se apoyan para realizar la siembra, desD. jóvenes realizan las labores agrícolas, pues D. su producción se alimentan y logran comercializar una parte para sus gastos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, con este insumo lo aplican a la plantación y le ayuda para desarrollarse y dar buenos frutos, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para tener su producción y poder comercializar parte D. este. 
Su objetivo es recibir una buena cosecha, que cubra las necesidades alimenticias D. ellos y que puedan también obtener ingresos D. la venta D. esta misma producción.
texts.en:
Ana grows beans and corn.  She lives with her husband and they both support each other in growing their crops.  They have both been farming since they were young.  They eat some of what they produce and manage to sell the rest to cover their expenses.  Ana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers.  They will apply these to their crops and it will help them to develop and proviD. good fruit,

This loan will be a great help to Ana in growing her crops and she will be able to sell some of them.  Ana's goal is to obtain a good harvest that will cover her family's food needs and also enable them to make income by selling some of their produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn crop

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de de 1 año y un bebe de 8 meses. El marido es comerciante. Ella estudia en segundo semestre de secretariado ejecutivo en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Ella es una joven madre que para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogo de algunas marcas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días en los momentos que está desocupada, ella aprovecha las noches ya que allí les vende a sus compañeras en la universidad, trabaja a base de pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que le encanta vender. Su mercadería la recibe en distribuidoras en el centro de la ciudad. Lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  9 ciclos y nos cuenta que los créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros por eso le agrada la institución. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '5 de Septiembre' community bank meet in La Paz neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city has been known since colonial times as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 22 year-old Karen who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 1 year and 8 months.  Her husband is a salesman.  Karen is studying her second semester of an executive secretarial course at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Karen is a young mother who sells brand clothing through catalogs in order to help her husband with their household expenses.  She makes her sales door to door and works every day whenever she has free time.  She makes the most of the evenings when she sells to her fellow university students.  Karen works to order, leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that she loves selling.  She receives her merchandise from distributors in the city center.

Karen has been in this business for three years and she has done very well.  She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for nine loan cycles and tells us that her loans have got her out of many tight spots.  For this reason, she is grateful to the institution.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and own her own business.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Bellas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Bellas de Vista Hrmosa: Este grupo lo integran dos señoras las cuales estam nuy contentas porque tienen la oportunidad de un credito ya que doña Vilma se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en general y nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar por eso solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos,doña Rosa tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad ella tambien nececita el credito para la compra de productos comestibles ya que sus clientes le hacen pedidos y nececita mas capital para trabajar
texts.en:
'Mujeres Bellas de Vista Hermosa' group

This two ladies who make up this group are very happy that they have the opportunity to receive this loan.  Vilma sells cosmetics.  She tells us that she needs more capital in order to work.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics.  Rosa owns a grocery store.  She also needs a loan to buy food products as her customers make orders with her and she needs more capital in order to work.

loans.use: to buy food products and cosmetics

loans.name: Santa Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Santa Rosa es casada, tiene 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos los cuales no estudian, ella se dedica a la elaboración de costeras a diferentes prendas ya que inicio este trabajo desde que era joven, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica la tejeduría de telas típicas.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de costuras,  y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Va a comprar telas,  e hilos de diferentes tipos y colores. Espera seguir manteniendo este trabajo por toda su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Santa Rosa is married and 58 years old.  She had no opportunity to study at school, and she has 6 children who do not go to school.  She works doing embroidery on different garments and has been doing this work since she was young; so far she has 25 years of experience in this work.  She counts on the support of her husband who works weaving traditional fabrics.

She decided to request a loan to be able to buy materials for embroidery, and thus to be able to improve their income.  She is going to buy fabrics and yarns of different types and colors.  She hopes to continue this work for the rest of her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and yarn.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación hasta 3ro de secundaria. 
Su préstamo anterior de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domestico como ovinos, vacunos, etc., especialmente compró tres ovejas.  Desde hace un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000 soles comprará dos toritos para su engorde por dos meses  y su posterior venta en la localidad de Totorani e Ilave.
Su sueño es ser tejedora de chalinas, chullos, mantas y mejorar el ganado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the community bank Virgen de Concepción, located in C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, married, and has a school-aged child.  She went to school until the 3rd year of secondary school.

Her last loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested it in her business buying and selling domestic animals, such as sheep, cattle, and others by purchasing three sheep.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year.

With this loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase two bulls that she will fatten for two months and then sell in Totorani and Ilave.

Her dream is to weave scarves, woolen hats, blankets, and improve her livestock.

The things she likes about the community bank are the ease of getting loans, the savings, and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar de 29 años de edad, convive con Reina de 20 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen una hermosa criatura, de 2 añitos con quien vive en su casa propia del centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Él posee un negocio de producción de cacao, y que ahora esta en pleno auge económico, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a ello cuando tenía 20 años, actualmente tiene su parcela que ahora ya esta por producir este fruto. Edgar siempre ha sido consecuente con sus objetivos trazados, desde luego que tuvo infinidades de barreras, que gracias a ello aprendió buenas lecciones en la vida. Su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM; por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Para el futuro desea vender su producción en otras comunidades para así aumentar sus ganancias. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea darle un buen manejo agronómico a sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Edgar is 29 years old and lives with Reina who is 20.  The couple have a beautiful 2 year-old daughter with whom they live in their own home, in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.

Edgar owns a cacao production business.  This crop is currently at an economic peak and Edgar decided to enter this business when he was 20 years old.  He currently has a plot of land where he produces this crop.  Edgar has always been consistent in working on his goals.  Of course, he has come up against countless obstacles but, thanks to this, he has learned good lessons in life.

Edgar's working hours are from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He generally works on his own but he sometimes receives help from his family.  In the future, Edgar would like to sell his produce in other communities so that he can increase his profits.  This will be his first loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your support so that he can achieve his goals.  Edgar would like to use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to care for his cacao plants.

loans.use: to clear the weeds from his cacao plants

loans.name: Josue Abinadab

texts.es:
Josue, es un agricultor, está casado tiene 3 hijos de 12, 15 y 18 años de edad, a través del cultivo ha logrado dar a su familia la alimentación y una vida digna, lleva muchos años siendo agricultor sembrando maíz y frijol.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono e insecticidas, para el cultivo de maíz, con estos materiales podrá dar un sano cuido al cultivo.
Su aspiración es que a través del cultivo de maíz, su familia pueda estar más segura económicamente, apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y ante cualquier circunstancia.
texts.en:
Josue is a farmer, he is married with 3 children aged 12, 15 and 18.   Through his farming, he has fed his family and given them a decent life.  He has been growing corn and beans for many years.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and pesticides for farming corn.  These materials can provide healthy care for a crop.

His hope is that through the farming of corn, his family can be more secure financially, and he can support his children in their education and in any other situations.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides for farming corn.

loans.name: Lisbeth Stefania

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar Conocimos a la señora Lisbeth, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de dos  años de edad. El marido trabaja con aluminio y vidrio.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las noches ya que a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo de su pequeño hijo y ella puede ir a hacer sus recorridos con más comodidad, ella para tener mayores ventas deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, con esto les da  a sus clientes mas tiempo y es por esto que la prefieren. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the La Paz neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "5 de Septiembre" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Lisbeth, 20, who is in a common-law marriage that has produced a 2 year-old child.  Her husband works with aluminum and glass.

Lisbeth is a housewife who, in order to generate her own income, sells clothing through a catalog and also sells Sayson products (beauty products, including cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women.)  She works 3 days a week, mostly in the evenings, since at this hour her husband can care for their small son so that she can make her rounds more efficiently.  In order to have higher sales, she sells her products on credit and collects every 15 days; this gives her customers more time and as result they prefer to do business with her.  Her products are delivered to her house except for the clothing, which she buys from a distribution center.  She has been doing this work for 2 years and it is going very well.

Lisbeth will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing for women, men and children.  This is her second loan cycle with her communal bank, and she likes it because of the easy payment terms on the loans.

Her dream is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Nelida Casiana

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Tiene educación secundaria.
La señora trabaja en el negocio junto con su esposo, se dedican al engorde de animales domésticos como vacunos y ovinos.  Su préstamo anterior  fue por la suma de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de cuatro unidades de ovejas.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca para su engorde por cuatro meses y luego la venderá.  Nelida nos cuenta que los compra en las comunidades de la localidad y los vende en Ilave.
Su sueño es tener una casa en la ciudad y tener un carro para darlo en alquiler y así generar otro ingreso.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad  y las charlas que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the "Virgen de Concepción" Community Bank which is located in the village of Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district. This is in the province and department of Puno.  She is 22 years old, and lives with her partner and her school-age son.  She has a secondary-school level education.

The Señora works in business with her husband.  They are engaged in fattening domestic animals such as cattle and sheep.  Her previous loan was for the sum of 500 New Soles, money which she invested in purchasing four sheep.  She worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  With this new loan of 1,500 New Soles, she will buy a cow to fatten for four months and then sell.  Nelida tells us that she buys her livestock in local communities and sells them in Ilave.

Her dream is to have a house in the city and to have a car that she can rent out to generate other income.

What she likes about the Community Bank is the timeliness and the lectures offered by the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, es comerciante de ropa, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, ella vive junto a su madre, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y perfumes, esta venta la realiza de forma ambulante en colonias y barrios cercanos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir como: faldas, blusas, camisetas y ropa interior.
Este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar la mercadería del negocio y a ofrecer a los clientes mejores estilos de ropa, con la esperanza de potenciar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, su aspiración es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, que por medio de su trabajo pueda dar lo necesario a ellos.
texts.en:
Rosa works selling clothing.  She is a single mother of two children who are 5 and 11 years old.  She lives with her mother.  She has sold clothing and perfumes for seven years.  She travels through nearby areas and neighborhoods selling clothing in the street.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase items of clothing such as: skirts, blouses, shirts, and underwear.

This loan will help her increase her merchandise and offer her customers better styles of clothing.  She hopes this will improve her business and help her earn more income.  Her dream is to help her children with their education and to give them everything they need through her work.

loans.use: to purchase clothing like: skirts, blouses, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Duo Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
DUO SANTA TERESITA:
Este dúo esta conformado por doña María Marta, quien tiene  venta de consumo diario y hace poco logró comprar un molino de nixtamal en cual le ha ido muy  bien ya que atiende a varias personas durante el día, ella quiere aprovechar para invertir más en la venta de consumo diario, ya que las personas que visitan su molino aprovechan para comprar las cosas de su hogar, junto a ella vive la señora 	Justa, quien vende tortillas desde hace varios años,  viendo el incremento del precio del maíz ella necesita  capital para comprar por cantidades mayores,  para que al final pueda ella tener  un ahorro también, según la necesidad de sus clientes ella también vende maíz, teniendo así un  ingreso adicional a la venta de tortillas, el deseo de ambas es seguir trabajando e ir incrementando sus negocios, ellas se sienten contentas de tener esta oportunidad de obtener este capital para poder lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
'Santa Teresita' group

This group has two members.  María Marta sells essential household products and, a short while ago, she managed to buy a mill for grinding 'nixtamal' (cooked corn used in making tortillas).  Her business is doing very well as she serves a number of people during the day.  She would like to take advantage of this opportunity and invest further in her grocery store business as the people who come to use her mill also buy household products while they are there.  Alongside María Marta lives Justa who has been selling tortillas for several years.  Owing to the increase in the price of corn, she needs capital so that she can buy in larger quantities and save.  According to her customers' needs, she also sells corn which makes her an additional income to that which she makes selling her tortillas.  Both ladies would like to continue working and expanding their businesses.  They are happy to have this opportunity to obtain capital with which they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy essential household products and to buy corn wholesale

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Nemesia De Los Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Nemesia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la elaboración de calzado desde caites, sandalias y zapatos desde hace 12 años. Este negocio es familiar y lo inicio con su esposo con el fin de salir adelante, es un taller modesto y artesanal que poco a poco han ido mejorando.
Ella con el crédito comprara cuero, pega, hilo, plantillas…etc.
texts.en:
Señora Nemesia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She has been making footwear such as different kinds of sandals and shoes for 12 years. This business is family-owned, and she started it with her husband with a view to moving ahead in life.  They have a modest artisanal workshop which they have been improving bit by bit.

With the loan she will buy leather, glue, thread, patterns, etc.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, thread, patterns, etc.

loans.name: Iris Nohemy

texts.es:
Iris, administra una tienda, vive con su familia conformada por sus cuatro hijos, ellos le ayudan a atender a los clientes, no tienen un horario fijo para atender y actualmente necesitan invertirle al negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos domésticos tales como: aceite, azúcar, sal, huevos, papel higiénico y bebidas, la compra le ayudara a surtir el negocio y a mejorar la atención a la clientela.
Su objetivo es fortalecer sus ingresos a través del negocio, mantener todo lo necesario en los hogares de los clientes, y ayudar a sus hijos en todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Iris owns a store and lives with her family, which is made up of her four children.  They help her serve customers, and there is no fixed schedule.  She currently needs to invest in her business.

She is asking for this loan to purchase domestic products such as oil, sugar, salt, eggs, toilet paper, and drinks.  The purchases will help stock her store and improve customer service.  

Her goal is to increase her income from the business, provide her customers with everything they need for their homes, and help her children with all of their needs.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, salt, eggs, toilet paper, and drinks.

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad, está divorciada y de esa relación tuvo una  hija la misma que tiene cuatro años y este año ingreso al jardín de infantes. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos han sido muy importantes para su vida ya que con estos ha podido arreglar una parte de su casa.

Ella trabaja como facilitadora en un programa del INFA (Instituto de la Niñez y la Familia). Siempre  ha hecho los créditos  para poco a poco con ellos ir mejorando su hogar, con este crédito quiere poner cerámica en el baño de su casa ya que hasta la fecha solo esta enlucido y le falta el acabado necesario para que tanto ella como su pequeña hija tengan más comodidades.
  
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica, cemento y otros materiales de construcción.

Sus sueños son terminar por completo su casa para darle a su hija un lugar adecuado donde ella pueda crecer segura.
texts.en:
In the residential community of La Paz in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the "September 5th" Community Bank meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Señora María, who is 30 years old and divorced.  She has a daughter from this relationship who is four years old, and who this year is entering kindergarten.  She has been part of five loan cycles with the Community Bank and likes it because the loans have been very important for her life.  With them, she has been able to fix up a part of her home.

She works as a facilitator in an INFA (Institute for Children and Families) program.  She has taken all the loans to improve her home bit by bit.  With this loan, she wants to tile the bathroom of her house so that both she and her young daughter have more amenities.  So far, she is only lacking the required plaster and finish.

This loan is to buy tiles, cement and other building materials.

Her dreams are to complete her house so that she can give her daughter a suitable place where she can grow up safely.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, and other building materials.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco” ubicado en Centro Poblado Tahuaco, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 08 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales como ovinos, vacunos y porcinos, también se dedican a la chacra  como papa, habas.  Su préstamo anterior fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace catorce años.
Faustina solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cinco vacas para su respectivo engorD. por 3 ó 4 meses y luego venderlos en la localidad  D. Yunguyo.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que ahorran.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the community bank San Jan D. Tahuaco, located in the village of Tahuaco in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married, and has eight children, who are all independent adults.  She did not attend school.  

She and her husband work buying and selling animals such as sheep, cattle, and pigs.  They also farm potatoes and beans.  Her last loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and she invested the money in her business.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 14 years.  

Faustina is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase five cows that she will fatten for three to four months and then sell in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to improve her livestock and therefore increase her income.  The things she likes best about the community bank are the ease of getting a loan and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase five cows.

loans.name: Elmer Orlando

texts.es:
Elmer, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es ganadero y agricultor, este oficio lo aprendió desde joven y un amigo lo animo a trabajar en el campo, no tiene un horario definido para las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas.
Por el momento Elmer ha iniciado la siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo para adquirir fertilizantes y abono, con estos insumos dará el cuido necesario a la plantación y tendrá menos riesgo para  dañarse la cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una buena producción, aumentar su número de ganado, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Elmer lives with his wife and two children.  He is a rancher and farmer.  He learned this trade at a young age and a friend encouraged him to work in the field.  He doesn't have a set schedule for his farming and ranching activities.  Elmer has started planting corn and it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure.  With these supplies he will be able to care for his crops and there will be less risk that the crops will be damaged.  His goal is to have a good production, increase the number of livestock he has and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel de 30 años convive con claudio de 43 años de edad, juntos tienen 3 hijos con quienes vive en su propia casa  en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Marivel es una mujer de ardua labor que desde muy niña tuvo que trabajar por ganarse la vida para poder tener un futuro con buenas expectativas. Es así que decidió emprender un negocio que es la venta de pollos, claro que a los inicios le fue muy difícil mantener en pie su negocio y tener clientes ahora cuenta con un ingreso económico estable y el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. El  único problema que ella tiene es que los pollos tiene que comprarlos desde san Francisco que queda a una distancia no menos de 45 kilómetros y trasladarlos hasta Canayre que es donde queda su negocio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella esta agradecida y a la vez se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea adquirir más pollos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marivel, aged 30, lives with Claudio, aged 43.  They have 3 children together, and live with them in their own house in the town of Canayre in Llochegua district.  Marivel is a hard-working woman who has had to work for a living since she was a little girl, in order to have a future with good prospects.  She therefore decided to start a business selling chickens.  Of course, at the beginning it was very difficult to keep her business going and to have customers.  Now she has a stable income and the support of her husband and children.  The only problem she has is that she needs to buy the chickens from San Francisco, which is at least 45 kilometers away, and transport them to Canayre which is where she has her business. 

This will be her second loan through MFP, for which she is grateful and also agrees to pay her repayments promptly. With the 1,000 New Soles,she wants to buy more chickens to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: G.s. G.m.s Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario G.M.S  está conformado por dos integrantes José Antonio y Maria Ignacia, José Antonio se dedica  a la venta de pelibuey, hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este medio de vida cuando quedo desempleado y no tenía ingresos para su hogar,  no proporciona los suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia es por esto que solicita este crédito para la compra de 3 pelibuey. Sueña con obtener su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en: The unified group G.M.S. is made up of two members, José Antonio and Maria Ignacia.  José Antonio has been selling pelibüey sheep for more than 4 years.  He started making a living this way when he was unemployed and didn't have a household income.  It doesn't however, provide enough income to maintain his family, so it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy 3 pelibüey sheep.  His dream is to obtain his own means of transportation.

loans.use: purchase 3 pelibüey sheep.

loans.name: Solidario Mujeres Del Libano Group

texts.es:
MUJERES DEL LIBANO
Este grupo está formado por María Juliana D. 42 años, casada tiene 5 hijos y ella se dedica a hacer comales des D. hace  15 años y ha venderlos, nos cuenta que quiere este crédito para poder almacenar comales y a si cuando venga el invierno ella pueda tener bastante producto para vender, también esta Rosa Irma D. 44 años ella es soltera y se dedica a la venta D. huevos en su casa y va a ofrecer en las tiendas D. sacsuy desD. hace 9 años, también esta doña Rosa, D. 56 años ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella es dueña D. una pequeña tienda en la aldea sacsuy  desD. hace 8 años nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder invertir en productos Comestibles D. primera necesidad y poder venderlo las tres señoras se conocen y son amigas  son trabajadoras y emprendedoras en su negocio además nos cuenta que esperan que se les brinD. la oportunidad por lo tanto esperan que fape les puedan dar la oportunidad D. poder crecer  y desarrollarse en sus negocios confían en esta gran oportunidad y esperan no defraudar a la institución que les va a brindar la mano.
texts.en:
'Mujeres del Líbano'

This group has three members.  María Juliana is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She has been making and selling 'comales' (special pans used for cooking tortillas) for 15 years.  She tells us that she would like this loan so that she can store 'comales' so that when the winter comes she will have enough products available to sell.

Rosa Irma is 44 years old and single.  She has been selling eggs from her home and also in the stores in Sacsuy for nine years.

Rosa is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  She has owned a small store in the village of Sacsuy for eight years.  She tells us that she is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying basic household products to sell.

The three ladies know each other and are friends.  They are hard working and entrepreneurial.  They hope to receive this opportunity from FAPE to grow and develop their businesses.  They are relying on this great opportunity and hope that they will not let down the institution that will lend them this support.

loans.use: to buy basic household products, to buy 'comales' (special pans for cooking tortillas) and to buy eggs wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise like oil, condiments, rice, beans, and pasta.

loans.name: Nelly Guadalupe

texts.en: Nelly is 43 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. She is separated and lives with her three daughters: Jessica, 17; Diana, 15; and Adaluz, 9. Nelly is a person who likes to move forward with her life and pull herself up without fear of falling down. She is simply a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her children. Nelly is a seamstress who manufactures sportswear and clothing. She used to work at home, but with a previous loan she purchased a store. She is requesting this loan, her 10th, to buy fabric and materials to fulfill a large order of sports uniforms. She works alone, but her daughter Diana helps her in her free time away from school. Her past loans have helped her expand her business. She now carries more goods, has more supplies, and carries more colors and sizes. She has been able to buy more machines and has given economic stability to her daughters. Nelly's dream is to have a large factory and provide work for others. She also dreams of purchasing a home for her family, and that her daughters will not have the economic problems she has had in her life.

loans.use: to buy cloth to fill her orders for sports uniforms

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia de 53 años de edad casado con Alejandro de 54 años quien tiene dos hijos Revel y Clinton con quienes vive en su casa propia del centro poblado de Canayre  del distrito de LLochegua. Apenas tiene primaria incompleta, pero eso no lo impidió a seguir sus sueños como el tener su campo agrícola, recuerda que sudó la gota gorda para establecerse en un rubro que tanto es olvidado a nivel nacional. Pero ella le da mucho valor y dedicación, aparte de que sus productos son orgánicos, no daña al medio ambiente; para ello utiliza técnicas de manera etológica para que cuide de sus cosechas. Olimpia es consciente de que en el futuro lo van asumir sus hijos, por ello le esta enseñando en el manejo y cuidado de sus  productos y a la vez en conservar el medio ambiente. Su producto es reconocido en su comunidad, por la buena calidad que tiene, es por ello que los grandes mayoristas llegan a su parcela para comprar sus productos. Usualmente ella trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, sin embargo en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que lo facilite la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro  cercano anhela incrementar su campo agrícola, con la necesidad de ganar clientes potenciales. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, Olimpia desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Olympia is 53 years old and married to Alexander, 54.  She has two children, Revel and Clinton, with whom she lives in their own home in the town of Canayre in Llochegua district.  She has only an incomplete primary level education, but that has not prevented her from following her dreams to have an agricultural field.  She recognizes that sweating bullets to cultivate a field is something that has been forgotten at a national level, but she brings a great deal of courage and dedication to her work.  Besides her products being organic, she does not harm the environment; she uses ethological techniques as a way to take care of the crops.  

Olympia is aware that in the future her children will take over the business, so she is teaching them how to manage and care for the crops while conserving the environment.  Her products are recognized in her community for their good quality, and this is why the major wholesalers come to her plot to buy their products.  Usually she works with her ​​partner, and sometimes she gets help from her children, but in the harvest season she needs workers to help harvest the crops.  In the near future she desires to increase her agricultural field, because of the need to gain potential customers. 

This is her first loan through MFP, therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you. With 1,000 New Soles, Olympia want to buy more cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de dos años. El marido es comerciante de pescado. Para ella este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos han podido salir adelante en su negocio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del marido el cual vende mariscos en el mercado numero uno de Portoviejo. Allí él vende pescado, camarones, conchas, entre otros mariscos, nos dice nuestra amiga que su esposo se va de madrugada al mercado a esperar que lleguen los comerciantes mayoristas para luego él comprar sus productos y tener para la venta diaria, luego espera a que lleguen sus clientes a este lugar para hacer sus compras para el hogar, él trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 18h00 y viene realizando esta actividad por mas de seis años.

Este crédito es para comprar  pescado, camarón, conchas entre otros productos del mar.
 
Su sueño  es tener un buen local para vender sus productos.
texts.en: In La Paz is the city of Portoviejo, known in colonial times as Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, where every fortnight the members of the communal lender 5 De Septiembre meet.  Johana is one member who is 21, married and mother of a 2-year old son.  Her husband has been a fish seller in the market of Portoviejo for the last 6 years, where he sells fish, shrimp, shellfish and other seafood, buying product wholesale early in the morning and selling in the afternoons.  Johana has sought credit 3 times before, and is grateful for allowing her to grow her family's business.  She hopes to one day be able to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothing such as shirts, pants, skirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su familia, sus hijos y su esposo, todos trabajan, ella junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura y ganadería, el trabajo es propio, sus hijos también ayudan a atender las labores que demanda, como familia todos se apoyan para que el negocio marche bien.
Actualmente quiere comprar cerdos para engorD., por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita comprarlos y atender este nuevo sector D. comercio, aumentar sus ganancias.
El propósito D. Blanca es tener una fuente D. ingresos segura, que su negocio con los cerdos le genere lo planeado y D. esta manera garantizar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her children and husband.  Everyone works.  Blanca works with her husband in his farming and ranching business.  Their children also help with the labor.  As a family everyone helps out so that the business runs smoothly.  Currently she wants buy pigs to fatten.  With the loan she is requesting she will purchase the pigs and attend to this new business venture to increase her earnings.  Blanca's aim is to have a reliable source of income generated by her pig business and thereby, ensure better financial stability.

loans.use: purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Sanquira, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria.
La señora se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de granos de la región como papa, chuño, habas y quinua.  Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en compra de abarrotes. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar veinte arrobas de papa y chuño, éstos productos los compra en Yunguyo y los vende en Desaguadero.  En el negocio la ayuda su esposo, quien  también se dedica a la costura de chamarras, pantalones, y en sus ratos libres es albañil.  Nos cuenta que también tienen algunos chanchos para vender.
Su sueño es comprar más chanchos porque dice que hay buena ganancia.
Le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en: Dominga is a member of the "San Juan de Tahuaco” community bank which is located in the village of Sanquira, in Yunguyo district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department. She is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She has an elementary school level of education. Dominga used to sell groceries. She currently buys and sells grains from her region such as potatoes, 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product), beans and quinoa. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that loan in buying groceries. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Dominga will use this new loan for 500 soles to increase her business capital, buying twenty 'arrobas' (one 'arroba' = approximately 25 pounds) of potatoes and chuño. She buys these products in Yunguyo and sells them in Desaguadero. Her husband helps her in her business. He also sews jackets and pants. In his free time, he is a construction worker. She tells us that she and her husband also have some pigs that they sell. Dominga's dream is to buy more pigs because she says that she makes a good profit from them. Dominga likes her community bank for the meetings, the ease of obtaining the loans, the punctuality and the responsibility amongst the members.

loans.use: to buy twenty 'arrobas' of potatoes and 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product)

loans.name: Aurelia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia Antonia es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de fajas típicas, inicio este trabajo no siendo de ella propiamente y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia trabajando ya propiamente.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, el dinero lo utilizara para comprar materiales para elaborar mas tejido, compra de hilo de diferentes clases  y colores, espera mejorar su negocio con la inversión que hace.
texts.en:
Aurelia Antonia is 45 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has three children, two of whom are in school.  Aurelia's business is weaving traditional belts. When she started this work, she did not work for herself.  She now has three years experience working for herself.

Aurelia has decided to request a loan that will help her to expand her working capital.  She will use the money to buy materials for doing more weaving work.  She will buy different classes and colors of thread.  She hopes to improve her business with this investment.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y su hijo, él es agricultor y ganadero, comenzó por el apoyo que le brindaron sus suegros, pues también atienden labores agropecuA., no tiene un horario fijo y de este trabajo alimenta a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado e insumos agrícolas, pues también se dispone a sembrar maíz, para lo cual necesita abono y fertilizantes, con estos materiales puede iniciar el cultivo.
Su objetivo es que a través de financiamientos pueda aumentar el ganado,  sus parcelas de tierra sembradas y del mismo modo obtener una buena cosecha para comercializar, dando así una mejor solvencia a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and son.  He is a farmer and also raises livestock.  He started out in this business with support from his in-laws as they also work in agriculture and livestock raising.  Miguel does not work fixed hours and this work feeds his family.

Miguel is currently requesting a loan to buy livestock and farm supplies as he is getting ready to sow his corn crop and needs manure and fertilizers with which to start his sowing process.

Miguel's goal, with the help of loans, is to increase the size of his herd, to sow all his land and to obtain a good harvest to sell.  This will make his family more financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy livestock and also fertilizers for his corn crop

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es vecino de la comunidad  de Las Bonitas de Pérez Zeledón. 

Marco quiere aprovechar que los precios nacionales del café han mejorado, y por eso quiere sembrar su finquita de café. Para esp necesita un préstamo de ₡600 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de fertilizantes y los materiales necesarios para sembrar un almacigo.

Marco asegura que este préstamo ha será una bendición ya que lograra sembrar a tiempo.

El es socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal “ Las Bonitas” una de las 110 empresas socias  de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Marco lives in Las Bonitas community, in Pérez Zeledón.  He would like to make the most of the fact that the price of coffee has increased in his country by sowing coffee on his farm.  For this, he needs a loan for 600,000 colones, so that he can buy fertilizers and the materials he needs to sow a seedbed.

Marco assures us that this loan will be a blessing as it will enable him to sow his crops on time.

Marco is a member of the "Las Bonitas" Community Loan Company, one of 110 EDESA member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, está  casada  y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió hasta 2do de secundaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo inicial que fue por S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ovinos, vacuno, alpaca, llamas y venta de artesanías como chompas, chalinas, chullos, guantes, etc.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará cinco ovejas,  15 fibras de ovejas y 20 fibras de alpaca de diferentes colores para la fabricación de prendas. En el negocio le ayuda su papá y pastores de la zona.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar el negocio así incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the "Virgen de Concepción" community bank, which is located in Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district, in the province and department of Puno, Peru. She is 36 years old, married and has three children. She studied up till the second year of high school.

She has been working with Kiva Field Partner, Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for one year. Her initial loan was for 500 PEN, and she invested it in her business buying and selling sheep, cattle, alpacas and llamas, as well as handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, wool caps, gloves, etc.. With this new loan of  1500 PEN she will buy five sheep, 15 skeins of sheep wool and 20 skeins of alpaca wool of different colors to make garments. Her father and local shepherds help her out with her business.

Her dream is to keep the business going and improve it to increase her profit.

What she likes about the community bank are the savings and the profit.

loans.use: to buy five sheep, 15 skeins of sheep wool and 20 skeins of alpaca wool of different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase women's clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and other items of clothing.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William wants a loan to hire and pay for labor to harvest groundnuts, beans, maize, and pineapples. He is a Ugandan man, age 51, and he hails from Kyenjojo. He is an agriculturalist. William is the father of two children, ages 5 and 1, whom he lives with along with their mother. He has been in the agricultural business for four years. A problem he faces is weather changes. In the future, he wants to start up a produce business and get rich through agriculture.

loans.use: to hire and pay for labor to harvest groundnuts, beans, maize, and pineapples

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 25 years old and lives in Pimampiro, Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents and her six-month-old son. Norma is an entreprenuerial woman who is honest, humble, and has a strong desire to overcome obstacles and move forward with her son. Norma learned to plant, cultivate, and harvest from her father. She began her own farming activities sowing a cucumber crop on her father's land. Her past harvest was good, and, at this moment, she is cultivating her crops on good land.
