The loan she is seeking will help her buy seeds to plant beans and take care of her crops. This loan is her seventh, and she believes that she has improved the quality of life for herself, her family, and her son. Her income has increased as the production of her crops has improved. Norma's dream is to have her own house and her own farmland where she can grow her produce. Her other goals include giving her son an education, good nutrition, and proper clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant beans

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es de la comunidad de las bonitas de Pérez Zeledon, es conocido por ser una persona muy trabajadora.

El tiene una finca en la cual ha sembrado la mitad de café, ahora el  necesita un préstamo de  ₡600 000 (Seiscientos  mil colones) para la creación de un almacigo de café. El espera poder sembrar toda su finca de café y poder sacar provecho del alza nacional de  en los precios del café.

Don Rafael está seguro además de que mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is from the Las Bonitas community of Pérez Zeledon. He is known for being a very hardworking person. 

He has a farm half of which he has sown with coffee. Now he needs a loan of 600,000 colones for the creation of a coffee seedling bed. He hopes to be able to plant his entire farm with coffee and take advantage of the nationwide rise in coffee prices. 

Don Rafael is also certain that it will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Francia Maria

texts.es:
Francia de 53 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Su esposo es carpintero y tiene hijo mayores de edad. Se dedica ala confección y la venta de hielo.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás en las ventas ya que esa profesión le gustaba también confeccionando trajes. Labora sola diariamente en la ventas de hielo y en algunas ocasiones realiza costura mediante clientelas que le pide arreglos del mismo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo de vivienda y tener una vida saludable y estable con su familia.
texts.en:
Francia, 53, lives in a semi-urban area in the Fortín de Guayaquil. Her husband is a carpenter and they have adult children. She earns a living by dressmaking and by selling ice. 

She began in sales some time ago since she enjoyed that profession, as well as making clothes. She works alone every day selling ice and at times does sewing for customers who ask her to make repairs. 

With the help of the loan she wants to buy construction materials for fixing up her home and have a healthy, stable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and cinderblock.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad, alquila vivienda donde tiene instalada la tienda, desde hace más de 5 años, posee experiencia y clientes bien definidos, estos son de la zona y consumen a diario de la mercadería que ella ofrece.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, como detergentes, jabón, comestibles en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, galletas, boquitas y bebidas.
Esta inversión será una gran fortaleza para María, pues al abastecer el inventario, estará sirviendo mejor a los clientes, su sueño es crecer en el negocio y un día comprar su propia vivienda para estar con su hijo, y que él pueda estudiar para superarse.
texts.en:
María earns a living selling basic staples. She is a single mother and lives with her 17-year-old son in rental housing where she has had her store set up for over five years. She has experience and a well-defined set of customers from the area who consume on a daily basis the merchandise she sells. 

Currently she is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise to stock the business, such as detergents, soap and groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, cookies, snacks and drinks. 

This investment will be a strong support for María, since by stocking up on inventory she will be better serving her customers. Her dream is to grow in the business, to purchase her own home some day for her and her son, and that he might go to school to make the most of himself.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, soap and groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Herlinda Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó el tercer año de educación básica, tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando, se dedica al comercio y a la tejeduría, inicio con la tienda gracias al apoyo de su esposo y lleva 1 año de experiencia. 

Decide solicitar un préstamo que ser vira para invertirlo como capital para la tienda que tiene para comprar más productos: golosinas, jugos, comida en lata, dulces, aguas gaseosa, etc. Esperan ver su negocio en el futuro más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herlinda Isabel is married and 27 years old. She finished the third year of elementary school, and has one child who is in school. She earns a living in business and with weaving. She started up the store thanks to the help of her husband and she has one year of experience. 

She decided to seek a loan which will be invested as capital for the store, as she must buy more products: snacks, juices, canned foods, sweets, soft drinks, etc. They hope to see their business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Esteban Rosalino

texts.es:
Esteban de 60 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es casado y su esposa le ayuda en las criás de los pollos para sus respectivas ventas.

Empezó trabajando como guardia en un hacienda en la entrada de playas con el esfuerzo de sus ahorros elaboro un galpón para criar pollo y huevos con la ayuda de su esposa en su domicilio. Con este negocio y mas los préstamo que realizo esta terminando de construir su casa. Labora diariamente desde la 7H00 am a 7H00 pm donde sale de alimentar a sus pollos para luego comercializarlo en las tiendas y restaurantes que quedan por el sector. Al principio tuvo inconvenientes con el mantenimiento de las criás de pollo cuando hacia calor se le moría o no crecían pero después les compro fertilizante y se arreglo el problema. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar fertilizantes vacunas balanceados y mas pollo para mantenimiento y respectivas ventas. La meta de el es terminar de construir su vivienda la cual le falta poco y mejorar su negocio haciéndose conocer en el sector ademas de gozar de buena salud y energía para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Esteban, 60, lives in a canton called Playas, one of the tourist areas of Ecuador with diverse populations of seafood. He is married and his wife helps him raise chickens for sale. 

He started out working as a security guard at an estate located at the entryway to Playas. By his effort and with his savings he built a coop for raising chickens and eggs at home with the help of his wife. With the help of this business and the loans that he took out, he is finishing up building his house. He labors daily from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m., going out to feed his chickens in order to later sell them to the stores and restaurants in the region. At first he had difficulties caring for the chicks as when the weather was hot they would die or fail to grow. Then however he bought them vitamins and the problem was solved. 

With the help of the loan he wants to buy vitamins, vaccines and chicken feed, and more chickens to raise for sale. The goal is to finish building his house which is nearly complete, and improve his business, becoming better known in the area, as well as enjoy good health and energy to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines, feed and chicks.

loans.name: Germania Aracely

texts.es:
Germanía de 53 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltero y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Inicio hace un tiempo atrás viendo que por su sector no hay ese tipo de actividad de ventas de comida entonces ella decidió abrir una. Labora sola de lunes a viernes de 5H00 pm a 9H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda. En un futuro dese abrir un restaurante mas grande.
texts.en: Germanía is 53 years old, and lives in Primavera, Duran.  (This is an area on the outskirts of the city that was originally built upon without official authorization. The area has several hills, streams and lakes that are visible as the remains of a deteriorating ecosystem).  She is single and has three adult children.  She works selling food.  She started this some time ago as there wasn't this kind of food sales activity in her area, so she decided to open one.  She works alone from Monday to Friday, from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m.  With the help of the loan, she wants to buy construction materials to finish building her home.  In the future, she wants to open a larger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cinder blocks.

loans.name: Nyansio

texts.en:
Nyansio is a farmer who grows Irish potatoes, maize and groundnuts. He hails from Kyenjojo, Uganda, and is 55 years old. He is married and a father to eight children. Like most families in his area, his wife is also a farmer. Nyansio owns a semi-permanent house and dreams of building a good one and educating his children. He has been a farmer for 15 years now. He began by growing groundnuts on two acres of land from where he accumulated capital to buy more produce and more acres of land. In the future, he wants to own a big store to sell his produce. His hardships are bad climatic conditions and lack of capital.
Nyansio wants a loan facility to enable him to buy produce of groundnuts and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy produce of groundnuts and maize for selling.

loans.name: Julio Bismar

texts.es:
Julio de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa se trabaja como estilista y hace manicure y a la vez cuida a un niño. Tienen un hijo con discapacidad y esta en el ultimo año de bachillerato. Su actividad e su taller de refrigeración y mecánico soldador.

Empezó hace 15 años escogió esta actividad a raíz de que su padre fue quien le enseño, luego tomo cursos para aprender mas . Labora diariamente en su taller reparando electrodomésticos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas repuestos para su taller y arreglar su vivienda en la compras de cerámicas para piso. En un futuro quiere cambiar de negocio comprarse un carro para hacer de taxi y ampliar su vivienda y que su hijo llegue hasta la universidad y seguir D-miro.
texts.en:
Julio, aged 44, lives in an urban area in El Guasmo (so named because of the tree species Guazuma Ulmifolia). El Guasmo is a crowded, lower-class neighborhood in Guayaquil that was formerly a ranch.  His wife works as a stylist and does manicures while caring for a child.   They have a child with disabilities, who is in the final year of high school. 

Julio's business is a refrigeration and mechanical welding workshop.  He started it 15 years ago, and chose this activity because of his father.  His father was the one who taught him, then he took courses to learn more.  He works daily in his workshop repairing appliances. With the help of the loan he wants to buy more spare parts for his workshop and fix up his home with the purchase of floor tiles.  

In the future he wants to change business and buy a car to use as a taxi. He also wants to expand his home and for his child to reach college, and to continue with D-MIRO.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cinder-blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Ninfa Minoslaba

texts.es:
La Señora. Ninfa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida y la  variedad de su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña Ninfa tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Ninfa tiene una tienda de comestibles  hace 10 años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo y trabaja desde las 12 del medio día hasta las 3 de la mañana.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos y más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.
 
Su sueño es conservar su salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Señora Ninfa is a member of the communal bank, “Mujeres Triunfadoras.”  She lives in the neighborhood of Batan in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and great architectural and natural beauty.  Its people are very warm, and it has a variety of gastronomy, both local and foreign, that captivates the palate.

Doña Ninfa is 41, is a single mother of an 8-year-old son, who goes to school in the city.  She doesn’t have her own home, so she rents.

Señora Ninfa has had a grocery store for 10 years.  She works in it every day from noon until 3 a.m.  This is her first loan with her communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, detergent, sausages, and other basic goods to supply her business.  Her dream is to maintain her health so she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Dalila Sarai

texts.es:
Dalila, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la tortillería, inicio con su madre, ahora posee su propio negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado, esta es su fuente de ingreso con la que ayuda a su esposo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz y leña, para preparar más tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara para que tenga los materiales necesarios y pueda continuar con su venta.
Su aspiración es lograr una mayor comodidad y tranquilidad en su negocio, a través de financiamientos que le permitan desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Dalila lives with her husband, and they don’t have children.  She has a business making tortillas that she started with her mother. She works from Monday through Saturday, and this source of income helps her husband cover their home’s needs.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood to prepare more tortillas.  This loan will help her buy the materials she needs to continue with her sales.

Her aspiration is to achieve greater comfort and peace with her business through finances that will let her develop it.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and spray his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Elida Elvecia

texts.es:
Elida, se dedica a la venta de perfumería y cosméticos variados, vive con su esposo; inicio el negocio hace un año y medio, en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su hermana a vender, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, con esta compra fortalecerá  el inventario,  para atender mejor a los clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
Su objetivo es mantener un negocio fuerte, rentable, que incrementen sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Elida has a business selling various perfumes and cosmetics.  She lives with her husband.  She started this business a year and a half ago.  Her sister occasionally helps her sell.  She started this business through her own initiative.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like perfumes, creams, and makeup.  With these purchases, she will strengthen her inventory and be better able to attend to her customers and increase her profits.  Her goal is to maintain a strong, profitable business that will increase her sales and generate more income for her home.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics like perfumes, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell at her restaurant.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 39 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Elvira de 33 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Manejando su motocarro, Fredy mantiene a sus hijos, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ellos, puesto que tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Es una persona muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, lo cual ha hecho que las personas que lo conocen prefieran subir a su motocarro que al de la competencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, ya que así hace más amenos sus largos viajes. Lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar otra moto, ya que sueña con tener una empresa de transporte. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes asimismo afirma que cumplirá  con sus pagos. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un nuevo motocarro, para ello esta dispuesto a completarlo con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Fredy is 39 and is a very friendly and hard-working man.  He lives in his parents’ home with his wife, Elvira, who is 33, and their 6 beloved children, to whom he wants to offer a better standard of living.  By driving his motorcycle rickshaw, Freddy supports his children.  He knows that he has a lot of responsibility with them and has to watch over them.  He is a very happy person and always receives his customers with a smile on his lips, which makes people that know him prefer his motorcycle rickshaw over that of the competition.  What he likes most about his job is conversing with his passengers, since that always makes his long trips more enjoyable.

He has done this job for 17 years.  He thinks that working late at night is the most difficult part of his job.  With time, he hopes to be able to buy another motorcycle since he dreams about having a transportation company.  This will be his eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he is hoping for your support and is committed to make his payments on time.  With the 2,000 PEN requested along with money from his savings, he will buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cecilia Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Cecilia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida y la  variedad su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraño.
 
La Señora. Cecilia tiene 32 años, es divorciada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Cecilia es de profesión estilista y ejerce su profesión hace 10 años en su salón de belleza en el cual labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza como tintes de cabello, cremas, shampoo, etc. para su gabinete.

Su sueño es viajar a los EEUU.
texts.en:
Señora Cecilia is a member of the communal bank, “Mujeres Triunfadoras,” and lives in the Batan neighborhood in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and great architectural and natural beauty.  Its people are very warm, and it has a variety of gastronomy, both local and foreign, that captivates the palate.

Señora Cecilia is 32; divorced; and has 2 children, who are 16 and 13.  Her children go to secondary school in the city.  She doesn’t have her own home, so she rents.

Doña Cecilia is a stylist and has done this work for 10 years.  She works in her beauty salon every day from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  This is her first loan with her communal bank, to which she was invited by her sister.  She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products like hair dye, hair creams, and shampoos.  Her dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, creams, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Monica Antonia

texts.es:
Mónica es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.  Su préstamo anterior de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovejas, también nos cuenta que vende picarones (dulce limeño) en la plaza de Mañazo.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco ovejas para su engorde por quince días, luego las venderán a un mejor precio.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.  Su esposo trabaja en una mina en Arequipa.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,”  which is located in the district of Mañazo in the province and department of Puno.  She is 39, married, and has 3 children.  She completed secondary school.

She has had 3 loans with Manuela Ramos.  Her previous loan was for 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying and selling small animals like sheep.  She also tells us that she sells “picarones” (a type of doughnut from Lima) in the plaza of Mañazo.

This is her ninth loan, and it is for 1,200 PEN.  She will use it to buy 5 sheep to fatten for 2 weeks.  She will then sell them at a better price.  Her children help her with this business.  Her husband works in a mine in Arequipa.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.  What she likes most about her communal bank is saving money and making profits.

loans.use: to buy five sheep

loans.name: Solidario La Providencia Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario la provedencia: este grupo esta formado por nueve señoras la cuales tiene su negocio en diferente punto Doña Bertha es la lider D. este grupo ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva al igual que las otras socias ella noe cuenta que nececita el credito para la compra D. ropa nueva ya que esta conciente D. que nececita mas capital para trabajar, el grupo en si nececita este credito para la compra D. ropa nueva para la venta el sueño D. ellas es agrandar mas su negocio y tener un local mas granD. para aumentar sus ganancias,
texts.en:
'La Providencia'

This group is maD. up of nine ladies who each have their own business.  Bertha is the group's leader.  She sells new clothes as do the other group members.  She tells us that she needs a loan to buy new clothes as she is aware that she needs more capital in order to work.  The group as a whole needs this loan to buy new clothes to sell.  Their dream is to further expand their business and have a larger sales location so that they can increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.
Robert has been in the metal fabrication business for three years. He notes that his main challenge faced so far is lack of sufficient capital for expansion of his business. His goals are to expand his metal fabrication workshop and finish his family house, which is currently under construction. Robert needs the loan to renovate the business premises for his metal fabrication workshop.

loans.use: to renovate the business premises for his metal fabrication workshop.

loans.name: Dimas Marin

texts.es:
Dimas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, es empleado como vigilante de la alcaldía, además es albañil, su familia depende de él.
Actualmente esta remodelando parte de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en materiales de construcción, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, esta financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y mantenerla más segura en la época más lluviosa.
Su misión es trabajar por ofrecer a su familia una vida digna, mejorando las condiciones de la vivienda y ofreciéndoles alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Dimas lives with his wife and 2 children, who are 11 and 15.  He works as a security guard for the city.  He is also a construction worker, and his family depends on him.

He is currently remodeling part of his home, which is why he is requesting a loan to invest in construction materials like sand, cement, and labor.  This financing will help him improve the condition of his home and keep it safe in the rainy season.  His goal is to work to offer his family a decent life, to improve their living conditions, and to offer them nutrition and health.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ketly

texts.es:
Ketly, de 25 años es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio al que Ketly se dedica, es la venta de gallinas y patos, a los cuales tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde tiene muchos clientes y el dinero que obtiene de sus ventas es muy bueno.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio de Transporte. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en:
Ketly is 25 and is very friendly and hard-working.  He lives in his parents’ home, and he is willing to work very hard to improve his quality of life.  He has a business selling hens and ducks, for whom he feeds and cares for very well.  His stand is located in the Bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa, where he has a lot of customers.  He makes good money from his sales.

What he likes most about his job is feeding his animals, since he raises them with a lot of care.  He has had this business for 1 year.  He thinks the most difficult part of his job is being at his stand all day waiting for customers.  In the future, he plans to start a transportation business.  This will be his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He knows that he has to make his payments on time, and he is willing to do this.  He is a very happy and responsible member of his communal bank.  With the 2,000 PEN he is requesting, he will buy feed for his animals, since he knows that he needs to keep them well-fed if he wants to receive a good price for them.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas for processing local brew.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria.
La señora Lucia es socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de San José del Movimiento Manuela R., ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de chifleria (candados, linternas, cepillos, otros de uso personal)  También se dedica a la venta de leche y venta de ovinos y vacunos.  Con el préstamo solicitado comprará candados, linternas, pilas, cepillos, fósforos, detergentes, gaseosa, etc., 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtido y abastecido con diversos productos para el hogar.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,” which is located in the district of Mañazo in the province and department of Puno.  She is 30, a single mother, and has 3 children.  She studied through her third year of secondary school.

Señora Lucia recently joined the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,” which is part of the Manuela R. movement.  She needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will invest in her business of selling miscellaneous items like padlocks, flashlights, brushes, and items for personal use.  She also sells sheep and cow’s milk.  With the requested, loan, she will buy padlocks, flashlights, batteries, brushes, matches, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked supply store with various products for the home.  What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy padlocks, flashlights, batteries, brushes, matches, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: El Fresnito Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "EL FRESNITO", ya que en la comunidad que viven lleva este nombre. Esta ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes. La señora Adelia es una integrante del grupo. Ella estudio hasta la primaria en su comunidad. La señora se dedica a la elaboracion de costuras en su  localidad. Tiene dos hijos (una niña y un niño).La señora se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de costuras desde hace varios años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en la mercancia como hilos, agujas y tela. Sus clientas dicen que su mercancia es muy bonita ya que las decora con mucho ingenio y de muy buena calidad. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos ya que desea que tengan una carrera y un mejor futuro, también para apoyar en los gastos de su familia para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called, “El Fresnito,” and is named after the community where it’s located.  It is located in the state of México.  The group has 9 members.  Señora Adelia is one of the members.  She studied through primary school in her community.  She is a seamstress in her town.  She has 2 children (one boy and one girl).  She has had her business for several years, and she will invest her loan in supplies like thread, needles, and fabric.  Her customers say that her merchandise is very pretty since she decorates it with a lot of creativity, and it is high quality.  With the money she makes, she wants to save for her children’s education since she wants them to have a career and a better future.  She also wants to support her family’s living costs so they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise like thread, needles, and fabric.

loans.name: Carmen Amapola

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca en un sector muy concurrido de esta ciudad, esta localidad  es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida y la variedad de su gastronomía  cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Carmen tiene 47 años, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 15 años de edad que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión topógrafo, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Carmen es comerciante ambulante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, realiza esta actividad hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para tener más variedad. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Triunfadoras (Successful Women).  She lives in the Batan sector of the city of Cuenca.  This is a city with a cold climate, has great architectural and natural beauty, its people are warm and the gastronomic variety captures the palates of visitors and residents.

Mrs, Carmen is 47 years old, married and has a 15 year old daughter that is studying in a school in the city.  Her husband is a topographer.  They do not own their home and live in the house of a family member.

Carmen is a traveling merchant, selling all types of clothing.  She has been doing this for the last 3 years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan through the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of merchandise, such as slacks, blouses, T-shirts and clothing for children, to offer more variety.

Her dream is to own her home.

loans.use: to purchase slacks, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Tiene estudios universitarios.
Su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carnes de cordero.  Trabaja desde hace tres ciclos con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco degollados de cordero.  Nos cuenta que los compra en las ferias de la  localidad y los vende a las tiendas, en el negocio la ayudan su suegro y su cuñado, su esposo trabaja en la mina de Cusco.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y tener su propia tienda de carne así mejorar las ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the communal bank  “Santa Rosa de San José”, located in the Mañazo district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has one child.  She has attended university.
Her first loan was for 500 New Soles, money which she invested in her business of buying and selling lamb meat.  She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement through three cycles.
With this new loan of 1200 New Soles she will buy five lamb carcasses.  She buys them at the local markets and she sells to stores.  Her father in law and brother in law help her in the business.  Her husband works in the mine at Cusco.
Her dream is to grow her business and have her own meat store this way improving her income.
What she likes about the communal bank is the ease and punctuality of the loans.

loans.use: to purchase five carcasses of lamb.

loans.name: Santos Isidoro

texts.es: Santos Isidoro tiene 53 años, es una persona humilde. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. El se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras en el mercado más cercano, el tiene sus clientes que le venden sus productos favorables. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y ha trabajado en diferentes actividades pero necesitaba algún negocio que le proporcionara ganancias diarias y es así que decide establecer una pulpería. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y golosinas, pan, refrescos, galletas y gaseosas. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en: Santos Isidoro is 53 years old and is a humble person.  He makes a living running a general store.  He gets up very early in the morning to make the purchases in a nearby market, he has his vendors where he gets his favorite products.  He has been in this business for more than 23 years.  He has liked merchandising since he was very young and has worked at various jobs.  He needed a business that would provide a steady income and for this reason he set up this general store.  He is requesting this loan to invest it in purchase of general merchandise for his store, such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, candies, bread, beverages, crackers and sodas.  His biggest dream is to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, beans, sugar and candy, bread, beverages, crackers and sodas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de María está ubicado en su propia casa, ella tiene un puesto de comida, que  es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo su especialidad los Juanes y el Tacacho (Platillos típicos de la selva peruana), con los cuales se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo esta afición, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes al mismo tiempo. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un restaurante, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que invertir bien el dinero si quiere que su negocio progrese. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en: María is 43 años, simple and hard-working.  She lives in her own home with her husband, José, 35 and they have 3 children who they support.  Maria works out of her home selling prepared food, and has steady clients who enjoy her cooking, especially dishes such as "Juanes y el Tacacho" (typical cuisine of the Peruvian Amazon).  Maria loves cooking and has been selling prepared foods for two years, striving to satisfy her customers even when many must be served at the same time.  She hopes one day to open a proper restaurant to better serve her clients.  This is her fourth credit from MFP, which has helped her business to prosper., and she is very grateful to all who support her endeavor  She will use the 1,500.00 soles to buy an inventory of ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make prepared foods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a produce business selling ground nuts [peanuts] and popping corn for 20 years. Before that, Grace used to sell tomatoes in the markets. Her hardships are price fluctuations and high transport costs. Her vision is to become a wholesale dealer of dry foods.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and popping corn to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 17, 13 y 8 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo trabajan la agricultura y ganadería, pues a Blanca sus padres le inculcaron este trabajo y al casarse formo su familia con un agricultor para compartir la misma actividad económica.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sembrar maíz, ya que están iniciando la preparación para que la siembra reciba todos los insumos necesarios para la producción.
Para ella tener una producción abundante es su principal objetivo,  ya que de ahí dependen sus ingresos y los beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and her children who are 8, 13, and 17 years old.  She and her husband work together in agriculture and raising livestock.  Blanca's parents taught her this work and when she married, she married a farmer so they could share the same economic activity.  

Currently, she is asking for this loan to purchase pesticide and fertilizer to plant corn since she is beginning preparation so that her crop receives all of the materials necessary for production.

Her main goal is to have an abundant harvest, since her income and her family's benefits depends on it.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Job

texts.en: Job is 28 years old and married with two children, ages 6 and 3 years old. He lives in his own house with four people in Hoima, Uganda. For 10 years now, Job has been running a produce business selling beans and dry cassava. From it, he has been able to educate his children. He started purchasing items using a bicycle but now has a motorcycle which he uses. However, in the future, Job hopes to own a bigger store. He is requesting a loan to buy beans and dry cassava for selling at a margin.

loans.use: to buy beans and dry cassava to sell.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, vende tortillas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, poseen casa propia y desde hace 6 años está vendiendo tortillas, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia.
Por el momento necesita de maíz y leña para el negocio, pues son sus materiales primarios para la venta, este préstamo será una gran ayuda que le permitirá tener todo lo necesario para su negocio.
Su propósito es que su negocio sea rentable, producir más y pagar oportunamente este préstamo, que es su fortaleza para el negocio.
texts.en:
Elsy sells tortillas.  She lives with her husband and her two children, ages 8 and 5.  They have their own house.  She has been selling tortillas for six years.  This business developed through her own initiate.

She currently needs corn and firewood for the business.  These are the primary materials she uses in order to make her S..  This loan will be a great help; it will allow her to have everything she needs for her business.

Her aim is for her business to be profitable, to produce more, and to repay this loan in due time.  The loan will strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 34-year-old married female with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Enid has worked in the clothing business selling dresses, skirts, shirts and shoes for the last seven years. She started with 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings and now has 2,800,000 Shillings. Her vision is to expand her business up to 5,000,000 Shillings, construct property in town, and educate her children. Enid needs the loan facility to restock items of dresses, skirts, trousers and shirts to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, trousers, shirts and shoes for resale.

loans.name: El Bosque Group

texts.es: La señora Margarita es natural D. Lima, tiene 57 años, casada y con 03 hijos, tiene un negocio familiar dedicado a la venta D. materiales D. construccion  especialmente a la venta D. ladrillos empezaron aproximadamente hace doce años, la señora Margarita al inicio vendia pollo en el mercado y su esposo era chofer D. camion, juntaron un buen capital y compraron su primer camioncito luego empezaron a realizar servicio D. carga y finalmente se dedicaron D. lleno a la venta D. materiales D. construccion. Su meta es poder tener una cadena D. ferreterias.
texts.en:
Margarita is a native of Lima, 57 years old, and married with 3 children. She has a family business dedicated to selling construction materials, especially bricks. The business began approximately 12 years ago. 

Initially, Margarita sold chicken in the market and her husband was a truck driver. They gathered a good amount of capital and bought their first small delivery truck. Then they began to haul goods and, finally, they dedicated themselves full time to selling construction materials.

Their goal is to have a chain of hardware stores.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly construction products.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ignoly de 32 años y su querida hija Penny de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La fábrica de hielo de Pedro funciona en su casa, su hielo es distribuido a sus vecinos y a todas las tiendas de su barrio, los cuales son consumidos rápidamente debido al intenso calor que hace en la ciudad de Pucallpa. La mayoría de clientes ya saben que es Pedro el que hace el hielo y muchas veces le compran directamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar todo el hielo que quiera, sin embargo el cambio de temperatura le puede hacer daño. Por ahora su propósito es crecer su negocio para tener más ingresos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de todos para que pueda desarrollar su negocio. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más moldes para preparar su refrescante hielo.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 38, is a very unassuming and hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his 32 year old wife, Ignoly, and his beloved 2 year old daughter, Penny.  Pedro wishes to offer them a better future.  

Pedro’s ice factory is in his house.  His ice is distributed to his neighbors and to all of the stores in his neighborhood.  The ice is consumed rapidly due to the intense heat in the city of Pucallpa.  Most of his customers know that it is Pedro who makes the ice, and many times they buy directly from him.

The thing he likes most about his work is being able to use all of the ice he wants.  However, the change in temperature could cause damage to the ice.  His current objective is to grow his business in order to have more income.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He therefore hopes for everyone’s collaboration in order to be able to develop his business.  He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy more molds to prepare his refreshing ice.

loans.use: to buy more ice molds.

loans.name: Union Obregon Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Union Obregon" porque asi se llama la colonia donde esta el grupo, esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en Mexico, el grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Fabiola es integrante del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es comerciante, tiene en total 3 hijos una mujer y 2 varones, ella se dedica a la venta de parguas, negocio que inicio hace 6 años, solicita este prestamo para comprar más paraguas por mayoreo para que le den mejor precio y de diferentes modelos, tamaños y colores ya que es la temporada de lluvias y es cuando tiene mayores ventas, sus clientes se sienten contentos porque con ella encuentran una gran variedad en paraguas, ademas de los precios accesibles que les brinda, al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente contenta porque tendra la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio, quiere este prestamo para comprar mercancia, con las ganancias que obtenga pagara las inscripciones de la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en: This group is called  "Union Obregon" because this is the name of the colony where they are located.  It is in the Morelos state in Mexico.  The group is made up of 8 members and this is the fourth time that they request a loan.  Fabiola is a member of the group.  She is 26 years old, attended through the third year of high school and is a merchant.  She has 3 children, one girl and two boys.  She sells umbrellas, a business that she started 6 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy more umbrellas at wholesale, this way getting better pricing and different styles, sizes and colors. Since it is the rainy season, this is when she has the best sales.  Her customers are happy because she provides a good variety of umbrellas and also reasonable prices.  At the time of the loan request, she feels happy to be able to invest in her business.  She wants the loan to buy merchandise and she will use the income that she obtains to enroll her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more umbrellas.

loans.name: Felipe Cidar

texts.es: Felipe Cidar tiene 56 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 13 años que se hace cargo de este negocio, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarles a su esposa y dos hijos lo más necesario. El dio inicio a este negocio por su Padrastro que le enseño  ya que fue él quien le enseño este oficio, mas tarde Felipe lo ocuparía como su medio de vida. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, vidrios, aceite, batería, entre otros  para su vehiculó. Sueña con tener otro vehiculó para que dejárselo a sus hijos.
texts.en: Felipe Cidar is 56 years old, and he offers taxi service.  He has been in charge of this business for 13 years for he has always been concerned about providing for his wife and two children.  He started this business with the help of his step father.  Since he taught him this trade, Felipe would be his means of support later on.  This is why he is requesting the loan to purchase tires, glass, oil, and a battery among others items for his vehicle.  He dreams of having another car to be able to leave for his children.

loans.use: to buy tires, glass, oil, and a battery among others.

loans.name: Cris Katherin

texts.es:
Cris Katherin nació en la ciudad de San Francisco del departamento de Ayacucho (Perú) y tiene 23 años de edad. Actualmente, Cris Katherin vive en la misma hermosa ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cris Katherin es docente de profesión y trabaja en el colegio privado “San Jose Obrero - Didaskalion” de la ciudad de Pomacanchis. Ya es un año que enseña al nivel secundario y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Cris Katherin requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para pagar sus estudios de la maestría que está realizando. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Los Emprendedores” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Cris Katherin was born in the city of San Francisco in the department of Ayacucho (Peru) and is 23 years old. Currently, Cris Katherin lives in the beautiful city of Cusco (Peru). She is a teacher by profession and works in the "San Jose Obrero - Didaskalion" private school in the city of Pomacanchis. She has been teaching second grade for a year now and it is going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. At this time, Cris Katherin needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay for her ongoing teaching studies.

She is a responsible and hardworking person and it was because of these qualities that her fellow group members invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa's "Los Emprendedores" ("The Entrepreneurs") communal bank.

loans.use: to pay for her teaching studies

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Valle, vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos de su gente sale a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca y regresa en la noche, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.
 
Doña María tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos y ganado a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus terrenos. 

Su meta es  arreglar y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the El Valle Communal Bank.  She lives in the Zhidmad parish.  This place is surrounded by vegetation, and its people devote themselves to raising animals and farming.  Many of its people leave to work in the city of Cuenca and return at night.  They are kind and charismatic people.

María is 37 years old, married, and has four children.  Her first two children go to high school, and the last two children go to elementary school in the area.  Her husband has migrated looking for better work in order to improve the household finances.  The house where they live is their own property.

María devotes herself to agriculture and to raising animals like guinea pigs, pigs, and cattle.  She sells them in her own community.

This is her fifth loan with her communal bank.  She will use it to buy fertilizer for her land.

Her goal is to fix up and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 35 years old, married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional items to sell in her store such as milk, groceries, etc.
Leny has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for nine years and also earns an income from vegetable vending. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señorita. Ana es socia del banco comunal El Valle, vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos de su gente sale a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca y regresa en la noche, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.
 
La Señorita Ana tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa con sus padres y les ayuda económicamente, su papá labora en la construcción y su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar, la casa en la que habitan es propia siendo el sacrificio de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años y trabaja de lunes a sábado.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para iniciar con la crianza.
 
Su sueño es  tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the 'El Valle' community bank.  She lives in Zhidmad parish which is surrounded by vegetation.  The locals work raising animals and farming.  Many people go to work in the city of Cuenca and return at night.  They are very kind and charismatic people.

Ana is 25 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  She helps them out financially.  Her dad works in the building trade and her mom is a housewife.  They own their own home which her parents made sacrifices to acquire.

Ana works as a maid.  She has been in this line of work for ten years and works from Monday to Saturday.

This is Ana's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying pigs that she will start raising.

Ana's dream is to own her own business such as a store.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 28 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucel has requested a loan of 20,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs. Lucel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.
In the future, Lucel would like to save money, and to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Valle, vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad, este  lugar que se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente sale a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca y regresa en la noche, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.
 
La Señora. María es muy joven con apenas 19 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo maquinaria pesada, con el apoyo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, cerdos, pollos y ganado, con la leche que obtiene de su ganado hace quesillo para la venta.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus pastos.

Su meta es crecer en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'El Valle' community bank.  She lives in Zhidmad parish which is surrounded by vegetation.  The locals work raising animals and farming.  Many people go out to work in the city of Cuenca and return at night.  They are very kind and charismatic people.

María is very young.  She is just 19 years old and married with three children aged 7, 5 and 1.  Her eldest two children are attending an elementary school in her community.  Her husband is a driver by profession and he drives heavy machinery.  Through their joint support and sacrifice, they have managed to build their own home.

María raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and cattle.  With the milk that she gets from her cattle, she makes 'quesillo' (soft cheese) which she sells.

This is María's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying manure to improve her pasture.  Her goal is to grow in her animal raising business.

loans.use: to buy manure for her pasture

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase a fishing net, gasoline and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Mercy has been in her business for 16 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net, gasoline and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 30 years old, married and has two children aged ten and one. In 2002, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, Shanti supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Kiva partner, Patan Business and Professional Women, and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Shanti plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Nhessa

texts.en:
Nhessa is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.
Nhessa has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from hog raising. Nhessa aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
Suzel is 56 years old, married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dried fish trading business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.
Suzel has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried fish trading business for ten years and also earns an income from hog raising. Suzel aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mukunda

texts.en:
Mukunda is 61 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged 20.  In 1999, she established her business raising cows.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young dairy cow.  

In the future, Mukunda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires.  Its gases can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 50 years-old .  She is married and has 3 children, aged 29, 26 and 14.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase inventory for the store. 

In the future, Sita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 40 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 15.  In 2001, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of the store. 

In the future, Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Indramaya

texts.en:
Indramaya is 40 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 10.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fetilizers. 

In the future, Indramaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tejkumari

texts.en:
Tejkumari is 50 years-old .  She is married and has 4 children, ages 26, 23, 19 and 17.  In 1995, she established  her furniture business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid,  5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood and timber for her business. 

In the future, Tejkumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of his or her lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timber

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
The Melati Group is made up of 16 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 20,800,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) and each member will receive 1,300,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on the best practices for pig raising. This is their third loan with MUK.

Ni Ketut is the head of the Melati Group. She is married and has three children. Her younger son is in school. Her husband earns money as a carpenter, but Ni Ketut would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after five months of fattening. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a lumberyard business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sugarcane farming. Ma. Fe is requesting to borrow 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase a chainsaw to be used in her lumberyard business.
Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she is able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a chainsaw to be used in her business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Nelia has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from sugarcane farming. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Muniya

texts.en: Muniya is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, who is four years old.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store.  In the future, Muniya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no larger than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Perla has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Joan works very hard to provide for her family.
Joan runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Joan has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, sardines, sugar, etc. In the future Joan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Ma.ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is 55 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Ma. Ana works very hard to provide for her family.
Ma. Ana runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Ma. Ana has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, toothpaste, soap, cream, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nanumaya

texts.en:
Nanumaya, a 45-year-old married mother of a grown child, age 30, established her cow-raising business in 2000. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. Having already received and repaid five loans from Patan BPW, she used her most recent one to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Nanumaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Never raised for beef, their milk is used to make curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer). Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk daily, each liter selling in the local market for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Subdra is 40 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 5. In 2000, she established  her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Subdra plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 58 years old and is a widow with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.
Monina has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from Kiva partner, NWTF, before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for 12 years and also earns an income from selling chicken and farming rice. Monina aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her old and broken house.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 53-year-old married woman currently residing in the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. She has four children, and they are generally adult-aged and have their own families.

Divina is engaged in a vending activity where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables within the community where she lives. She has been doing it for almost 10 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. According to her, through her vending activity she has been able to raise her children and send them to school. 

With her dreams and goals in life, she would like to continue improving her backyard vegetable garden. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital amounting of PHP6,000 for the improvement of her business. She wants to purchase additional vegetable seeds and pesticides. Divina hopes that her requested loan will be fulfilled so that she can improve the business that she manages.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 33 years-old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 3. 

In 2000, Parbati established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase inventory of her store. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married. She is now 31 years old and blessed with only one child. She is managing a small general store where she sells different grocery items like junk foods, soft drinks, candies, frozen foods and other daily used products. Rosemarie had this business for almost 3 years. 

Rosemarie is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used in purchasing additional items to sell like soft drinks, junk foods, candies and frozen foods. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to strengthen her small business in order to supplement the income of her husband in financing the education of their daughter and to save funds for their future. She hopes that she can able to improve her small store through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, junk food, candies, and frozen foods.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is now 47 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. Janette is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Janette is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. Janette grows rice and has been in rice production for almost 30 years.

In the future, Janette hopes to have a plentiful harvest so that she can earn income to support the education of their children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to improve their sources of income. She hopes that KIVA lenders will continuously assess her so that she can be able to start another kind of business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Arodgina

texts.en:
Arodgina works hard to support her family. Arodgina is married and has a lumber business in the Philippines. Arodgina has been in this business for ten years. She also earns additional income by farming rice and by buying and selling charcoal and coconuts.

Arodgina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.

In the future, Arodgina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhin, age 30, is married with two children who attend school. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in the community. 

Mrs. Chhin is a domestic rice trader and she rents a small store where she operates her rice-selling business. She always buys rice in bulk at a wholesale price from her suppliers, and then resells it at a profit. Usually Mrs. Chhin earns around $2.50 a day to meet the needs of her family. For more income, Mrs. Chhin needs capital to purchase more rice to sell. 

In the future, Mrs. Chhin hopes she can buy her own store.  She also wants to support her children's education by putting them through a university.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 21 years old and married with two children.
