She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income by buying and selling pigs. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and married with three children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Elvira has borrowed and re-paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income by farming rice.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 49 years old and married with one child.

Lorena earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store where she sells ready-to-wear clothes.

Lorena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 47 years old, is a farmer and fish seller with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have 6 children, four are studying. 

Every month, Thy spends $47 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy three cattle for doing farming. Previously, her husband was a soldier for about 15 years. The income of a soldier is too small to support the family, so he decided to stop being a soldier and began helping his wife to earn money. This family would like to feed eels to sell because they saw that their neighbor can make a good profit from selling eels. Her plan is to expand her new career, if it can make a good income and she can feed more cattle to sell. For her children, she wants to send them to study until they are able to get a good job.

loans.use: to buy three cattle for farming.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Nelia is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Nelia has been farming vegetables and rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 38 years old, is a cleaner in one university in Siemreap province. Her husband is a construction worker and motor taxi driver. Their income is $6.50 per day. They have 4 children, three are studying. 

Every month Chanthy spends around $70 on expenses for her family. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy baby pigs and crickets to feed. She wants to have a small farm for raising animal such as, pigs, chicken, and ducks. For her children, she will try to earn more money to support them to school until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos from NWTF to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. Maria has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Salve Mae

texts.en:
Salve Mae is 22 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Salve Mae has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Salve Mae aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing, 26 years old, is a construction worker. His wife is working in a massage shop. Their income is $10 per day. He has 3 children, one is studying and the rest are too small to be in school. 

Every month, he spends around $63 for family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a boat engine to do fishing, besides working as a construction worker. Because his current work can’t make a good enough profit, he decided to ask his wife to sell fish and groceries at the market so they could save more money. For his children, he has to send them to school, at least to finish high school.

loans.use: to by a boat engine to do fishing.

loans.name: Jorevic

texts.en:
Jorevic is 26 years old and single. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jorevic has a general store in the Philippines. Jorevic requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in his store.

Jorevic has been in this business for 10 years. He would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach is a 63-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Lach is married to Sin, age 68. The couple works together in the farming business, and they have three children. Two of the children are married and one is single. Two of Mrs. Lach's children are food sellers in  Kompong Som Province. Presently, they intend to decorate their store but they lack some funds to do that. To help support her kids’ business, Mrs. Lach would like to ask for a Kiva loan for her kids to rent a new store and also to use to decorate their store.

loans.use: to assist her kids to rent a new store and decorate their store.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 59 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Victorina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Victorina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Victorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 23 years old, is a cook. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $5.50 per day. She has one child, and there are 6 members in this family. 

Sopheak spends $85 on food and $25 more on other expenses every month. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work because every day she has to spend time and money for transportation. In the future, she want to get a small shop to sell food and to help her husband to have some construction equipment to do construction.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother traveling to work.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Melina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippinesand also earns additional income from selling fruit.  Melina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy fish, fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Melina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is now 42 years old and still single. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 8,000 per month. 

Arthur is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides for his farm. He grows rice and has been in rice production for almost 10 years.

In the future, Arthur hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to save for the future. He is so thankful with the Kiva lenders who offer financial assistance for him to increase his crop yields. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to assess him so he can continuously yield a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet, 33 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a guard at Angkor Wat temple. Their income is $7 per day. They have three children; one is also a guard but in different place from his father. 

Every month, Vet spends around $66 on expenses for the family. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy columns for repairing her house. Her house is so short that it makes her feel uncomfortable to stay and hard to keep things in a proper place. She wants to buy more goods to sell as now she has little inventory and does not meet the needs of the customers. For her children, she commits to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy columns for repairing the house.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is 38 years old and is married. She has 4 school aged children. Macario is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 4,000 per month. 

Macario is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides. He grows vegetables and has had this production for almost 20 years.

In the future, Macario hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn a higher income to finance the schooling of their children and satisfy their basic daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Chomrouen

texts.en:
Chomrouen, 28 years old, is a cook in a restaurant. Her husband is waiter in the same restaurant. Their income is $8 per day. They have not yet had any children but are planning to have some soon. There are 5 member in this family. 

Every month, Chomrouen spends $70 on food, and $25 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her brother traveling to work. She wants to have small restaurant by herself, if she can make a good income and save a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother traveling to work.

loans.name: Kuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuong is a rice farmer from Kompong Cham province, who has ten years experience in the crop-growing business. Currently, she plants rice crops and a few kinds of vegetables on her farmland. She earns around $1.50 a profit a day. In addition, Mrs. Kuong owns a wooden kiosk in front of her house and sells a few items, for instance: foods, soft drinks, cooking ingredients and other goods. Mrs. Kuong’s husband has worked in the public sector since 2000 as a chief villager, and he earns a specific salary monthly. 

As the rainy season is coming now, Mrs. Kuong has requested a loan to plant peanuts and buy additional items for resale. She hopes she can enlarge her mixed goods-selling business and rebuild her house to make it bigger than it is at the present time. She dreams of her children getting degrees.

loans.use: to plant peanuts and buy additional items for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 28-year-old married father who currently lives in the province of Siem Reap. He owns a medium size shop next to his house in the village where he provides a boat-repairing service. He often increases his clients every month because of the good service he provides to them. He started his service in early 2005 and he earns about $4 per day mainly to cover his family’s daily expense. His wife manages the household work and sells some merchandise to earn some revenue. Ly will be using the loan to buy some spare parts for boats in order to provide his boat-repairing service to his customers. Ly has only two school-aged kids who depend on his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his boat-repair service

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Mrs. Kum has been spending most of her life in the farming business. She always uses her existing farmland to grow rice and other crops. She is generating an average income of US $1.25. Mrs. Kum’s husband also assists her in the agriculture sector as well. They are blessed with four single children, one of whom is employed as a local garment factory worker. Besides her current work, she often goes around her community using her old motorbike as a vehicle in order to transport many types of old things or secondhand things such as papers, bottles, cans, old wires, and other use goods. After buying, she always brings them to resell to get a little income. Mrs. Kum will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting while it rains almost every day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Croet

texts.en: In Cambodia, there are many kinds of businesses but the most popular field is farming. One of them is Mrs. Croet. She has been a domestic rice cultivator for a long time in Kompong Cham Province. On average, she can make a little income from her crop-planting business. She makes approximately $2 each day. Her husband works in the fields frequently alongside her. For generating extra income, Mrs. Croet’s husband also works in the construction field as a construction worker. Traveling expenses always increase from day-to-day and she really wants to decrease the expenses. Mrs. Croet would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work place. Mrs. Croet has only one child who is attending school and living under to support with food, clothes and education. Mrs. Croet and her husband are shown in the photo in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work place.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace, 25 years of age, is married to a policeman. They have no children yet. She has had a retail store for almost 11 years and she sells a variety of different products. Her net income is 6,000 PHP, monthly. She's asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell. She hopes to continue to avail loans and achieve her dream for her family through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 46 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Образование у нее среднее. Она более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа бычков. Она намерена закупить бычков для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи.
texts.en: Ruzigul lives in the region of Yavan. She is 46 years old. She is a widow with five children. He has secondary education. For more than ten years Ruzigul has been doing animal husbandry. She breeds large horned cattle. She is asking for a loan to buy calves. She plans to buy calves for the feeding and future resale.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 55 years of age, is married and blessed with 4 children. She has had a retail store for almost 2 years and she sells a variety of different products. Her net income is 5,000 a month. She's asking for a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles and coffee to sell. She wanted to thank Kiva lenders for their assistance in availing the loan and hopes lenders will continue to fund her loan requests in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
Davlat lives and works in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He owns a business of selling clothing at the local market. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise, which is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Davlat stay afloat with his business for 3 years. In this business, his sister helps him. He purchases his goods from Korvon market. Besides this business, Davlat is engaged in services of transportation. Davlat would like to repair his car and increase his working capital. For this purpose Davlat has requested a loan of 4500 TJS. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to repair his car and increase his working capital.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.ru: Айша проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 54 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Айша имеет среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Она хочет увеличить количество крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Aysha lives in the Yavan district.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Her son works in Russia.  Aysha has a secondary education.  Currently, she is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for subsequent resale.  She has been involved in this type of business for 15 years.  Aysha is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.  She wants to increase the quantity of cattle and small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Flores Marie is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Flores Marie has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Flores Marie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of lumber and other materials for her business.

Flores Marie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Flores Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more lumber and other materials for her furniture business.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is a hardworking man. For 2 years Suhrob has been running his business of transportation services. He transports people in his local city. Suhrob works hard in order to make a good profit and keep his family in good living conditions. He would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS for purchasing a new car in order to provide his clients with a comfortable and convenient ride.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a personal beauty products (Avon) dealership business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Janeth has been in this business for four years.

In the future Janeth would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family & to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway, 42 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She's engaged in food vending, and she has a butcher shop in which she sells pork meat. She's been in this business for almost six years. Her net income is 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase pork and chicken meat to sell. She would like to continue taking loans to improve more of her business, and she hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pork and chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham has been in farming for four years, employing one farmhand and producing milk which he sells to the local market. He is age 31 and single. He runs a "posho" (cornmeal) mill in the local market in Eldoret town.

Abraham has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to enable him to venture into poultry farming by purchasing poultry. He says he wants to venture into poultry to supplement his dairy farming. He also wants to expand his half acre piece of land by purchasing more land and thereafter increase the number of his dairy cows.

Abraham says the common animal diseases have become very expensive to manage.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her old house.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Sharofat lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and the loving mother of one child. Her husband works in a firm that produces aluminum, which is called “Alumini Tojik.” She works in the local café of “Lazzat.” She cooks the national cake called “Sambusa” and bread. Sharofat would like to get a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan somoni for repairing her café and purchasing equipment for the production of ice cream. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to repair her café and buy of equipment for the production of ice cream.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and has five children. Virginia is married and has one child who is presently in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feed.

Virginia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is 41 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Felixberta works very hard to provide for them.

Felixberta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like candy, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Felixberta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, biscuits, noodles, snack food, etc. 

Felixberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items  like candy, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en: Celedonia, 57 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She's engaged in food production and sells cured pork and sausages. She's been in this business for almost six years. Her net income is 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. She's asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make more sausages to sell. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Celedonia, who sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of her business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make more sausages to sell.

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.en:
Usmonali has a car and provides transportation services. He has been in this business for 2 years he has gained reach experience. The business is stable and generates the main considerable income for Usmoali’s family, allowing for improvement of their living conditions.  Currently Usmonali wants to buy a new car. That’s why he is seeking a loan of 4700 TJS.  Usmonali thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new car of “Tico” brand

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail works hard to support her family. Abegail is married and has an "abaca"-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca-making business.

Abegail has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Abegail would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her "abaca" (natural fiber) making business.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with four children (three boys and one girl). She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also does farming as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, beans, cooking fat oil, sweets and biscuits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, beans, cooking fat oil, sweets and biscuits.

loans.name: Kiloja

texts.en:
Kiloja is 29-years old, married and has two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). 

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. 

He dreams to be prominent farmer. 

He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Unity Is The Power Group

texts.en:
Theodorah is 52 years, married, and does not have any children. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in business for 40 years selling live chickens and running a "spazza" shop (spazza shops are small convenient corner stores). She requested this loan throgh WDB and Kiva to buy live chickens and spazza shop stock. She says that extra income from this loan will help her put food on the table for her family and also buy good clothes. She faces a challenge of customers who buy food on credit and fail to pay on time. 

Theodorah would like in future  to see her business grow and buy a new car. She thanks WDB a lot for lending her this loan amount.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and "spazza" shop stock.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito, 54 years old, is married and blessed with 4 children. He is engaged in food vending business and his primary activity is butcher shop. He sells pork meats in his village. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase hogs to sell as meat. His net income is 6,000 PHP a month. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to sell as meat

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genara is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her store.

Genara has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Genara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salaton

texts.en:
Salaton has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 31 years old, married to a house wife and blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his third loan and he plans to use it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Bozorkul

texts.ru: Бозоркул житель Яванского района. Ему 64 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, механизатор. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном он занимается посевом зерновых культур. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кроме того в свободное от работы время он занимается вспашкой земель на своем тракторе. Кредит берет для посева зерновых и злаковых культур, то есть для закупа семян.
texts.en: Bozorkul lives in the region of Yavan. He is 64 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Bozorkul has secondary specialized education - he is a mechanic. He now does agriculture mainly sowing cereals. He has a rich experience in this field. Besides that in his free time Bozorkul also plows the land on his tractor. He is taking out the loan to sow cereals and to buy seeds.

loans.use: to sow cereals

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Catching fish is the main part of 31-year-old Mrs. Soun’s everyday work. She and her husband live along the river in Siem Reap province. They use different kinds of fishing tools in their fishing activity. This couple makes an income around $7 each day to use for daily expenses. Mrs. Soun and her husband also support their three children who are enrolled in school. To earn extra income, her husband also works as a construction worker. 

Mrs. Soun will use her loan to purchase nets, a new boat and other fishing implements so she can catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase nets, a new boat and other fishing implements so she can catch more fish.

loans.name: Nairesiae

texts.en:
Nairesiae is a very hard-working lady, who practises mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 51 years old and married to Weldon, also a farmer, and they have five children.


She is applying for her fourth loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and other items for business use. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees.


She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and other items for business use

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a resident and farmer in Kisii area of South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for six years, employing one farmhand and producing tomatoes, maize, trees and potatoes. He is married with three children and works as an electrician for additional income.

Patrick has made a loan request of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to plough his horticultural land and buy horticultural seeds.This is Patrick's fourth loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He adds that the productivity of his farm will go up and help his family with their daily meals. He wants to buy a vehicle in future to venture into transport.

Patrick complains of poor market prices for his produce.

loans.use: to plough his horticultural farm and purchase seeds.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora has been in the trade for three years. Her perseverance, confidence, experience and work consistency have guaranteed the growth of her business. She is constantly increasing the assortment of fruits and berries which helps her increase her income. She is hoping to generate enough income and increase her working capital. Besides this business, in autumn and winter in the off-season she sells clothes and coverlets. Nigora would like to get a loan of 4500 TJS for purchasing berries in order to increase her profit.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
