Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy berries to sell

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is 27 years old and a married father of one child aged six years. Matano runs a food stall in Bombolulu, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last three years and has been a success. 


Matano has been a KADET client and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, mangoes, watermelon, cabbage and carrots to sell. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, mangoes, watermelon, cabbage and carrots to sell

loans.name: Vugukuri Group

texts.fr:
Aloys est un commerçant âgé de 56ans qui habite au Quartier Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il  fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis 3ans. Il est en même temps plombier. Il est veuf avec 2 enfants âgés de  26ans et 24ans. L’ainée étudie. Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école.

Son crédit de 200,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité d’huile de palme à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« VUGUKURI».
texts.en:
Éliane is the president of Vugukuri Group.

Here follows the business description of Aloys, the highlighted member of the group. He is a 56-year-old merchant living in the neighborhood of Kanyosha in the municipality of Bujumbura. He has been selling palm oil for three years. In addition, he is a plumber. He is widowed and the father of two children, aged 26 and 24. His eldest daughter is studying. Aloys himself did not attend school.

He will use his share of 200,000 Burundi francs in the group loan to increase his working capital. He will buy more palm oil for resale and make a big profit.

Aloys is a member of Vugukuri Community Group.

loans.use: to increase his supply of palm oil for resale and make a big profit.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosie is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosie has a souvenir sales business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her souvenir-making business.

Rosie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for souvenir-making business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 28-year-old housewife, who is also a mother of four children. Her husband Mahmoud sells carpets and household products for a living. Mohammad doesn’t own a shop. Instead he brings all his goods every day to a specific location in the market and starts selling regardless the weather  on that day.

So Wafaa wanted to support her husband and help him with his business by applying for this loan so they can have a shop in the future to display and sell all of his goods.

Since Wafaa is a conservative person, she asked for her husband to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To get her husband a shop to sell carpets in.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a widow with eight children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is delayed payments by creditors who fail to pay on time. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 51 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. She is engaged in the direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and apparel products in their village. She also sells native delicacies for additional income. Her net income is 6,000 PHP monthly in her selling businesses. Lolita is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase perfumes, lotions, powder, lipstick and clothes to sell. She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, lotions, powder, lipstick and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 44 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ethel has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Ethel has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is 51 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older son is a herder and his second son works for a private company. His younger three children attend college and secondary school. He manages a rag making business in his town with the help of his wife. He makes a variety of rags with different styles and designs. His products are well-known amongst his customers for quality and durability. In addition he makes shoes for all ages. 

Batmunh's family members all assist in his business operation. Therefore he is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a polite man who says, "We are committed to making quality products for our customers." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and some materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and some materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jabal

texts.en:
Jabal is 30 years old.  He is married and has two children between 2 and 7 years old.  He also has five adopted children between 2 and 20 years old. Jabal makes a living as the owner of a beans and Irish potatoes store. His business is well organized.  Jabal has seven years of experience in his business and works from 6am until 5:30pm every day except on Saturday.

Jabal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company S.A. in order to purchase more beans and Irish potatoes to sell. He hopes to increase the number of his customers as well as his profits. If successful, Jabal will save for the future and satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: buy beans and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda, 44 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She is engaged in the direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and apparel products in their village. Her net income is 6,000 PHP monthly. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase lipstick, perfumes, lotion and powder to sell. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase lipstick, perfumes, lotion and powder to sell

loans.name: Or

texts.en:
Mrs. Or is 53 years old and a married woman who lives in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh City. She and her husband are local rice cultivators, and they have three children. Two of their children are married and one attends school. The couple has two children who work in various jobs and they always share their monthly income for financial expenses. The family currently generates an income of approximately $6.66 per day. 

Mrs. Or will use her loan to build a new fence as theirs is too old and broken in some parts.

loans.use: to build a new fence.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 6 months to 11 years old. He has been running several businesses in the last 10 years. Vincent owns a cyber café and rents out spraying machines used for painting. He intends to use his loan to purchase another paint spraying machine for rental to his customers. 

Vincent hopes to open up another business in the future. He describes himself as honest and committed to his work.

loans.use: to purchase another paint spraying machine for rental to his customers.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

She operates a business of buying and selling chickens which she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because her place of operation is insecure. Saumu dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 50 chicks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 chicks for sale.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 38 years old, is a farmer. Her husband plants corn to sell; their income is $8 per day. They have four children, aged 21, 15, 13, and 3 years old; two are studying and one is working in a factory. Every month, Touch has to spend $27 on food, $10 on electricity, $7 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a corn throwing machine to help make her husband’s career easier. Her husband wants to buy more land on which to plant other fruit to sell to earn more profit as their children will need a lot of money for their schooling.

loans.use: To buy a corn throwing machine

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children between 3 and 5 years old.  Her business is well-organized. She employs two people to help her. Clementine has four years of experience in her business and works from 7am. until 7:30 pm every day except on the weekends.

Clementine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more Irish potatoes and tomatoes to sell. With the profits generated, Clementine will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: buy Irish potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Renfort Plus Group

texts.en:
Angèle, aged 40, is married and the mother of a daughter aged 22. Angèle is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Renfort Plus” which comprises 22 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Angèle has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She runs a general store in the eastern area of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $100 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. She will diversify her business by adding semolina for resale at profit with this next loan.

loans.use: to diversify her business by adding semolina for resale at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 35 years old, married, and has a son aged three and a half. He operates a business that sells secondhand clothes and employs two people. He has been selling mens, ladies, and children's clothes for eight years. Nickson plans to use this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes which he intends to resell.  

In the future, Nickson hopes to expand his business and open more outlets. He describes himself as welcoming. He also likes to sell quality brands.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur   est un plombier qui exerce dans ce métier depuis 07 ans. Il est spécialiste dans l’installation, l’entretien et la réparation de réseaux d’alimentation en eau potable, de lavabos, de toilettes.Il démarre son travail à 8 heures et descend à 19H.  Il est marié sans enfants.Il vie avec ses 6 freres et ses deux parents.Toute cette famille est a sa charge.Il paie ainsi les frais mensuels de scolarité de ses frères.Il dépenses 80000 FCFA par mois pour l’alimentation et achète fréquemment des médicaments pour sa maman qui est très maladive.
Malgré toutes ces charges, il se bat et arrive à gagner des chantiers.Il est sociétaire de l'IMCEC depuis 2006 et a bénéficié de trois prêts qu’il a remboursés intégralement sans retards. Actuellement, il sollicite un quatrième prêt de 400 000FCFA pour renforcer son matériel de plomberie en achetant 09 clefs, 02 piques, 03 pelles, 06 marteaux, 07 brins et 01 moteur neuf pour sa moto. Ce matériel lui permettra d’équiper ses apprentis, de les répartir dans ses différents chantiers et de faciliter ses déplacements.
Avec les bénéfices tirés de ces investissements,l'emprunteur pourra mieux prendre en charge l’alimentation de sa famille, l’éducation de ses frères et la santé de sa maman. Il pourra aussi augmenter son épargne et  son  personnel. Son ambition est d’acheter une voiture pour élargir ses activités dans d’autres villes.
texts.en:
This borrower is a plumber who has been in this business for 7 years. He specializes in installing, maintaining and repairing potable water delivery systems, sinks and toilets. He begins work at 8am and finishes at 7pm. He is married without children, and lives with his 6 brothers and both his parents. He supports his whole family, and pays the monthly school fees for his brothers. He spends 80,000 FCFA each month for food, and frequently buys medicine for his mother, who is quite ill.
In spite of all his responsibilities, he fights in order to gain work opportunities. He is a member of UIMCEC since 2006 and has already taken out three loans which he has repaid on time. Now, he is asking for a fourth loan of 400,000 FCFA in order to buy new plumbing tools, including 9 keys, 2 spades, 3 shovels, 6 hammers, 7 blades and a new engine for his motorbike. These materials will help him equip his apprentices to send them to his different worksites, and help with their transport.
With the profits gained from his investments, the borrower will be better able to take care of the responsibilities of purchasing food for his family, educating his brothers and caring for his mother. He will also be able to increase his savings and add more employees. His ambition is to buy a car so that he can start working in other cities.

loans.use: to buy plumbing supplies and a new engine for his scooter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old.   She is married and has nine children between 2 and 21 years old. Her bananas vending business is well-organized. Esther has 6 years of experience in her business and works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekends. She currently employs four people to help her.

Esther has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas to sell.  With any profit generated, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of secondhand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Mrs. Y, 37, is a married woman who lives in Dongkor. To earn a living, she always goes to the garment factory in order to buy pieces of cloth to weave at home. Her finished products are mats and cradles and she takes them to sell at the local market. She is married and blessed with two children, both of whom are students in the local public school. Her husband is responsible and is employed as a local building worker. 

Mrs. Y will be using the loan money to purchase more cloth in order to make more woven products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth in order to make more woven products to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Annet has a business which sells firewood. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days every week. Annet sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van for easier transportation. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a bookshop in a busy market and has been in business for seven years. Maureen sells many things including textbooks, staplers, paper, and erasers. She intends to use her loan to purchase more textbooks. 

Maureen hopes to open another bookshop in Shamakhokho. She also hopes to purchase a car so she can deliver books more easily. Maureen describes herself as polite and courageous.

loans.use: to purchase more textbooks to resell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy lives in Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Dorothy has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for two years, and she works one day out of every week. Dorothy sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread. The main business challenges for Dorothy include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school. Dorothy lives in a home that she rents/owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy rolls of clothing material and thread

loans.name: Enhamgalan

texts.en: Enhamgalan is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His daughter who is three years old goes to a kindergarten. He manages a taxi service business with the help of his older brother. He feeds his family with his business earnings therefore he must work very hard. He is a polite man who says, "My wife got a new job recently. So our family living conditions are getting better day by day." He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is 50 years old and a single mother of four children aged between nine months and 24 years old. She runs a poultry and charcoal business in Kisauni, Mombasa.


Her business has been in operation for the last seven years. Carren has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit and to buy bags of charcoal for her business. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Carren’s dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en: Gerlee is 42 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who operates his own taxi service business. She manages a shoe-making business in her town with the help of her younger sister. Gerlee started her business in 2005. Her products are well-appraised by her customers. Now she has many regular customers who order several shoes at a time. With her earnings she has been able to buy a car, some furniture and appliances for her family. She is an open-minded woman who says, "One must be a good person." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her shoe-making business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with five children, three attend school while two have graduated. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati (flatbread), beans and rice. She also sells detergent and clothes, which contributes another source of income. Pamela faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergent. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergent.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver at a private company while her older daughter helps with the family business. Her second child, age 20, works at a construction company and her younger two children go to a secondary school. 

Jargal manages a clothing-trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2011. Her stall is located in a very good place, therefore her earning is quite high compared with other salespersons. She plans to have her own stall in the future, so she can save her rent payment. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to have my own working place in the future." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase a container for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a container

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married.  She has two children aged 6 and 12. She runs a snack and drinks shop where she sells cakes, soda, tea and food. Josephine employs two people and has been running this business for 18 years. She intends to use her loan to purchase more ingredients needed for baking cakes, yogurt, and equipment needed for making fresh juice. 

Josephine hopes to use the profit she makes to expand her business and to pay for her children’s education. She also dreams of being able to build residential and rental houses. Josephine describes herself as creative and innovative.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients needed for baking cakes, yogurt, and equipment needed for making fresh juice.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary, 47 year old, is a farmer.  Her husband is a driver in a factory and their income is $4.50 per day.  They have 4 children, two are studying in school and other two are working in a factory.  

Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, and $35 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a store in a market in Phnom Penh to sell groceries.  She also wants to buy a flat in Phnom Penh and send her last two children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a store in a market

loans.name: Odhuu

texts.en:
Odhuu is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  His two children, ages 9 and 18, go to a secondary school. 

He manages a furniture making business with the help of his wife in his town.  He started his business in 2003 and gained much experience.  He makes his products at his workshop place at Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar city.  Now he makes all kinds of furniture such as tables, chairs, hangers, etc.  His business is quite successful which allows him to employ two more workers.  He is a hardworking man who is planning to expand his business in the future.  He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for furniture making

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 23 years old and has been practicing mixed farming for four years.  She produces maize, beans and milk which are sold to the local market in Nyamira in South Rift Kenya. She is married and has three children between 10 and 6 years old.

Rose has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the cow will make the provision of meals for her children a possibility and the additional income can be used to meet other family needs.  She wants to save enough to venture into the transport business in the future.

Rose says that challenges for her remain the poor road network and low market prices for her products.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, rice, washing soap, paraffin and cooking oil.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, rice, washing soap, paraffin and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tumenbileg

texts.en:
Tumenbileg is 51 years old and lives with his wife and twins in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  His one son is a worker and other one is a student.  

His wife is a salesperson who has her own business.  He operates a uniform trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar city.  He started his business in 1995 and gained much experience.  Now he has 3 stalls where he sells a variety of uniforms for all ages.  He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to increase my business sales."  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to sew uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for making jars

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old, married, and has five children age 1 to 10. 

He operates a small kiosk where he sells items like mandazi (a pastry), tilly (cooking fat), bread, sugar and rice. James has been in business for five years. He intends to use his loan to purchase more rice that he intends to sell. 

James hopes to expand his business into wholesale. He also hopes to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. James describes himself as visionary.

loans.use: to purchase more rice that he intends to sell.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Mrs. Peou, 38, is a married woman and the mother of two children, both of whom are married and living independently. Her husband is Moeurn, 29, a local rice farmer and also fisherman. Mrs. Peou makes a living by selling fresh fish that she gets from her husband's fishing or from other local fishermen in and around her village, Baray district. 

From her fish-selling business, Mrs. Peou can make about US$ 2 each day.  Because some of her husband's fishing implements are broken or torn and this may affect her husband’s business activity, Mrs. Peou would like to request a loan to buy new fishing equipment, for example a boat, a motor, and nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment, for example, a boat, a motor, and nets.

loans.name: Sisto

texts.en:
Sisto is 31 years old and married to Doreen. They have two children.

He has been running his carpentry business for the last ten years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000, which he uses in the business and to take care of his family.

He has been loaned KES 40,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase more timber for sale.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business even more.

loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Khaidav

texts.en:
Khaidav is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Khaidav is a monk. He established his own small monastery in 2004 and since then, he has been providing different religious services to his clients. Also he has a few disciples who come to his teachings every day. 

Khaidav's only son is mentally ill and needs constant care. Khaidav’s wife looks after and cares for his son. She also runs a home appliance retail business at the outdoor market. 

Khaidav’s monastery was built in 2004 and it needs some renovation at the moment. The loan Khaidav is taking will be used to buy the necessary building materials and to do renovation to his monastery.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials and to do renovation to his monastery.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old and married to Henry. They are blessed with four children, 16, 13, 10 and 8 years old.

She has been operating her food business for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000 which she uses to purchase stock and take care of her family.

She has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase milk, bread and other items for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to establish a food kiosk. In the future, she hopes to establish herself in the business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread and other items for sale.

loans.name: Kouen

texts.en:
Kouen, 35 years old, raises animals to sell. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $14 a day. They have two children, one is in school and one is waiting to be in school soon. 

Every month, she has to spend around $55 for every expense in the family. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy pigs to sell. 

In the future, this couple plans to find a small farm to raise animals such as pigs, chicken and ducks. For her children, she wants them to study until they become teachers in her village.

loans.use: To buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Sokhouen

texts.en: Sokhouen, 36, a sweets seller, and her husband, a construction worker, earn a combined income of $10 per day. They have three children, none of whom  yet attend school.  Every month, Sokhouen has to spend $42 on food and $15 on transportation. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy farmland to begin a farming enterprise. In the future she wants to have a café and sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some more bags of smoked fish to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is a resident farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift, Kenya. She is married with three children, ages 9, 5 and 1 year old. She has been farming for 10 years producing and selling maize, vegetables, bananas and tea for the local market. She gets additional income from her rental houses.

Naom has obtained a loan of 46,800 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide the family with milk and additional income. She says she wants to own three quality dairy cows in five years. Naom says farming inputs have become expensive and this is the main challenge for farmers in the area. However, she thanks Juhudi Kilimo for their services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth is 42 year old. She and her husband are farmers. Their income is $6 per day. They have four children. Two are in school and one is a worker.

Every month, she has to spend about $45 on every expense in the family. 

She does not want to change her career as a farmer but wishes to extend her farmland. She wants to send her children to study in the university. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son's travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's travel to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock like cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Rumdoul

texts.en:
Rumdoul, 29 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a buyer and selling motorbike, their income is $8 per day. They have two children, 7 and 1 year old. 

Every month she has to spend around $45 on every expense in the family. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase old motorbikes which is cheap to sell in her village. She wants to buy more motorbikes to sell with her husband if she can make good profit from it and when she could save much money she wishes to extend this business and run it at her home. 

She plans to send all of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy old and cheap motorbikes to sell in her village

loans.name: Mouykea

texts.en:
Mouykea, 58 years old, is a roast chicken seller. She is a single mother with three children. One is studying and two are working. 

Without her husband, she has to support her children’s living and going to school. Even though she is alone, she has a strong commitment to take care all of her children and send them to school or to study a skill for their future. 

This family can make an income of about $9 per day. Every month, she has to spend around $45 on every expense in her family. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy chickens to roast and sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens to roast and sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Merlinda, a 41-year-old married mother of three, sells fruits and vegetables in their village and public market. In business for almost 10 years, she earns a net income per month of 5,000 PHP. Melinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to increase her revenue and to continue borrowing from ASKI to help achieve her business goals.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Rose has learned a great deal about how to effectively run a business during the past four years she has been operating her beauty salon. She says she is now at the stage where she can advise business-oriented people on how to begin and run their own businesses. While those who do not know her may question her confidence, this happily married mother of three says that her achievements have arisen frorm the courage of her convictions. The optimistic Rose says she lets negative people slide by like the water from the proverbial duck's back, a philosophy that has worked very much in her favor.

A farmer before embarking on her beauty salon enterprise, Rose also owns and operates a scrap metal sales business. Weekly, this business brings in profits amounting to Ugandan shillings 150,000. With this Kiva loan, Rose will purchase more cosmetics and other hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and other hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sokheoun

texts.en:
Sokheoun, 31 years old, is a laborer. His wife is a cook. Their income is $6 per day. They have four children. Three are studying. 

Every month, he has to spend around $45 on every expense in the family. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy construction equipment to do construction. Without equipment to do construction this family won’t be able to earn money because most people will not hire him without equipment.

After buying that equipment, he expects to earn more income to support his family, and especially to send all of his children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.fr: Anastase  est éleveur, il est Rwandais il est le client d’ACB depuis 2007,il est marie, il a 50ans, il a 2 enfants entre 15 ans et 16ans et tous vont à l’école, il a deux personne en charge. Il a 6 ans  des études secondaire c’est son sixième  cycle de prêt avec ACB.il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter  les aliments des poules et payer la main d’oeuvre.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est de rembourse le crédit à temps et utiliser la technologie pour son élevage   .ses ambitions il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des œufs et construire des maisons de location, et pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval de ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en: Anastasius is a breeder, he is from Rwanda and is a client of ACB since 2007. He is 50 years old, married, has two children, who are 15 and 16 and both are attending school. He also has two other kids in his care. He completed six years of secondary education. He is requesting his sixth loan from ACB, which he will use to purchase animal food and pay his workers. He has never had any problem in paying back his previous loans. His business growth strategy is to pay back according to schedule and use technology in his breeding business. His ambition is to become a major distributor of eggs and to build houses to rent, and for his family he wants to be able to pay for the school fees of his children and for their health care.

loans.use: to purchase animal food and pay workers

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 34 years old.  He is married and has three children between 2 and 9 years old.  He sells food such as cakes, biscuits, bread, etc. in his shop. His business is well organized.   He works from 7am to 7pm every day except Sunday. He has two years of experience in this business and currently employs one person to help him.

Victor has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more food such as cakes, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell. With any profit, Victor will reinvest in his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 34 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area. She is married and has four children age 9 to 12, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past four years she has been involved in the sale of fish. She started this business with the help of her husband. 

Annie says what she likes about this business is that it helps her to take care of her children and also she enjoys being responsible for her own business and making it work. Her main problem is the cost of transport and the time it takes to buy and collect the fish.

Annie has requested this loan to purchase more fish to sell. She wishes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a poultry selling business, selling wholesale to restaurant operators and hotel owners. She faces a major a challenge of seasonality especially disease outbreak. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Mega lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity nor to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity and food.   

Mega has a business of selling things like sugar, salt, soap and bread. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mega sells her products at the market by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling firewood.

Mega has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO that she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.    

The main business challenges for Mega include defaulters and transportation.  

Her business goal is to own a delivery van to ease in transport and also to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been in farming for over 15 years, producing and selling milk, maize, cabbages, tomatoes and tea. She also gets additional income from working as a tea harvester.  Josephine is married and has 4 children between 12 and 3 years old. All her children are in school and live with her in their home in Nyamira, South Rift Kenya.

Josephine has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help her educate her children. She is also focusing on purchasing more land and acquiring two additional dairy cows.

Josephine says crop diseases are a challenge to farmers. She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its support of farmers.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.fr: Gratien est commerçant, il est Rwandais il est le client d’ACB depuis 2010,il est marie, il a 49ans, il a 2 enfants entre 4 ans et 7 ans et tous vont à l’école, il a une seul personne en charge. Il a niveau d’étude de 6 ans de primaire c’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB.il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1200 kgs de miels pour revendre et payer la main d’oeuvre.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est améliore les services pour conquérir la marche.ses ambitions il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des miels dans des différentes alimentations dans son région, et pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval de ses enfants et assure le développement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gratien is a merchant. He is Rwandan and has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is married, 49 years old, and has two children who are four and seven years old. Both go to school. He is the only breadwinner. 

He went to primary school for six years, and this is his second loan with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy 1200 kilograms of honey for resale and pay for labor. No difficulty with repayment is expected.

His strategy for growing his business is to improve his service to win over the market. As for his ambition, he would like to become an important distributor of honey in the various grocery stores in his region, and for his family, he would like to pay school fees for his children and ensure the development of his family.

loans.use: to buy 1200 kgs of honey for resale and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
Toujours en activité dans son atelier de réparation de machines à coudre, l’emprunteur est devenu, depuis la mort de son pére , le responsable de sa  famille composée de 10 personnes. Il est marié  et a trois enfants. Toutes les dépenses de la famille (location,  nourriture, éducation, santé,  factures d’eau et d’électricité) sont à sa charge pour un montant de  225 000 par mois. La famille vit dans la promiscuité si bien que 4 personnes dorment dans une seule pièce . 
Sa journée démarre très tôt à 6h 30  et il lui arrive de travailler toute la nuit lors des grandes fêtes. Il répare des machines à coudre en panne. Il achète aussi des machines neuves ou d’occasion chez des grossistes qu’il revend en détails aux tailleurs. Il a réussi à ouvrir une petite mercerie dont il a confié la gestion à sa petite soeur.Son activité a de relles opportunités pour reussir car le marché de la couture est tres large et la demande est forte aussi bien dans sa localité qu' à l'étranger.
. C'est pourquoi, il demande un crédit de 350 000f pour augmenter ses marchandises en achetant notamment 4 machines à coudre, du fils et des garnitures.Il n' a jamais sollicite de prêts à l'IMCEC bien que sociétaire de cette institution depuis 2008.
Les bénéfices tirés de ce financement pourront lui permettre  d’augmenter  et de diversifier les produits de sa mercerie, de se lancer dans la vente de pièces détachées de machine à coudre. Il pourra également mieux supporter les charges sociales de la famille qui pèsent lourd sur lui (location, alimentation, éducation …).
Son ambition est de générer assez de revenus pour se lancer dans l’importation de matériels et de fournitures pour la couture.Il reve de construire une maison pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Always busy in his sewing machine repair workshop, the borrower became the head of his family of 10 people after the death of his father. He is married and has three children. All family expenses (rent, food, education, health, utilities) fall on his shoulders and amount to 225,000 francs a month. The family is living from hand to mouth, such that four people sleep in a single room. 

His day begins very early, at 6:30 am, and sometimes he works through the night when it is a big holiday. He repairs broken sewing machines and also buys new or used machines from wholesalers and then resells them retail to tailors. He has also managed to open a little sewing notions shop which he has  his little sister manage. His business has real opportunities to succeed since the market for tailored goods is very big and there is plenty of demand, in his own locality and elsewhere. 

This is why he is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to grow his stock of merchandise by buying in particular four sewing machines, some thread, and accessories. He has never asked for a loan from IMCEC even though he has been a member since 2008. 

The profit from this loan will allow him to add to his stock and diversify the products in his sewing notions business and get into selling spare parts for sewing machines. He will also be able to deal better with family expenses, which are quite a burden for him (rent, food, education, etc.)

His ambition is  to generate enough income to get into importing sewing materials and supplies. He dreams of building a house for his family to live in.

loans.use: tp buy sewing machines, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 28 years old.  He is married and has two children between 6 months and 4 years old.  Augustin sells goats.  He started this business 12 years ago.  He works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekends.  He currently employs two people to help him.

Augustin has requested his first loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to buy more goats to sell. With the profit generated, he will reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children. 

In the photo, Augustin is in front of the others and has a cap in his hand.

loans.use: buy goats

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 44 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married with five children between the ages of 6 to 23, and her husband is an engineer. All of the children live at home with them.

For the past six years, Kebbeh has been running a tailor shop where she  sells African fabric for children and adults. One of her major problems is the cost of transportation which is very high since she has to travel to neighboring Guinea.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more fabric for her shop, she hopes to build  another shop and build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell and pay for a market stall.

loans.name: Milda

texts.en:
Milda  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Milda   has a pub.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Milda   sells her products in a shop, retail.  

Milda has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.The main business challenges for Milda   include defaulters and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own  a fully stocked bar. Milda lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include   electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gIn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Il va acheter les matériels de construction utiliser  pour le finissage d'une maison de location

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Olivia has a business of bakery. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Olivia has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bags of baking flour, cooking oil and baking powder.  She also generates additional income through selling airtime. The main business challenges for Olivia  include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked kiosk and also to sell wholesale only. Olivia lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of baking flour, cooking oil and baking powder.

loans.name: Saint Luc Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata Pascaline est la représentante du groupe SAINT LUC. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 1an 02 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy.ses clients sont les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter un demi-ball de fils de tisse.

Mme économise ses bénéfices et met une partie dans les charges familiales. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande vendeuse de fils de tisse et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Pascaline is the representative for the Saint Luc group. She married and the mother of 4 children, ranging in age from 11 to 1. 2 of her children go to school and she is responsible for 4 people. 

She has been a weaver for 4 years. She obtains her supplies at the Pissy market, and her customers are men. 

Aminata Pascaline wants to buy a half-bale of thread for weaving. She saves her profits and uses some for household expenses. Her goal is sell a large quantity of thread for weaving and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a half-bale of thread for weaving

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is married with 3 children. She runs a small business in the central city market selling clothing. Her vending spot is well-known for having a wide variety of inventory. The assorted trendy clothing items that Mavluda offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Mavluda has been in this business for one year. Mavluda’s hard work is – plain and simple – the engine that drives her success. She is also very consistent in her business planning. She is requesting a loan of 4,800 TJS to open a new vending spot and expand her business venture. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is married with 4 children. She has been running a grocery business for 18 years. Jumagul is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She has already borrowed from IMON International and paid back her loan on time. She says that the loan helped her to generate additional income. Jumagul takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need. Jumagul would like to obtain a loan of $1,200 USD to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 51 years old. She lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with her big family, which consists of her husband, her mother-in-law, her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

Larisa has worked at the illuminating glass factory for 7 years. In the early nineties, Larisa started to engage in the agricultural business. On her farm she has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Larisa's family helps her with farming. They breed their animals and sell agricultural products to the villagers. Thanks to their occupation, Larisa and her family are able to support each other. 

This is Larisa's third loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to add to her sheep number and to buy fodder.

loans.use: to add to her sheep number and to buy fodder

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is 45 years old. She and her husband have two children. To improve her family position and help her husband with family expenses, Lola started her business 16 years ago. She bakes “lepeshka” at home, together with her son. Having plenty of customers, Lola sells the majority of her products just from her place.

 Lola is doing her best to ensure her children of the best future. Now she requests a loan of 1200 USD that she is planning to spend for the purchase of  flour required for her business, wholesale. Lola is grateful to all those supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour wholesale to bake the national bread, “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is 28 years old and has four children. She sells men's shirts and shoes at the central market. Mastona has been in this business for 17 years. Good location and a positive attitude towards customers have helped Mastona to develop her business. This business is the main source of income for her family. 

Mastona is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to expand her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit and improve her living conditions.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado porvenir se encuentra compuesto por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción. El mismo se encuentra en su primer ciclo. Al hablar con ellas se definieron como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que tienen sueños que quieren cumplir. Justamente por ello se organizaron y se formaron para la consecución de sus anhelos.
La Sra. Librada tiene 21 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad escolar, y se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo. Comenta que por sus hijos ella se sacrifica todos los días para asegurarles una vida digna y decorosa. Sueña con algún día poder armarse con un pequeño puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus mercaderías sin dejar a sus hijos.
Solicita el credito para poder comprar mas ropas que luego venderá, posee un pequeño grupo, pero le gustaría comprar las ropas de esta temporada de invierno. Tiene sus esperanzas puestas en el credito.
texts.en: The "Porvenir" group consists of 12 women from the city of Asunción, Paraguay, and is on its first loan cycle. The members defined themselves as hard-working women who fight for their dreams to come true. They organized and formed this group for this very reason, so they could reach their goals. One of the members is Librada. She is 21 years old, has two children under school age, and makes a living selling all kinds of clothing. She says that she sacrifices all of her days for her children to assure them a dignified and decent life. She dreams that one day she can have a small sales post where she can offer her merchandise without leaving her children behind. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase more clothing to then sell. She has a small supply, but she would like to buy clothing during the current winter season. Her hopes rest with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of clothing to later sell.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a single mother and has a 2-year-old daughter. She sells stones to private developers and construction workers and has been do this for the last 12 months. She also runs a salon business. Norah intends to use her loan to purchase more stock for her salon. 

Norah hopes to venture into building and construction of rental units. She describes herself as humble.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal that he plans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs that he intends to sell.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is 39 years old, married and has four children. For the last 18 years, he has earned a living making and repairing vehicle interiors. He has applied for this loan to buy more supplies and tools for his business. His goal is to use his profits to pay for his children’s education and improve their standard of living. In the future, he would like to keep expanding his business. Onesmus describes himself as hardworking, humble and friendly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a business repairing vehicle interiors.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda lives in Uganda, is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the last five years, she has supported her family by roasting and selling maize. She works seven days a week and sells her products in a shop in a local retail market. She is applying for a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fresh maize to roast. The main business challenges she faces are seasonality and transportation, and in the future she would like to go to farmers directly to buy maize and eventually grow her own. She lives in a home that she owns and has electricity but no piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are electricity and food.

loans.use: to buy fresh maize to roast.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is married and has 4 children, ages 7 to 20. He is very skilled at automobile repairs and runs a business that rebuilds car bodies, does fabrication, and repairs car chassis. He has been running this business for 21 years and it is located in an industrial area. The main struggle is not having enough small tools to help him effectively do his job. Bernard intends to use his loan to buy a grinder and a drill. 

Bernard hopes to use the profits from his business to get more education. In the future, he would like to own his own a motor vehicle business. Bernard describes himself as zealous.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and a drill

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Virgen del Rosario cuenta con 17 mujeres que trabajan de forma coordinada y organizada. Todas ellas se esfuerzan al máximo para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y familiares que de ellas dependen. Ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que no temen al trabajo y que todo lo que hacen es para que sus hijos no pasen por aquellas carencias por las que ellas tuvieron que atravesar en su momento.
La Sra. Enma se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, es decir, todo tipo de verduras. Ella manifiesta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana a buscar los productos frescos para salir a venderlos. Cada día que sale, lo hace con el deseo de traer mas ingresos a su familia.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas hortalizas, tales como lechugas tomates, repollos y demás, por que sabe que teniendo mas tipo de verduras podrá atraer a mas clientes, sumados a los que ya tiene.
Ella tiene el sueño de algún día poder armar armar en su casa un pequeño puesto donde vender sus mercaderías.
texts.en: The Virgen del Rosario group consists of 17 women who work together in a coordinated and organized way. All the women put in the maximum effort in order to be able to make headway for the children and family that depend on them. The members defined themselves as heads of the family who are not afraid to work and are willing to do whatever it takes so their children don't suffer the same hardships they have had to endure. One of the members is Enma, who makes a living selling all kinds of vegetables. She says that she gets up very early every day to look for fresh products that she can later sell. She does this every day with the desire to bring in more income for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more vegetables, such as lettuce, tomatoes, cabbage and others, because she knows that having more kinds of vegetables will attract even more customers than she already has. Her dream is to one day set up a small post in her home where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes and others.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 3 to 17. He has been repairing motor vehicle engines for the last 15 years. He services both public service vehicles and other commercial vehicles. Moses intends to use this loan to buy more tools for his business. By purchasing four different sizes of spanners, he believes he will be more effective at this work. 

Moses hopes to use the profits from his business to pay for his children’s education. He also hopes to become a large-scale farmer one day. Moses describes himself as hardworking, friendly, and honest.

loans.use: to buy more tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and a food-vending business

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a farmer in Nyamira, South Rift Kenya. He has been farming for the last 2 years.  His farm produces tomatoes, maize and cabbages, which are all sold locally. He is married and has one child, aged 3 years.  On his farm, he is helped by two farmhands. Fred also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Fred has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income generated to educate his children, buy more land, and open other businesses to support his farming efforts. He is very optimistic that his business will grow.

Like other farmers, Fred too complains about limited financial resources and lack of farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Regan

texts.en: Regan is 37 years old, married, and has three children who range in age from three to seven. For the last 18 years, he has earned a living by running a vehicle-painting business and now has three employees. He also runs a farm where he grows maize, beans, and sugar cane. He is applying for this loan to buy more seeds for his farm. His goal is to use the profits from this business to educate his children and improve their standard of living. In the future, he hopes to expand his painting business and his farm. Regan describes himself as hardworking, humble and friendly.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en Accion se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Capiatá, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Esmeralda, contactó con personas allegadas al programa de mujeres emprendedoras y se informó de la forma de organización del mismo. Después de esto formó y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio para formar su comité. Logró reunir a 19 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el quinto ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria. Ellas se conceptúan como mujeres muy emprendedoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas como ser sandwiches, empanadas, tortillas y otros tipos de comestibles. Se dedica a esto hace ya mucho tiempo por lo que tiene ya un grupo de clientes bien definido. Sueña con un día poder tener un establecimiento propio donde ofrecer sus alimentos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos que ella vende. Piensa que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: The Mujeres En Accion (Women In Action) group consists of an excellent group of women from the city of Capiatá, Paraguay. This is thanks to the work of current general director Esmeralda, who contacted people associated with the women's entrepreneur program and was informed about the organization. After this, she organized her friends and neighbors to form the group. She was able to unite 19 women who work with a lot of passion and are already in their fifth loan cycle jointly and with solidarity. They think of themselves as hard-working women willing to fight for what they want. One of the members is Silvia, who makes a living making and selling food such as sandwiches, empanadas, tortillas and other items. She has done this for a very long time, so she has a solid customer base. Her dream is to one day be able to have her own establishment where she can offer her meals. She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients she needs to make the food she sells. She thinks that the loan will be a big help so she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as meat, eggs, spices and others, to make meals.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been engaged in farming--rearing livestock and cultivating crops--for the last five years. He is a hardworking 26-year-old businessman who supplements his earnings by the salary he gets from being employed as a driver. He is married and blessed with two children aged four years, one month and two years. 

He wants to be the main supplier of milk in his local community in the next five years. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for enabling him to purchase a cow. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow
